title: Amazon ECommerce Data Analyst
description:
Role

At Canopy, the Amazon Data Analyst reviews, assesses, and creates presentations from the data of Amazon brands taking into consideration implementation of new services, strategies, & desired growth rates. This position is client facing, and strong verbal communication skills are necessary...

Responsibilities
• Pull data & reports from Amazon Accounts that are relevant to the analyses being performed or the area of performance that is being investigated.
• Perform the necessary data reduction and visualization techniques that are required to complete the analysis and generate clear analysis results.
• Take detailed analysis notes to facilitate the transfer of findings to other parties, including members of the sales organization, service providers or management.
• Become familiar with the data tracking tools that the Ad Specialist and Partner Success Management Teams use to manage Canopy Partner Accounts for the purpose of analysis assignments for existing Canopy Partners.
• Using third party tools like Jungle Scout and Helium 10, perform Market and Competitive analysis for specific product niches on Amazon.
• Create slides of analysis results in presentations for prospective Canopy partners or existing Canopy partners.

Results
• Complete analysis assignments within 2 business days, or faster, as needed.
• Fully document the processes and procedures for an account review.
• Create and deliver high quality presentation content.
• Able to find numerically and articulate verbally areas of opportunity such as wasted spend, low ad type utilization, poor conversion rates, product opportunities, etc.

Requirements
• Advanced proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, lookup functions, charts & data visualization, etc). Proficiency with VBA, Power Query and Macros are a plus, but not required.
• Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills to translate ambiguous business requirements into complex analyses.
• Analytical with business and technical acumen.
• In-depth industry experience with Amazon Selling.
• Proven analytical and quantitative skills, and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and generate actionable insights.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Paid time off
• Parental leave
• Vision insurance

Compensation package:
• Bonus pay
• Commission pay

Experience level:
• 5 years

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Experience:
• Amazon: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Technical Data Analyst (SQL Exp.)
description:
Position: Technical Data Analyst (SQL Exp.)
Location: Frankfort, KY (Remote)
Duration: Long-term Indefinite Contract...
Mode Of interview: Video Interview (MS Teams)

Job Description
Cabinet Office of Information Technology (OIT), Enterprise Data Services Branch (EDSB) has an immediate opening for an IT Technical Data Analyst (TDA) in Frankfort, Kentucky, with at least 5 years of experience. This position is currently remote. The ideal candidate should be a team player that can thrive in a fast-paced environment, be flexible and adaptable to changing needs/opportunities, comfortable with Agile environment, possess critical thinking skills, be an effective communicator, who is self-motivated. In addition, the candidate should be committed to delivering successful products that address the business and data requirements.

POSITION OVERVIEW
• The IT TDA will have at least 5 years of experience working in an Agile Project environment understanding all aspects of a Project Life Cycle and will provide support for projects and maintenance work with the highway information network and vehicle regulation data. The IT TDA will become familiar with existing data systems, the business they support, and the role each play as part of the overall Transportation Cabinet’s mission.
• The IT TDA will be Data Lead (DL) for multiple projects in EDSB.
• The IT TDA will work with EDSB, other branches within OIT, and the business areas of CABINET to coordinate and analyze enterprise-wide data requirements. They will be familiar with existing data integrations and reporting environments and assist with continued development of a comprehensive, sustainable data warehouse to facilitate integration, and support highway and vehicle regulation applications. The IT TDA will be skilled with tabular and spatial database analysis tools.
• The IT TDA will be able to provide high-level, as well as, detailed, data analysis, for multiple projects and create Data Discovery Documents that document and outline EDSB’s role and impact on projects. The IT TDA will maintain User Stories and Tasks in Microsoft’s Team Foundation Server (TFS) for EDSB Technical Resources for each project. The IT TDA will also serve as the technical liaison between the Project Manager (PM), Business Analyst (BA) and EDSB Technical Resource(s). The IT TDA will attend all project meetings and communicate with the Branch Manager and EDSB Technical Resource(s) on an ongoing basis on all aspects of the project. The IT TDA will be involved in all facets of the Project Life Cycle from Initiating to Deployment/Direct Support. The IT TDA will be responsible for ensuring all EDSB documentation is completed and stored in the correct locations in EDSB Teams folders and in TFS.
• Data analysis and data validation are critical to this position and the IT TDA is expected to write and read SQL code to assist in analysis and validation of data. The IT TDA is expected to learn/understand CABINET business processes and applications to identify possible improvements in data integrations, the data warehouse and reporting environments. The IT TDA will work within a defined Project Life Cycle in an Agile Framework on project efforts. They will have a thorough understanding of the workflow of EDSB and how it pertains to the OIT Project Life Cycle.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Acquire a sound understanding of CABINET business areas, their application data, and the interdependencies within the CABINET enterprise to perform duties as DL for multiple projects.
• Provide high-level and/or detailed data analysis for multiple projects by using SQL to query data and perform analysis on SQL server databases and Oracle databases from current and legacy systems.
• Demonstrate the following Leadership Skills while exercising independent judgment with minimal direction from management: Oversee and be accountable for the successful completion of all aspects of assigned EDSB project work, monitor progress, provide respectful feedback, escalate where necessary, and analyze/identify areas of risk and develops plans to minimize.
• Effectively facilitate meetings, demonstrate brainstorming/consensus building skills, and interact with all levels of project teams.
• Define and estimate tasks necessary to accomplish assigned goals with the CABINET OIT defined Project Life Cycle Process and be able to use and support TFS by creating user stories and tasks for projects.
• Oversee the completion and correctness of all EDSB project documentation, including the Data -Discovery Document - outlining EDSB’s role and impact on projects. Recommend changes to documentation for EDSB work.
• Handle confidential information responsibly and support data integrity.
• Be flexible and adaptable to changing needs/opportunities, with ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
• Ability to travel to on-site location if required.

SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
• Bachelor’s Degree and 5+ years of work experience in IT working with SQL, data analysis, technical documentation, and team leadership.
• Experience and ability writing/reading/understanding/analyzing SQL to query SQL Server and Oracle Databases to analyze and troubleshoot data issues.
• Detail-oriented team player with robust interpersonal and leadership skills who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment with the ability to quickly assimilate and apply new concepts, business models, and technologies.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills in English, serving as liaison between technical and functional staff.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to negotiate and resolve conflicts with other team members.
• Strong time management skills with the ability to understand and set priorities, set realistic deadlines, and organize work to meet deadlines by defining and estimating tasks.
• Strong facilitation skills including being prepared, setting guidelines, being flexible, and active listening.
• Proficient with Microsoft Office 365 Excel, Word, and Outlook with skills in PowerPoint and Access a plus.
• Experience writing professional quality business and technical documentation.
• Experience developing ETLS/Universes/Reports a plus.
• Experience writing/reading/understanding various programming languages a plus.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $48.00 - $53.00 per hour

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• Health insurance
• Paid holidays
• Paid time off
• Work from home

Compensation package:
• Hourly pay
• Weekly pay

Experience level:
• 10 years
• 11+ years
• 9 years

Schedule:
• Day shift
• Monday to Friday
• No nights
• No weekends

Experience:
• Reporting: 3 years (Required)
• Microsoft Office: 10 years (Required)
• Data Analyst: 9 years (Required)
• Microsoft SQL Server: 9 years (Required)
• Oracle: 7 years (Required)
• Data Analysis: 8 years (Required)
• Software troubleshooting: 9 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Business Data Analyst
description:
\*\*Remote OK, but MUST be able to work PST hours\*\*

Overview...
Are you excited to analyze large datasets and help business owners make data driven decisions? Are you excited to design and develop automated reports using industry leading tools like Tableau? At New American Funding we know the importance of utilizing quantitate insights and actionable reports to drive our business; and we are looking for a highly talented Business Data Analyst to join our BI and Analytics team and help us become a more data driven company.
Comp- up to $120k

Responsibilities:
• Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive stakeholder engagement
• Proficient with advance tableau concepts like LOD’s, table calculations, custom visualizations, complex time series analysis, performance tuning and follow visual best practices.
• Strong in implementing what-if, if else, KPI’s, gap analysis, behavioral analysis, exploratory analysis, regression, and sentimental analysis.
• Strong SQL skills in analyzing, implementing/writing complex SQL scripts for designing critical data sets, trace data quality issues and should be proficient in data cleansing.
• Strong with SQL joins, store procedures, unions, views, and custom calculations.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and attention to details
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related field
• Strong desire to learn the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc.
• Possess the ability to identify, analyze and resolve problems logically and systematically
• Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to present complex information in an easy-to-understand manner with clear recommendations based on data insight
• Can function collaboratively as part of a fast-paced, customer-oriented team, perform effectively and demonstrated willingness to support the team on all levels to get the job done
• Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast-paced environment
• Other duties may be assigned.

Qualifications:
• Experience independently designing and implementing solutions to complex problems.
• Have attention to detail to ensure the highest level of quality/rigor in solutions.
• Proficiency with MS Office Suite.
• Must be a team player
• Must have clear and effective communication
• Strong SQL experience including stored procedures, complex joins (from one or more servers, with nested sub-queries), creation of views, database scripting and performance tuning.
• Experience with data modelling, data preparation (from one more or sources) and data cleansing of large data sets before data visualization, so most important information and takeaways are easy to convert into graph or chart.
• Strong experience in Visualization tools like Tableau/Power BI to create clean, visually compelling charts that will help understand discoveries and empower others to use data to make key decisions.
• Proficient with advanced tableau concepts like LOD’s, table calculations, custom visualizations, complex time series analysis, performance tuning, and following visual best practices.
• Extensive data exploration, research, gap & behavioral analysis for information or possible solution/finding patterns.
• Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analysis, dashboards, etc. to drive stakeholder engagement.
• Attention to details that involves reading/accessing intricate coding or technical structure.
• Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast-paced environment
• Can function collaboratively as part of a fast-paced, customer-oriented team, perform effectively, and demonstrate a willingness to support the team on all levels to get the job done and work with minimal supervision.
• Understanding of the mortgage industry including the life cycle of a loan is a plus

Desired Education/Experience:
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related field.
• Must have experience working with a data visualization tool Tableau, Power BI or equivalent, SSRS, SSIS.
• 5-7 years of experience as a Business Data Analyst, Data Engineer or equivalent
• Relevant experience as a business analyst, data analyst or related role is a plus.
• Must have working knowledge of SQL and creating complex queries.
• Tableau certified professionals are preferred/add on.
• Experience with Snowflake

\*Other Duties:\* This job may require frequent sitting or standing for long periods of time. This job profile is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job duties and responsibilities, as one may perform additional related duties as assigned in order to meet the needs of the organization.Work Authorization: Must be able to verify identity and employment eligibility to work in the U.S.[EOE/M/F/D/V. Drug-free workplace.]Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be able to lift up to ten pounds. Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting; to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time; to occasionally stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, reach, and twist; to lift, carry, push, and/or pull light to moderate amounts of weight; to operate office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement and fine coordination including use of a keyboard; and to verbally communicate to exchange information. VISION: See in the normal visual range with or without correction. HEARING: Hear in the normal audio range with or without correction.#LI-AM1#LI-Remote

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Paid holidays
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Experience level:
• 5 years

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday

Experience:
• snowflake: 3 years (Required)
• Tableau: 3 years (Required)
• Power BI: 3 years (Required)
• SQL: 5 years (Required)
• mortgage: 2 years (Required)
• Data analysis: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Description:

DETAILS...

We are looking for a data analytics associate to lead the creation of data insights through Walmart Luminate and other data sources who will harness insights to identify opportunities and drive the Walmart eCommerce business performance. This will be achieved through an operational understanding of how to manipulate, create, and excavate insights and reporting from these data sources, give guidance to Data Architects and Engineers on how these measures and fields of data should be ingested into the Unilever data lake, and then deliver these insights through masterful storytelling of the Walmart ecommerce performance through a strong commercial understanding of these data insights back to the organization. This person should be an expert in data manipulation and visual data presentation and storytelling and be well versed in MS Office and BI tools such as Excel (pivot tables), Powerpoint, Tableau, Power BI, Domo, and/or SSAS, etc . This person would work directly with the Advanced Analytics and Automation Team (Data Engineers) to give direction on how to ingest this data into PowerBI while becoming an expert of how to extract and excavate information directly from Walmart Luminate by working directly in the WM Luminate database and attending trainings by the Walmart Luminate consultants and working with internal Walmart business managers on the needs of the business from a data standpoint.

PRIORITY SKILLS:
• Data ELT (Extract Load Transform)
• Data Analysis with Business Context
• Stakeholder Management
• Strong Communication and Storytelling
• Cross-functional Project Management

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
• Bachelor's degree required; Master’s degree preferred
• 5+ years’ experience in CPG or Retail industry, including roles in data analytics, insights, or eCommerce analytics, sales, category management.
• Working knowledge of eCommerce retail basics, traffic and conversion drivers, search, the consumer’s path to purchase journey, and pureplay customer models
• Must be a strategic thinker that can balance data and insights with trends and big picture thinking.
• Must demonstrate ability to leverage future trends and market insights and think creatively when building business plans and influencing the customer.
• Prior eCommerce or omni-channel experience preferred
• Must be able to provide clear leadership to a broad cross-functional business team to execute against business strategies.
• Strong track record of collaborating and influencing a wide variety of stakeholders, internal and external.
• You are a self-starter: You love working with ambiguity, developing new solutions and influencing change with a strong bias for action

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $55.00 - $60.00 per hour

Experience level:
• 10 years

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Experience:
• Data Analyst: 10 years (Required)
• Powerpoint: 9 years (Required)
• Tableau: 8 years (Required)
• Power BI: 7 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: SAP Finance Data Analyst
description:
We deliver innovative solutions not IT.

Madiba creates the opportunity through innovative solutions for businesses to deliver new value. As a certified SAP Partner, Madiba is at the forefront of SAP’s latest technology roadmap to transform and simplify complex business processes. By developing best practice solutions in our dedicated Innovation Center, we create an immediate value proposition... for our clients, reduce delivery time, and increase adoption with proven solutions.

We are an agile organization.

As the larger firms in our industry, we offer a structured methodology, pre-packaged solutions, and a global presence, but we operate as a lean organization with lower administrative burden and bureaucracy. This agility allows our consultants to flex with changing client requirements and take a more personal approach to project delivery. By balancing this individuality with a full spectrum of packaged solutions, we remain a cost-effective and long-term partner to our clients.

We have the right experience.

As a trusted advisor, we have built long-lasting relationships with our clients based on our ability to deliver our commitments on time and on budget. With over two decades of experience delivering projects and a staff of highly experienced consultants, we provide effective transformations in the organizations we serve in both process and technology. The average tenure of our consultants exceeds 15 years in the management consulting industry allowing them to provide expertise in designing optimal business processes and deploying the latest SAP S/4 and HANA technology solutions in Finance, Logistics, Business Intelligence and Enterprise Management.

SAP Finance Data Analyst

Position Type: Contract (9+ Months)

Location: Remote​ (Ability to be onsite in NJ or PA for key phases of the project < 25% - Must work EST hours)

U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.

The Role:

Madiba has an immediate need for an SAP Finance Data Analyst that will be responsible for providing support to the business Finance organization related to the Master Data solution for a S/4HANA implementation.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• SAP Finance Analyst experience in the following:

o Experienced with S/4HANA Finance Master Data in general

o Experienced with Data Migrations into S/4HANA (Not the technical aspect of developing data load programs, etc. but the functional knowledge of what is required for conversion, solid experience in data reconciliations into S/4HANA system)
• Key SAP Areas of Focus

o Internal Order conversion

o Identify active orders based on status and activity

o Validate source and target values, including attribute field mapping

o Initial Inventory conversion for both IM and EWM

o Calculation of Inventory Value based on material standard price

o Reconciliation of inventory values to GL Inventory Accounts
• Coordinate with business owners for functional validation and testing approvals, liaise across IT teams supporting data and configuration needs
• Proficient with detailed data analysis/reconciliation (Excel), ECC and S/4 HANA tables MM(IM/EWM) and CO(IO) standard transactions/reports

Minimum Qualifications:
• 8+ years of experience as an SAP Finance Master Data Analyst
• Bachelor's degree in Finance and Accounting or Computer Science preferred
• SAP MM experience is highly desired but not required
• Ability to work US Eastern Time Zone (remotely)
• Excellent communication skills, proficiency in being able to communicate (written and oral) with Finance leads within the Client organization
• Expert Excel skills required
• Big 6 Management Consulting experience is a plus

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $130.00 - $145.00 per hour

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Data Analyst
description:
If you are motivated by a fast growing company where you can really make an impact, enjoy the fully-remote, small-company lifestyle, and are comfortable with the rewards and challenges of working with a diverse array of business, technical, and analytical problems, then we would love to work with you!

The Role...

OB Media is seeking a quantitative-minded professional to work in our online advertising business. If you are motivated by solving complex, multivariate problems, enjoy the small-company lifestyle, and are comfortable with the rewards and challenges of working with a diverse array of business, technical, and analytical problems, then please read on.

About the job:

Internet advertising is a marketplace. As with all marketplaces, the inefficiencies provide opportunities for arbitrage, which is our business. The Data Analyst will join a team of media buyers, technologists, account managers, and strategists, to provide a strong statistical backstop to our efforts to grow and scale our business. As Analysts mature, they are welcomed to provide insights on external business efforts, and to help us identify and test new opportunities.

Here are some examples of what Analysts may expect to have accomplished after their first year:
• Gained a comprehensive understanding of our often complex business environment, learning the Google and Microsoft marketplaces, and the skills needed to interrogate related data.
• Established repeatable testing protocols for advertising optimization, using standard techniques such as A/B and multivariate testing, constructed in such a way that they can be used by non-quantitative personnel without loss of statistical rigor.
• Contributed to the development of manual processes and automated systems, by helping design insightful statistical analyses, or predictive / prescriptive machine-learning algorithms to better solve multi-armed bandit and knapsack-style problems.
• Helped ongoing company efforts to manage our massive, often noisy, and continuously changing, data streams.

We give team members a fair degree of autonomy in accomplishing these goals. A Data Analyst might choose to research and implement a pre-existing A/B testing solution, or they might exercise their programmer brain by building a customized solution using Databricks Notebooks (Jupyter Notebooks integrated with Spark). As a small company of fairly autonomous operators, we are happy to provide the tools needed to get the job done right.

We are not fond of the tyranny of bulleted skills lists, but here are a few that would help candidates succeed:
• A degree in a STEM discipline, or a good number of related classes
• Ae'd also accept the self-taught who show strong contributions to open source projects and/or kaggle competitions
• Experience using SQL to interface with database
• Some basic understanding of internet technology
• Preference will be given to candidates with strong coding skills (Python, R, Spark, Stata, etc)

Benefits
• 100% Employer Paid Health, Dental and Vision coverage for Employees
• 401(k) at a 4% match
• 4 Weeks PTO
• Performance based bonuses

About OBMedia

We are a small, profitable company that has been working remotely long before it became trendy. Growing from a startup in 2001 to one of the most trusted and established Ad Networks in the industry, we partner with some of the biggest names in tech to connect publishers, relevant advertisers and diverse audiences.

OBMedia is a subsidiary of the Enero Group, a publicly-held, international network of marketing and communications firms listed on the Australian Stock Exchange.

The Team

We are a growing, fully remote, team of media buyers, analysts, engineers, and strategic thinkers that enjoy the autonomy and innovation of a startup environment while enjoying the stability provided under a larger corporate umbrella. Located around the world, we are united in our passion to continually learn, grow, and build. We have been doing this successfully since 2001, and we’re pretty good at it. We are always looking for people who help us be better.

Internet advertising is a complex and fast paced marketplace and we compete in many areas of it while constantly exploring new opportunities. Doing so successfully requires a dedicated team, working together to find, and take advantage of, those opportunities. We’ve been doing this successfully since 2001, and we’re pretty good at it. We are looking for people who help us be better.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• 401(k) 4% Match
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Compensation package:
• Yearly pay

Experience level:
• 2 years

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday

Experience:
• SQL: 1 year (Required)
• Python: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Data Analyst: Marketing Analytics
description:
PROC9 is a small team of experience engineers with solid midwestern values. Based near Milwaukee, WI, we help national clients dig into the “why” of their biggest business challenges through research and in-depth data analysis. Our mission is to build better human experiences through evidence-based insights. Solutions we deliver include: Data Science and Analytics Services, UX/UI Research ... Portal Design, Marketing Analytics and Reporting, Dashboard Development, and Custom Software Development. To learn more, check out our website.

Role Description

PROC9 is looking for a Data Analyst with marketing experience. This is a contract to hire role on a project basis. This role is remote with occasional, in-person team meetings. This role requires proficiency to execute internal and client-facing projects. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Building and maintaining dashboards and other reporting solutions for clients
• Playing a key role in providing clients with detailed data analysis on marketing, operations, and other business related performance
• Collecting, cleaning, and manipulating datasets in preparation for analysis and reporting efforts
• Summarizing key findings and implications of analysis
• Working with and supporting other technical team members
• Communicating processes and findings to stakeholders

Minimum Requirements & Qualifications

A successful candidate’s skills will align with the following characteristics:

Experience
• Fluency in statistics, data analysis, and data visualization
• Examples of proven execution of data analysis and building dashboards
• Experience building dashboards utilizing programs such as Power BI or Tableau
• Experience writing/troubleshoot custom DAX calculations

Preferred
• 1-3 years in a data analytics role
• Experience designing, testing, and evaluating marketing and sales campaigns and strategies
• Experience building statistical methods
• Experience using programming languages such as R or Python to import, clean, and analyze data
• Demonstrated ability to communicate analyses with data-minded and non-technical individuals

Additionally, we are seeking someone who is:
• Self-starting and can work autonomously in a larger, remote team
• Organized and detail-oriented
• Displays strong collaboration, communication, and follow-through skills
• Committed to following best practices
• Creative and innovative in creating custom analytic solutions for clients
• Enthusiastic about curating clean, meaningful data visualizations
• Able to learn quickly and take on new responsibilities as priorities change

Hours: 15-25hrs per week

Rate: Experience based, starting at $30/hour

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $30.00 - $50.00 per hour

Benefits:
• Flexible schedule

Experience:
• Data analysis skills: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Pricing Data Analyst - Revenue Management
description:
What Data Analytics brings to Cardinal Health

The Data & Analytics Function oversees the analytics lifecycle in order to identify, analyze and present relevant insights that drive business decisions and anticipate opportunities to achieve a competitive advantage. This function manages analytic data platforms, the access, design and implementation of reporting/business intelligence solutions, and... the application of advanced quantitative modeling to support the execution of market strategy and profitability optimization through pricing and value-capture activities using modeling, analytics, and econometrics to create pricing strategies for our products and services.

Data Analytics applies business process knowledge and data analytics to develop, recommend and communicate timely, accurate, relevant, and actionable insights to support business decisions and objectives.
• Uses knowledge of business and data to discover and/or anticipate problems or opportunities where data can be leveraged to address the need.
• Asks probing questions to translate business needs to build and design reporting solutions.
• Applies data visualization, descriptive and summary statistical techniques for discovery and timely insights (data exploration, ad-hoc queries, and analysis).
• Interprets results of analyses, identifies trends and issues (forecasting), and develops solutions to support business objectives.
• Applies data aggregation, descriptive analysis and data presentation techniques and tools to communicate complex findings and recommendations to influence others to take action.
• Demonstrates ability to communicate complex information clearly and concisely to a variety of audiences through a variety of mediums.

Responsibilities
• Works on projects (multiweek) and ad hoc requests (< 10 hours to completion) that help drive Medical Segment profitability
• Produces business-relevant deliverables on time and with high accuracy
• Acts as consultant and product manager to develop, deliver and maintain analytic solutions
• Tracks work in progress and effectively manages time to accommodate evolving business priorities
• Communicates effectively across all levels of the organization
• Develops relationships and becomes a trusted analytic partner
• Self-starter who drives results with some level of guidance

Qualifications
• 4-8 years experience preferred
• BA, BS or equivalent experience in related field preferred
• Experience with relational databases (SQL Server knowledge preferred)
• Experience with data exploration and mining tools (Alteryx experience preferred)
• Experience with data visualization and using visual design principles to best communicate information (Tableau experience preferred)
• Strong presentation skills preferred
• Experience translating vague requests into concrete deliverables
• Experience with complex data environments and leveraging disparate data sources, including 3rd party data

What is expected of you and others at this level
• Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
• May contribute to the development of policies and procedures
• Works on complex projects of large scope
• Develops technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives
• Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects
• Work reviewed for purpose of meeting objectives
• May act as a mentor to less experienced colleagues

Anticipated Salary: $75,200 - $107,400 Annual

Bonus eligible: No

Benefits: Health insurance, 401k Contributions, Paid Time Off, Vacation, STD/LTD

#LI-Remote

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Point32Health is currently seeking highly motivated individuals to join their Corporate Data and Analytics department in the role of Senior Data Analyst. A key role in the Corporate Data and Analytics department, the Senior Data Analyst will use advanced analytic tools and processes to unlock the value of data and deliver insight on business performance. Strong relationship building skills... combined with a strategic focus, enable the Senior Data Analyst to prioritize and address customer needs while keeping enterprise priorities at the forefront of their thought process and approach. The Senior Data Analyst is a strategic business consultant who can analyze data and deliver meaningful and actionable results that identify areas of success and opportunity, propose business solutions, and inform strategic decision making.

Key Responsibilities/Duties – what you will be doing
• Apply a strategic mindset and broad subject matter expertise to solve complex and diverse business problems within and across business functions
• Establish strong business relationships and be regarded as a strategic business partner
• Apply advanced analytics methods and techniques, including multi-variate statistical analysis, to deliver insights that support key business objectives
• Use strong data visualization and data storytelling skills to engage stakeholders and drive strategic decision making
• Accountable for business adoption of analytics, making sure that they are operationalized and including embedded in business processes
• Partner with IT to deliver production level analytical solutions using both Waterfall and Agile development methodologies
• Function in the role of analytics steward, providing support to other analysts to enable their use of the data to deliver accurate and timely insights
• Exemplify the characteristics of a lifelong learner, consistently seeking additional training and build knowledge/experience of business acumen, tools, languages and data sources
• Act as a Lean Thinker, applying continuous improvement philosophies and approaches to identify and address inefficiencies in your day-to-day work
• Train, mentor and guide associate level team members, both informally and formally as a dedicated “analytic buddy”
• Meets assigned timelines and escalates risks/barriers as needed
• Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications – what you need to perform the job
• Bachelor’s degree in an analytics related field with 5-7 experience, preferably in a payer/provider role with health insurance claims data experience. Master’s degree preferred
• Passion for data and problem-solving
• Complex analytics experience, including advanced analytics and statistical analysis
• Intermediate/Advanced programming skills (e.g. SAS, SQL, R, Python)
• Intermediate/Advanced Tableau or similar data visualization tool development experience
• Expert data visualization and data storytelling skills
• Experience Agile and Waterfall development methodologies
• Ability to manage tasks independently, take ownership of responsibilities and meet deadlines
• Strong written and oral communication skills

#LI-hybrid

#LI-KR1

Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Point32Health is committed to making diversity, equity, and inclusion part of everything we do—from product design to the workforce driving that innovation. Our DEI strategy is deeply connected to our core values and will evolve as the changing nature of work shifts. Programming, events, and an inclusion infrastructure play a role in how we spread cultural awareness, train people leaders on engaging with their teams and provide parameters on how to recruit and retain talented and dynamic talent. We welcome all applicants and qualified individuals, who will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

COVID Policy

Please note: As of January 18, 2022, all employees — including remote employees — must be fully vaccinated. This position will require the successful candidate to show proof of full vaccination against COVID-19. Point32Health is an equal opportunity employer, and will consider reasonable accommodation to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated consistent with federal, state, and local law.

About the Company

Point32Health is a leading health and wellbeing organization, delivering an ever-better personalized health care experience to everyone in our communities. At Point32Health, we are building on the quality, nonprofit heritage of our founding organizations, Tufts Health Plan and Harvard Pilgrim Health Care, where we leverage our experience and expertise to help people find their version of healthier living through a broad range of health plans and tools that make navigating health and wellbeing easier.

We enjoy the important work we do every day in service to our members, partners, colleagues and communities.

This job has been posted by TalentBoost on behalf of Point32Health. TalentBoost is committed to the fundamental principle of equal opportunity and equal treatment for every prospective and current employee. It is the policy of TalentBoost not to discriminate based on race, color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, age, religion, creed, disability, sex and gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local law.

title: Data Analyst 1, Workforce Management - Remote
description:
Job Description

At Nordstrom, we strive for excellence in workforce strategies, planning processes, and analytics that help our business and HR leaders optimize our workforce. This role will partner with diverse organizations across Nordstrom to develop strategies and workforce plans that inform business decisions by having the people needed in the right place, with the right skills, at the... right time. This individual’s ability to collaborate within HR and across internal functional groups using data driven decision making is critical to success in the role.

A day in the life…

Partner with key stakeholders within the Workforce Management team and cross-functionally within HR, finance and IT on KPI and data delivery/visualization needs.

Participate in various workstreams to provide a foundation in advanced application of data intelligence, processes and tools

Extract relevant data from source databases to outline key trends around demand planning, staffing, and scheduling

Utilize data visualization to bring data to life and tell a compelling story built around actionable insights and support the communication of solutions to stakeholders

Evolve the data analytics and reporting function by automating many of the time intensive (but largely static) data pulls and dashboards/visualizations already being performed today

Maintain self-service reporting and scenario planning tools to place the intelligence in store operations’ hands

You own this if you have…

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, Engineering Tech, or other “STEM” field

1+ years’ experience performing relevant work, especially in reporting, analytics, big data query, data visualization, or core workforce management principles

Knowledge and/or past application of forecasting evaluation, including deviation/error analysis, statistical controls, and time-series comparisons

Data mining skills, including ability to select and join disparate, complex data sets

Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (ideally Tableau or PowerBI), including the ability to develop dashboards from scratch

General understanding of Human Resources systems and employee data architecture, with a preference to BlueYonder or Workday

Strong proficiency in MS Excel

Good interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

Ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners

Nordstrom is able tooffer remote employment of this position in all US states except AR, MS, MT, NE, NH, ND, SD, VT, WV, and WY.

We’ve got you covered…

Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:

Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away

Life Insurance and Disability

Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources

A few more important points...

The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.

Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.

© 2022 Nordstrom, Inc

Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.

Pay Range Details

The pay range(s) below are provided in compliance with state specific laws. Pay ranges may be different in other locations.

California: $66,000 - $121,000 annually, Colorado: $66,000 - $105,000 annually, Nevada: $66,000 - $105,000 annually, New York: $66,000 - $121,000 annually, Rhode Island: $66,000 - $105,000 annually, Washington: $66,000 - $121,000 annually

title: Data Analyst
description:
UpSellit builds personalized e-commerce marketing experiences for thousands of the web's biggest brands. As part of the data team, you will be assisting our marketing, sales, AP, and AR teams by working with a range of data sets to analyze sales trends, create projections, and research discrepancies.

To say you're good with numbers would be an understatement. You can identify trends and... patterns. Help with diagnosing issues, and propose solutions that can be implemented across the department. We have a fast-growing client base and we need someone to help ensure that our customers are getting the best possible return on investment and nothing is slipping through the cracks.

You'll be given the opportunity to let your talents shine as you work directly with our Data Analytics Manager to work with client data across several platforms to update existing reports, create new reports and complete ad hoc requests.

Day-to-day tasks will include retrieving data from sources, combining data using python, reviewing data in Sheets/Excel and creating reports of findings for sales reps and management.

All applicants without personalized cover letters or a completed excel assessment test will be automatically rejected.

What you will need:
• We value intelligence and ambition over experience.
• BA/BS in business analytics, data science, statistics, economics, or a related major is preferred.
• If you don't know how to do something, you’re not above researching it.
• Maybe you've never normalized relational data with MySQL, but you want to learn how.
• You're well-versed in Excel and want to flex your mad skills in a practical environment.
• You don't think anything's beneath you, you'll do what it takes to get the job done.
• Nothing gets past you. You're detail oriented and organized.
• You're more concerned about doing it right than getting credit.
• You don't need someone looking over your shoulder to be productive.
• You are willing to work on multiple projects for a variety of Departments.
• You have a strong desire for taking initiative on projects & growing the position.
• Experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau or Google Data Studio.
• Proficient in Google Sheets, Docs & Slides and Microsoft Word & Excel.
• Ability to work effectively in a team environment as well as independently with minimal supervision.
• Ability to share findings and actionable insights in a clear and effective manner.

What to Expect:
• You'll grow with a fast-paced company that values its employees over its clients, and its clients over profits.
• You'll be given the opportunity to make a real impact on a very successful business. We don't believe corporate bureaucracy. Every employee has a voice within their dept.
• You will get extensive experience working for a SaaS company with hands-on eCommerce Affiliate Network experience.
• You'll be working alongside smart, driven young people who are passionate about what they do.
• Most importantly, you'll have fun and enjoy what you do.
• You are a data analyst who loves working with numbers and spreadsheets.
• You can identify trends, patterns, diagnose issues and propose solutions.
• You like to work independently and are not intimidated by creating & designing your own workflow to meet deadlines.
• You are able to coordinate with other teams and use your expertise to provide valuable insights to their requests.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• Dental insurance
• Dependent health insurance coverage
• Flexible spending account
• Health insurance
• Health savings account
• Life insurance
• Paid holidays
• Paid sick time
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance
• Work from home

Compensation package:
• Bonus pay

Experience level:
• Under 1 year

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Education:
• Bachelor's (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Data Analyst - MParticle
description:
Qualifications:
• 5+ years’ experience in digital analytics preferably at a digital agency
• Experience with CDPs/DMPs (mParticle, Adobe Experience Platform, Segment, etc.) or translation services (LiveRamp, Neustar) is required...
• Experience with digital data (e.g., site analytics, media analytics) is preferred
• Experience optimization of adtech (display,search) and martch (triggered email, site personalization) is preferred
• Experience with DSPs, ad serving, real-time bidding, and ad exchanges is preferred.
• Knowledge and experience with 1st party data, 3rd party data is preferred
• Digital agency, consulting, or ad tech experience required

Responsibilities:

A mid-level operational person who can collaborate with NBC brand teams to provide audience strategy and audience activation support for campaign initiation and activation through Comcast Set-Top-Box (STB) and mParticle.

As part of the NBCUniversal Enterprise Data Team, the Audience Operations Subject Matter Expert (SME) works closely with brands and advertisers to reach people with targeted messaging in paid media and owned channels leveraging Set-Top-Box (STB) and mParticle. With responsibility for audience data strategy, planning and profiling, selection, activation, and measurement, this team guides, supports and ensures successful optimization of audiences to achieve marketing objectives.

The right candidate has experience managing audience catalog, has extensive experience supporting audience operations in CDP, DMP, DSP, or other audience platforms, selecting, syndicating and tracking audiences, and is adept at end-to-end activities associated with audience testing. He/she also blends marketing, technical/digital, and performance marketing knowledge.
• Collaborate with teams and partners to translate marketing/campaign objectives into actionable audience objectives
• Provide day-to-day support in identifying campaign goals, media plans, media budgets to drive audience development via Set-Top-Box (STB) and mParticle platforms
• Ensure taxonomy, tracking, testing, reporting and optimization are properly enabled to drive superior audience management. Ensure successful audience sharing or onboarding.
• Leverage campaign and audience performance to make audience recommendations to reach audiences across platforms and formats. Perform data validation and auditing on audience builds and activations and identify and define automation processes and efficiencies that can streamline process and improve accuracy.
• Play the bridge between requesters, e.g., NBCU Brand Groups/agencies & Ad Sales, and supporting teams such as Comcast legal, Comcast STB team, NBCU Enterprise Data Organization (EDO), to get audiences activated through Set-Top-Box (STB) and mParticle platforms
• Use data-driven mindset to transform the way brands and their agencies approach Audience Activation process, including via Set-Top-Box (STB) and mParticle
• Conduct sizing analyses using data attributes and business knowledge to develop audience-based media testing and targeting strategy
• Collaborate with data science teams to provide analytics support to brands
• After campaign, work with brands and their agencies to gather performance reporting

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Salary: $50.00 - $90.00 per hour

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday

Education:
• Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:
• SQL: 1 year (Preferred)
• MParticle experience is a big plus: 5 years (Preferred)
• STB, working with legal and comcast: 5 years (Preferred)
• CDPs/DMPs: 5 years (Preferred)
• digital data (e.g., site analytics, media analytics): 5 years (Preferred)
• optimization of adtech (display,search): 5 years (Preferred)
• martch (triggered email, site personalization) is preferred: 5 years (Preferred)
• DSPs, ad serving, real-time bidding: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Speak with the employer
+91 630-635-8699

title: Clinical Research Data Analyst-Engineer
description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

The Clinical Research Data Analyst/Engineer's principal roles are to: 1) Work with and alongside clinical researchers at all levels within the clinical research community at Boston Medical Center and Boston University to create research quality data sets and reports using the resources of Boston Medical Center's Research Clinical Data Warehouse (CDW); and 2) Assist in... optimization efforts to improve data quality, science and standardization processes within the CDW.

Position: Clinical Research Data Analyst/Engineer

Department: Clinical Data Warehouse (Core Facility)

Schedule: Full Time

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES / DUTIES:

The Clinical Research Data Analyst/Engineer works with the Research Informatics Director to facilitate the accessibility, understanding, and active use of research-quality data for retrospective or prospective research studies across BMC.

The Research CDW is a consolidated data warehouse from a wide range of legacy and current clinical systems (EPIC) and is implemented using an Oracle RDBMS and SQL Server.

The Clinical Research Data Analyst/Engineer's primary responsibility is to retrieve and manage data from the CDW using SQL code, presenting data in a usable format for each researcher and learning the data platforms that are utilized across the Boston Medical Center Health System.

The Clinical Research Data Analyst/Engineer provides in-house content expertise in informatics and statistical/epidemiological analysis and provides limited project management support.

This position requires knowledge of SQL and strict adherence to research and regulatory data policies to ensure secure transmission/retrieval of data, working with researchers across the Health System to assure timely access to data to promote evidence-supported decision making by clinicians and administrators. It also requires a willingness to learn new systems and to work closely with hospital operations personnel, since the data warehouse exists within a rapidly changing health care environment.

Data Analyst

Programmatically operationalize data requirements to SQL queries in the Research CDW and present data for ease of researcher use guide researchers through the process of forming a sound, specific data request.

Harmonize data from the different sources from which the CDW obtains its data.

Help researchers understand the data available, work with them to understand their data requirements, and meet their data needs.

Provide formal written documentation of the dataset construction process, including inclusion and exclusion criteria and key definitions of data elements.

Understand and manage IRB restrictions on data access.

Implement the procedures and policies in the data warehouse system for access control.

Maintain data logs for auditing purposes.

Track hours and work with administrative personnel to invoice investigators and departments.

Data Engineer

Work with the Director of Research Informatics to build a research data infrastructure, developing innovative strategies to leverage Research CDW data to serve the research goals of the broader institution.

Develop standard operating procedures (SOPs) to ensure efficiency, reliability, and accuracy of CDW data.

Understand what processes in the Research CDW system need to be improved, communicate those needs to leadership, and participate in the improvement process.

Guide the development of appropriate metrics and reporting across the research community through consultation, education, and standardization.

Work with leadership to improve administrative and scientific processes of the Research CDW, while innovating new ways that CDW data could be used to advance initiatives central to BMC's mission.

OTHER DUTIES:

Conforms to hospital standards of performance and conduct, including those pertaining to patient rights, to ensure that exceptional customer service and patient care may be provided.

Utilizes hospital's behavioral standards and RESPECT attributes as the basis for decision making and to support the hospital's mission and goals.

Follow established hospital infection control and safety procedures.

Perform other duties as needed.

(The above statements in this job description are intended to depict the general nature and level of work assigned to the employee(s) in this job. The above is not intended to represent an exhaustive list of accountable duties and responsibilities required).

JOB REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION:

Masters' degree in applied biostatistics, applied math, computer science, computer/electrical engineering, public health, systems improvement, or information science.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS REQUIRED:

None required

EXPERIENCE:

Minimum 4 years of experience in a position focused on the delivery of numerical data to a wide variety of customers, with at least 3 years of experience working in hospital quality, healthcare information management, healthcare analytics, clinical research, or other relevant healthcare field.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

Demonstrated ability to use SQL or similar analytic tools Demonstrated ability to use SAS, R, Tableau, or similar data visualization tools.

Ability to organize, synthesize and analyze large amounts of information.

Strong interpersonal and communication skills to interface with staff at all levels.

Strong creative, analytic and critical thinking ability.

Demonstrated ability to successfully complete IT projects.

Experience managing implementations in a dynamic and highly integrated organization.

Knowledge of EPIC Clarity is a plus.

Req id: 26985

title: Data Analyst
description:
Get to know us:

We’re FieldRoutes, a leading cloud-based and mobile SaaS provider in the pest control and lawn care industry. Recently acquired by ServiceTitan, the world's leading provider of software for the trades, our platform automates all aspects of field service operations for enterprise and small businesses, enabling them to accelerate growth, streamline operations, increase customer... retention, and maximize revenue.

When you join our team, you’ll be joining one of the fastest growing companies in the US with an award-winning culture that’s been celebrated by Inc. Magazine and Forbes. Trusted by over 1,700 field service companies across thousands of locations, our software helps clients manage upwards of a billion dollars in revenue. Our partnership with ServiceTitan will enable us to accelerate investment in our technology and people while maintaining our flexible startup culture.

What you'll do:

Own and drive complex technical solutions to enable our business functions, including but not limited to payments, revenue operations, and FP&A, maximizing the value of their data

Ingest data from multiple Snowflake schemas to populate reporting views in Tableau

Transform business requirements from various business functions (Sales, Marketing, Finance, etc.) into technical requirements

Facilitate the reliable and accurate flow of data from various internal and external sources into the data warehouse

Use best of breed tools between the data warehouse and modern big data solutions. Familiarity with Snowflake, AWS, Azure, DBT, and other Cloud ETL tools such as FiveTran and Census preferred.

Develop scalable, integrated tools to promote cross-functional collaboration

Continuously learn about data analytics business and technology trends, and effectively communicate information with colleagues

Mentor technical employees and contribute to their individual development, and lead performance management processes for technical delivery teams

What you'll need:

Strong SQL skills

2-3 years of recent, progressive experience and demonstrable technical expertise in enterprise-class data analytics solutions and services; this includes advanced skills in areas such as Data Modeling, Integration, Storage, Indexing, Security, Logging, Data Quality, Master Data Management and Archiving

Minimum 2 years architect and hands-on experience with modern data analytics solutions (Snowflake, AzureDW, DBT, Tableau)

Experience with Architecture and applications on or incorporating cloud infrastructure-, platform-,and/or software- as a service (particularly data analytic solutions on Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, or other cloud platforms and service providers)

Experience in core business systems (e.g. customer, call center, billing, etc.) transformation programs, with a focus on related changes in data analytics architecture, engineering, and business capabilities

B.S. in Computer/Data Science or equivalent degree or 3-5 years of professional work experience is required

Strong database skills

Strong Data Modeling skills (dimensional modeling, DBT)

Tableau experience

DBT experience (Preferred)

Snowflake experience (Preferred)

Be Human With Us:

Being human isn’t about checking every box on a list. It’s about the experiences we have, people we meet, and the perspectives we share. So, if you have the skills but are hesitant to apply because of your background, apply anyway. We need amazing people like you to help us challenge the conventional and think differently about the problems that we’re solving. We’re in this together. Come be human, with us.

What We Offer:

When you join our team, you’re not just accepting a job. You’re making a career move. Here’s how we’ll support you in doing some of the most impactful work of your career:

Flextime, recognition, and support for autonomous work: Flexible time off with ample learning and development opportunities to continue growing your career. We offer a comprehensive onboarding program, leadership training for Titans at all levels, and other programs and events. Great work is rewarded through Bonusly, peer-nominated awards, and more.

Holistic health and wellness benefits: Company-paid medical, dental, and vision (with 100% employer paid options and 90% coverage for dependents), FSA and HSA, 401k match, and telehealth options including memberships to Headspace, Galileo, One Medical, Ginger and more.

Support for Titans at all stages of life: Parental leave and support, up to $20k in adoption reimbursement, on demand maternity support through Maven Maternity, free breast milk shipping through Maven Milk, pet insurance, legal advisory services, financial planning tools, and more.

At ServiceTitan, we celebrate individuality and uniqueness. We believe that the convergence of fresh perspectives and experiences from all walks of life is what makes our product and culture so great. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We do not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), genetic information, protected military or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

ServiceTitan is committed to fair and equitable compensation for all of our employees. We thoughtfully consider a wide range of factors when determining individual compensation. The expected salary range for this role is between $62,000 - $89,000. Actual compensation for an individual may vary depending on skills, performance over time, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to the base salary, the total compensation package also includes an annual bonus, equity and a holistic suite of benefits

title: SENIOR DATA ANALYST
description:
The Senior Data Analyst is part of a core team that enables strategic decision making throughout the company. Strong verbal and written communication, with time management skills are key to success in this role. This role will be able to consume, process and analyze the largest household goods datasets in the world in collaboration with other analysts, investigators, and subject matter experts... The right candidate should be passionate about data and analytics with a positive and solution-oriented mindset.

You are interested in this career because of your strong background with technologies like Snowflake as well as your experience building data catalogs or data dictionaries. More specifically, you are able to develop successful relationships with UniGroup business units.

The work location for this role is flexible if approved by UniGroup except this position may not be performed remotely from Colorado or California. You may read over the UniGroup privacy policy by clicking HERE.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Advocates for improvements to data quality, security, and query performance that have impact across your data domain.
• Approves data model changes as a reviewer and code owner for specific data domains.
• Builds actionable insight for the business using data visualization tools. (We use QlikSense and ThoughtSpot)
• Builds close relationships with other functional teams to truly democratize data understanding and access.
• Cleans and models large quantities of raw, disorganized data using code-based tools. (We leverage DBT)
• Clearly and concisely communicates complex business logic, technical requirements, and design recommendations through iterative solutions.
• Collaborates on SQL code base, creating analysis and transformations. Knowledge of Python, SAS, and various modeling techniques is preferred. (We use Snowflake and BI tools like Qlik and ThoughtSpot)
• Collaborates with business units across UniGroup in building self-service, dashboard, and reporting solutions to deliver useful analysis and strong data insights.
• Confidently delivers and explains data analytics methodologies and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects.
• Contributes to, implements, and maintains best practices and standards in functional areas (data warehousing, data modeling, coding, visualization, and analysis) keeping reliability, performance, scalability, security, automation, and versioning in mind.
• Effectively communicates and collaborates, including providing clear status updates.
• Engages in discussions of technical design and architecture recommendations.
• Explains trends across data sources, potential opportunities for growth or improvement, and data peculiarities to deliver descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, forecasting, and prescriptive data analysis.
• Follows and improves processes and workflows for maintaining high quality data and reporting.
• Helps to define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for our data environment. Maintains and advocates these standards through code review.
• Implements data quality tests and continuously review, optimize, and refactor data models in order to expand our data environments with ready to analyze data.
• Influences and implements service level framework SLOs and SLAs for data sources and data services.
• Influences overall objectives and long-range goals of team.
• Owns the end to end process of being on-call including reading logs, diagnosing issues, verifying and implementing solutions, and otherwise providing data support for UniGroup team members.
• Participates in data quality process and other data auditing activities.
• Proactively works on the efficiency and capacity planning to set clear requirements and reduce the system resources usage to make compute queries cheaper.
• Provides mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Data Analysts on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy.
• Solves technical problems of high scope and complexity.
• Turns learnings into repeatable actions by documenting work in the appropriate shared location.
• Performs a variety of other duties as assigned.

Education, License or Certification:
• Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Communications, Psychology, Business or equivalent experience.

Experience:
• 3-6 years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst or in related field
• Minimum 6 years of experience with SQL writing required
• Comfortable working in a highly agile, iterative environment using Jira.
• Ability to work with Git and the command line preferred
• Experience with a variety of data sources. (Our data includes many custom and internal applications, as well as Google Analytics, HubSpot, and more.)
• Significant experience in SQL and DBT required
• Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent those problems.
• Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases.
• Knowledgeable about UniGroup’s architecture, APIs, and tech stake.
• Possesses a deep understanding of how data is created and transformed through the UniGroup ecosystem to drive business operations, customer experience, service usage, and data reporting capabilities.
• Project experience working with SQL, Python, R, or other methods to generate insights.
• Self-motivated, and self-managing, with strong organizational skills.
• Understand the code base extremely well to lead new data innovation and to spot inconsistencies and edge cases.
• Understands the full data lifecycle and our common frameworks so that data can be easily integrated, modeled, and analyzed for insights.

We foster diversity, in part, by imposing a strict policy of non-discrimination. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information or other status protected by the law.

We value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and separated service members bring to our workforce. While serving our country you have gained skills such as leadership, flexibility, and agility, which will help to make you successful here. We are dedicated to supporting military families and ensuring that we provide a welcoming environment for our country’s heroes. We hope you consider joining the UniGroup family.

UniGroup is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, UniGroup will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@unigroup.com

title: Business Analyst
description:
Description:

Our ideal candidate is someone who is excited to become a part of an awesome, fast-growing team and must display these...

three top (required) skills:

1. Detail Oriented

2. Strong oral and written communication skills

3. Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment

General Position Summary:

The Business Analyst perform professional duties related to the review, assessment, and development of business processes. The Business Analyst will analyze and translate operation requirements into system deployments and business process changes. They act as a change agent to help facilitate effective process re-engineering. The Business Analyst will also develop a strong QA procedure for operational areas. After determining scope and optimum solution, the Business Analyst will develop seamless solutions delivered to operations and our clients on time, within budget and within scope.

Perks:
• Medical, FSA & HSA, Dental, Vision + More!
• 401k - 100% vested once you start contributing. Generous company match!
• Regular employee health, wellness & engagement activities!
• Pet Insurance, because fur babies are important to us too!

About Vervent:

As one of the pre-eminent Lending as a Service (LaaS) companies, Vervent sets the global standard for outperformance by

delivering superior expertise, future-built technology, and meaningful services. We support our industry-leading partners with primary

strategic services including Loan & Lease Servicing, Call Center Services, Backup Servicing/Capital Markets Support, Credit Card

Servicing, and Card Marketing & Customer Acquisition. Vervent empowers companies to accelerate business, drive compliance,

and maximize service.

If you're interested in reviewing the full job description, continue reading below...

Primary Responsibilities:

Defines and documents customer business functions and processes.
Consults with functional unit management and personnel to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access.
Acts as a liaison between departmental end-users, technical analysts, information technology developers, and executive management team in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of service management systems to ensure optimal operational performance.
Plans, organizes and conducts business process re-engineering/improvement projects and/or management reviews thorough gap analysis and develop multiple solutions for identified gaps.
Design new programs and processes by analyzing data, constructing workflow charge and diagrams, studying system capabilities and writing business requirements.
Improve systems and processes by studying current practices and designing modifications.
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends.
Develop and implement QA process and protocol for all process improvement initiatives and new client on-boarding.
Define scope by identifying optimum solution with contingency plans.
Transfer necessary business view to IT developers to ensure implemented solution meets the needs of the business.
Maintain project prioritization schedule for Operations to insure balance of process improvement deliverables with new client on-boarding.
Fully Document Compliance oversight and build automation throughout Compliance cycle.
Requirements:
Bachelor's in business management, Computer Science, or related field.
5 years of experience in project management, business operations or client services in financial services or related field, or combination of relevant experience and education.
Demonstrated expertise in compliance audit and reporting, including internal audit set-up.
Must possess proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key decision makers and collaborate across business lines.
Must demonstrate strong analytical skills and able to translate data into action.
Solid organizational skills, ability to lead teams of various sizes, ability to focus on broader goals and project details simultaneously, and ability to multi-task effectively.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office including Microsoft Project or equivalent.

Physical Requirements:

The work is of an intellectual nature. While performing the functions of this job, the employee is required to stand and sit for prolonged periods. Specific vision abilities required include close and medium distance vision and the ability to adjust focus. Must be able to hear normal sounds, distinguish sound as voice and communicate through human speech. This position requires the ability to operate a keyboard, computer mouse, telephone, fax, copier, writing tools, and other standard office equipment. On an occasion, an employee will be asked to lift items weighing up to 35 lbs.

Other Duties:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Salary:

$43,500-$58,000/year

title: Data Analyst II
description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

• Analyze health management programs including: data collection, validation and outcome measurement. May... include:
o Financial, pharmacy, claims, provider, and member data
o IRS, CMS, HHSC, HEDIS reporting
o Internal data cleansing and data reconciliation analysis
o Trend analysis in various functional areas of health care management.
• Create and generate reports through MS-Excel, MS-Access, and SQL using Business Objects interface and direct links to core databases (ODS/EDW)
• Produce reports for and interface with senior management and internal and external stakeholders.
• Gather and interpret business requirements and monitor data trends to proactively identify issues
• Execute data changes and update core systems as needed
• Handle multiple projects and timelines effectively and communicate risks and issues to manager regularly
• Assist with training lower level Data Analysts.

Position Purpose:
Responsible for analytical data needs. Handle complex data requests, reports, and predictive data modeling.

BUSINESS ANALYTICS:
Bachelor’s degree related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience or 1+ years of related IT experience, including data warehouse, coding or ETL experience. Advanced knowledge of Business Objects, SQL, and Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access.

Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law
