title: Healthcare Data Analyst
description:
CPS Solutions, LLC

Remote...

Summary:

The full-time, exempt Healthcare Data Analyst – Customer Solutions provides analytical and consultative support to our commercial organization to accurately model and design recommended specialty pharmacy services. The primary focus of the position is to analyze health system-specific clinical and financial data and draw appropriate conclusions that support the creation of a new or accelerated specialty pharmacy service line. Working alongside the Vice President, Customer Solutions, and the Senior Analyst - Customer Solutions, the Healthcare Data Analyst has responsibility for modeling the specialty therapy patterns at specific health systems and the resulting clinical and financial implications of a partnership with Trellis Rx. They contribute significantly to business development at Trellis and aid the sales team by engaging with prospects as required to support data acquisition and quality assurance.

Responsibilities:

Interpreting health care data sets for internal and external users.

Utilizing the analytical platform for health system specialty pharmacy assessments that is central to the partnership evaluation model used by Trellis Rx.

Partnering with other members of the Trellis team to formulate models and recommendations for service design, financial viability, and operational success of a specialty pharmacy service line for prospective health system partners.

Creating and refining financial models showing revenue, operating expense, profitability, and staffing requirements and plans for review with the VP, Customer Solutions and customer operations.

Presenting analytical models and key findings to internal stakeholders.

Designing/automating/optimizing systems and processes to drive improved accuracy and faster delivery of analytical outputs and insights.

Participating in company-wide analytic and business reporting activities

Assisting other members of the Trellis commercial team with data analysis and financial models for prospective customer presentations

Ensuring internal customer satisfaction and maintaining strong stakeholder relationships

Qualifications:

At least a bachelor’s degree in computer science, analytics, mathematics, or business or in a related field

Relevant work experience in data analysis with data sets of varying sizes with a preference for experience with healthcare data analysis and pharmacy-related data, including electronic prescriptions

Demonstrably advanced Microsoft Excel skills

Experience with developing and presenting client-ready findings and recommendations from analyzed data in both verbal and written forms as well as in Microsoft PowerPoint

Demonstrated ability to develop financial projections including a strong understanding of key interrelated financial concepts

Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills

The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions

A track record of following through on commitments using excellent planning, project-management, prioritization, and time management skills

Preference for knowledge of programming and data management infrastructures especially knowledge of Python

Benefits : All employees enjoy a competitive salary, eligibility to participate in the 401(k) savings plan with a match. Full-Time employees are also eligible for a comprehensive benefits package, including Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Time Off Plan, Company Paid Short- and Long-Term Disability, Basic and Supplemental Life Insurance, Medical Flex and Dependent Care Accounts and more.

CPS Solutions, LLC Requirements: All employment offers are contingent upon successfully passing a background check, drug test and signed onboarding documents. Additionally, you may be required to provide medical records or have additional medical examinations/background checks that are a specific requirement of the location or position in which you are hired. Due to the healthcare requirements of the location where you will work and the clients we support, this may include a COVID vaccine. This applies to internal transfers and status changes for internal CPS Solutions, LLC team members. CPS Solutions, LLC is also committed to a safe and drug free workplace.

About TrellisRx: Now part of CPS, TrellisRx is a technology-enabled service provider that partners with health systems to fund, build, and operate world-class specialty pharmacies on their behalf, with their brand. Trellis enables health systems to deliver enhanced experiences and outcomes by helping them offer concierge level clinical and administrative support to patients throughout their course of therapy. We believe pharmacists and pharmacy technicians are critical additions to the care team and that an exceptional pharmacy team makes superior results possible. For More information, visit https://www.trellisrx.com/ .

About CPS Solutions, LLC: Founded nearly 50 years ago and employing over 2,500 clinical, regulatory, and operational pharmacy professionals, CPS Solutions, LLC, is one of the nation’s largest providers of pharmacy services to more than 800 hospitals and healthcare facilities nationwide. CPS Solutions, LLC helps clients tackle a variety of complex issues, such as operational efficiency, rising drug costs, regulatory & compliance, 340B, and specialty pharmacy strategy. CPS Solutions, LLC helps healthcare leaders drive best in class pharmacy operations through skill, expertise, and proprietary technologies. For more information, visit https://www.CPS.com .

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any qualified employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, religious creed, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, mental or physical disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Data Analyst for Measuring Trends in Crime Rates Over Time Project
description:
Advertisement:

Greetings Freelancers...

I am looking for an experienced individual or team to conduct a project on "Measuring Trends in Crime Rates Over Time". The aim of the project is to answer the following questions:

1- What are the most common methods used to measure crime rates over time?

2- What impact does technology have on the measurement of crime trends?

3- What are some potential causes of changes in crime rates over time?

4- How do crime rates in urban areas compare to those in rural areas?

5- How have crime rates changed in the past decade?

6- How do crime rates in different countries compare, and what factors may influence these differences?

7- What role do economic and social factors play in shaping trends in crime rates over time?

8- What strategies can be used to reduce crime rates over time?

The project will require analyzing the 15 following variables(add the rest of the variables):

1- Crime Per Year (Quantitative, with values from 1990 to 2021, or any 10years time-series)

2- Crime Type (Categorical, with values of property crime, drug crimes, homicides, and violent crimes)

3- Number of Crimes per country (up to 3 countries, Quantitative with values of high, normal, low)

4- Population Size (Quantitative, with values of over population, normal population, and low population)

5- Income Level (Quantitative, with values of low income, mid income, and high income)

6- Status Status (Categorical, with values of employed and unemployed)

7- Urban/Rural Setting (Categorical, with values of urban and rural)

8- Gender (Categorical, with values of male and female)

The analysis will be done using the following techniques:

1- Crime rate VS Year = Time Series Plot

2- Demographic factors VS Crime Rate = Bar Graph

3- Status Status VS Crime Rates = Side-by-side Boxplot

4- Rural/Urban VS Crime Rates = Bar Graph

The following specific questions will also be analyzed:

1- How do crime rates in urban areas compare to those in rural areas? = bar graph

2- How have crime rates changed in the past decade? = Time Series Plot

3- What are the most common methods used to measure crime rates over time? = pie chart

Please, follow the instructions in the "Project Specification_2022.docx" and take a look at the "Project sample.pdf" To have an idea about the project.

if you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me.

If you have experience in data analysis and visualization and are interested in this project, please apply. Thank you

title: Data Analyst/Surveillance Coordinator
description:
Summary

The Disease Investigation and Surveillance (DIS) Analyst will assist in developing and improving programs and processes to monitor population health and communicable diseases in Chester County. The DIS team works to track, prevent and control communicable diseases by performing disease surveillance activities and epidemiology investigations, as well as initiating appropriate public... health interventions.

The Disease Investigation and Surveillance (DIS) team is seeking a driven analyst who can support the team in analyzing data and monitoring disease trends, conducting research, generating reports, and ensuring DIS procedures are documented, reviewed, and updated regularly. A successful candidate will have the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within the DIS team and Department to enhance the DIS program.

This is an Essential Employee position. Essential employees are obligated to report to work as scheduled or remain at work during emergencies. Following Is the Duty Statement for Essential Employees:
"Carries out essential job functions or assigned emergency duties which may involve assignments within the Department of Health Command Center, deployment to a field location to participate in public health activities, or other duties as required during periods of emergency. If received, emergency assignments may be performed under adverse conditions and continue for periods ranging from a few hours to several weeks."

Essential Duties
• Utilize data from statewide data systems used to monitor communicable disease trends
• Utilize statistical analysis tools to calculate frequencies, rates, and relationships in the data and ensure the data are clean and well-understood prior to developing additional outputs/reports
• Compare data with similar analyses developed elsewhere.
• Communicate any disturbing or unexpected findings to supervisors or others as appropriate
• Responsible for developing key indicators, volume drivers, and other infectious disease (including COVID-19) surveillance-related performance metrics for feedback reports and quality improvement processes.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to define data needs and identify gaps in current capabilities, as well as import, clean, transform, and validate data for the purposes of identifying COVID-19 and other infectious disease clusters, trends or patterns
• Drive a high level of quality and accuracy by identifying new opportunities for process improvement, as well as opportunities for coaching, training and other efforts at ensuring the best practices for maintaining data accuracy and integrity.
• Work with personnel on County, State, and Regional levels to collect, analyze and assess data and information pertinent to the delivery of public health services
• Review and analyze pertinent data and compile into plans or assessments for use by internal and external staff
• Make recommendations to staff regarding data collection, editing, organization, tabulation and presentation of data
• Participate in active and passive surveillance projects and disease outbreak investigations
• Perform systems analyses to ensure that the most efficient work processes are employed and that agreed upon procedures are documented and followed by appropriate staff
• Evaluate findings of studies conducted by staff and interns and validate the results prior to public release of information
• Maintain a positive and professional image when interacting with the public, county employees outside agencies and other professionals
• Plan and implement data collection systems and make presentations and/or prepare reports of activities
• Handle all other special projects or duties as assigned

Qualifications/Preferred Skills, Knowledge & Experience

Qualifications / Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health or a related field; or two or more years of job related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Strong project management skills.
• Statistical analysis experience.
• Strong time management skills.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Strong organization skills.
• Ability to work independently and proceed with objectives.
• Strong research methods and data analysis abilities.
• Ability to work as part of a team.
• Ability to exercise sound judgment and coordinate resolutions to critical situations, under all conditions.
• Ability to maintain confidential Information and handle confidential matters.

Preferred Skills, Knowledge & Experience:
• Master's degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health or related field.
• Four years job-related experience.
• Ability to perform data analysis.
• Ability to present data to others in a professional manner.
• Able to use common sense understanding to carry out written or verbal instructions.
• Accurate and detail oriented.
• Ability to establish priorities (remain focused on daily operations).
• Strong professional ethics.
• Ability to conduct training.
• Ability to follow office protocols.
• Ability to handle and resolve recurring problems.
• Able to carry tasks to completion.
• Flexibility.
• General knowledge and understanding of County of Chester policies and procedures.

Additional Information

Computer Skills:
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have:
• Knowledge of SAS software or previous data management experience is highly desirable
• Advanced Word skills
• Advanced Excel skills
• Advanced Access skills
• Advanced PowerPoint skills

title: Data Analyst II - Remote Available
description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Applicants for this position have the opportunity to work remotely...

Position Purpose: Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.

• Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims, provider, member, and encounters data. Identify and assess the business impact of trends
• Develop, execute, maintain, and troubleshoot complex scripts and reports developed using SQL, Microsoft Excel, or other analytics tools
• Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
• Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers
• Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines and thrive in a demanding, quickly changing environment
• Support the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation
• Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products
• Support multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
• Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results
• Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required

Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Working knowledge of SQL/query languages. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI.

Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law

title: Consumer Research & Data Analyst - Now Hiring
description:
Req ID:72652

Job Location:TulsaTulsaOK...

Areas of Interest:Business/Technical Analysis

Pay Transparency Salary Range:Not Available

BOK Financial (BOKF), Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top 25 U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in ten states - Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Arizona, Colorado, Kansas/Missouri, New Mexico, Nebraska and Wisconsin. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies. .
Bonus Type
Discretionary

Summary

We're building a culture at BOK Financial where amazing people (like you) can bring their best, be their best and work for the best. You've come to the right place to grow your career. The Consumer Research & Data Analyst provides expertise and actionable guidance to management through the analysis of consumer and market data, as well as the impacts of industry, financial services, and regulatory trends.

Job Description

The Consumer Research & Data Analyst provides expertise and actionable guidance to management through the analysis of consumer and market data, as well as the impacts of industry, financial services, and regulatory trends. Provides information and detailed analysis to guide business decisions. Serves as a strategic thought leader around data insights including client surveys. Develops strong working relationships with internal departments and line of business partners to understand business issues, key performance indicators, strategies and plans. This role will handle a high volume of work exhibiting attention to detail.

Team Culture

We celebrate each other's wins, big and small. We respect, honor and praise one another for a job well done. We are transparent. We are involved, committed, and collaborative. Simply put: We Achieve More Together.

How You'll Spend Your Time
• You will extract and decipher complex data, perform a broad range of analyses and employ analytical tools to illustrate emerging trends. This position provides actionable guidance by determining the meaning of complex data and formulating clear, concise, and compelling written/verbal conclusions or recommendations based on analyses.
• You will exercise sound judgment in researching problems, evaluating various solutions, and using data to inform decision making that impacts the Division's bottom line. You will also partner with various line of business leaders and managers to identify, address, and satisfy data needs for various LOB projects; develop ad hoc reports and analyze as requested by management; provide day-to-day support for specialized data requests.
• You will ensure data quality and validation controls are in place to support accurate data representation; effectively communicate and document segment models and their business implications. This position will formulate recommendations regarding segmentation, acquisition, retention, cross-selling and integrated communications.
• You will build tools and pipelines for gathering data from multiple sources into a coherent view, ensure high quality work products and on-time delivery of all initiatives. Proactively assists project teams in establishing requirements and resource needs, removing road blocks. Assist in building effective launch plans, participates in launch to ensure success, and provides critical feedback regarding defects and opportunities.
• You will research relevant industry, financial services, and line of business issues to build upon knowledge base, identifying trends and sharing insights with team; anticipate and identify issues inhibiting the attainment of assigned goals; develop and implement problem resolution.

Education & Experience Requirements

This level of knowledge is normally acquired by completion of a Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics and 2+ years of relevant professional business experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Ability to develop optimized SQL queries joining multiple databases to deliver customized inquiries
• Familiarity with PowerBI and the ability to partner with internal stakeholders to drive new and innovative PowerBI tools
• Strong conceptual thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills, including the ability to analyze complex problems that include interrelationships and dependencies in order to identify common themes and solutions
• Advance understanding of the data models in the domains - Customer, Products (Deposits, Loans, Cards, Payments) & related services).
• Strong aptitude to collect and analyze information and make appropriate recommendations including source to target, target to source - data mapping, business rules, data validation.
• Self-motivated, disciplined, and task focused
• Strong time management and organizational skills to effectively handle projects in a fast-paced, high-volume, and deadline intensive environment
• Highly detail-oriented
• Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality
• Well-developed written and oral communication skills to effectively represent self and the Division, as well as the ability to present complex information and issues in a clear concise manner
• Working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
• Experience with descriptive and exploratory data analysis.
• General knowledge of financial products and services
• General knowledge of marketing standards, principles, guidelines, and rules

Advertising Source

BOK Financial is a stable and financially strong organization that provides excellent training and development to support building the long term careers of our employees. With passion, skill and partnership you can make an impact on the success of the bank, our customers and your own career!

Apply today and take the first step towards your next career opportunity!

If you are interested in a career with BOK Financial text "BOKF" to 25000 to engage with Olivia our virtual recruiting assistant.

BOK Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for training, compensation, transfer, promotion and other aspects of employment for all qualified applicants and employees without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information or veteran status.

Please contact with any questions

title: HR Data Analyst
description:
Job Type

Full-time...

Description

Our human resources team is looking for an HR Data Analyst to help us by being a subject matter expert on all HR-related data systems and processes. Your day-to-day duties will include managing and maintaining HR data, processes, and metrics; supporting payroll; processing data through third-party web portals; performing related data reporting; and generally supporting system- and technology-related HR initiatives. If you are analytical, a systematic thinker, and want to join a team who enjoys helping people thrive in a relationship business, then APPLY TODAY!

In one year as our HR Data Analyst, you will know you were successful if you...

Create data models, analyze internal data, and present relevant, data-based inputs for company decisions via written reports, narratives, or presentations.

Lead or support system-/technology-related tasks associated with HR projects/initiatives.

Respond to internal data and audit requests by creating, analyzing, and providing data reports.

Create and deliver scheduled dashboards and metrics.

Collaborate with and support routine payroll processing.

Analyze and synthesize external data sources such as compensation or benchmark data for internal application.

Establish relevant databases of incoming data and configure methods for ease of use.

Develop and enhance HR data reporting practices in support of evolving business needs.

Interface with internal technology teams and external HR technology vendors to ensure the best use of HR systems and their integration with other relevant internal systems.

Train peers and employees on system usage.

Pursue updates in HR technology trends to enhance HR operations and employee service.

Lead or support future implementation and administration of HR systems and data feeds.

Requirements

What we are looking for…

Bachelor's degree in a related field of study (e.g., computer science, data science, applied statistics) or the equivalent combination of education and experience.

A minimum of four years’ experience working with company data systems in an analytical role is required, preferably working with HRIS applications (especially Paylocity).

Must be highly proficient in Microsoft Office applications – must be able to utilize Excel at least at an intermediate skill level including pivot tables and VLOOKUP functions. Advanced knowledge is strongly preferred.

Requires competency in effectively and accurately managing and utilizing HRIS data.

Experience with HRIS and payroll software is strongly preferred.

Strong analytical skills with a strong working knowledge of problem-solving, root-cause analysis, and associated solution implementation.

Demonstrated critical thinking, ability to analyze large amounts of data, to translate data, draw conclusions, and make recommendations.

Requires learning agility, discipline, flexibility, self-start, self-direction, forward-thinking, problem-solving and the ability to effectively manage multiple competing priorities.

Ranked as the top-performing U.S. public bank by S&P Global Market Intelligence, Merchants Bancorp is a diversified bank holding company headquartered in Carmel, Indiana, operating multiple lines of business, including multifamily housing and healthcare facility financing and servicing, mortgage warehouse financing, retail, and correspondent residential mortgage banking, agricultural lending, and traditional community banking. Merchants Bancorp conducts its business through its direct and indirect subsidiaries, Merchants Bank of Indiana, Merchants Capital Corp., Farmers-Merchants Bank of Illinois, and Merchants Mortgage, a division of Merchants Bank of Indiana.

Merchants understands the positive impact of making employees feel valued and is proud to once again be recognized by the Indiana Chamber of Commerce’s Best Places to Work Program. This is the seventh year in a row that Merchants was recognized as a Best Places to Work organization.

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
description:
Healthcare Data Analyst

Recognized for more than 30 years of growth in visual data mining technologies, Salient delivers a lightning-speed solution that empowers people and impacts business at all levels. As an industry leader, we attribute our success to our cutting-edge technology and to the contributions of our dedicated, forward-thinking employees...

We offer a fast-paced work environment and focus on the professional development of all employees. As part of our generous compensation package, Salient offers paid time off between Christmas and New Year’s, we foster open communication, and are committed to a team-oriented environment.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Healthcare Data Analyst at Salient, you will be in a highly visible analytical role and will work closely with NYS Medicaid program stakeholders as well as internal cross functional teams to conceptualize, design, develop, test, and support data driven solutions. Outcomes will rely on your analytical subject matter expertise and guidance. In this role, you will analyze data within Salient’s proprietary data mining software and directly from source data. This role requires a keen attention to detail, superior organizational and documentation skills, and a teamwork approach. Interpreting and understanding client needs will provide an opportunity to use data driven business processes to identify and seize opportunities to enhance our solutions.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:
• Plan and execute data analyses, incorporating business analysis skills to gather and document requirements
• Interpret and summarize data, identifying trends and developing a concise and informative avenue for communicating results and data stories to key stakeholders
• Develop customized templates and formats for reporting out on data analysis requests
• Create and maintain documentation (e.g. data dictionaries and About the Data documents) containing data definitions/nuances
• Understand client data requirements and assist in the translation of those requirements into new implementations and system enhancements; collaboratively work with cross functional teams to design, develop, test, and execute the task at hand
• Strive for continuous improvements of processes, quality, methods, and documentation
• Act as escalation point for client support analytical requests
• Assist with client user training classes as needed
• Carry out other duties as necessary and assigned

Required Education/Experience
• B.S. with concentration in healthcare claims data/analysis, health informatics, health administration, public health, epidemiology, statistics, or related field. Master’s degree preferred or additional relevant experience in lieu of advanced degree
• 5 to 7+ years of professional work experience focusing on data analysis in Medicaid, Medicare, or private insurance data
• Business analysis experience, as it relates to data analysis and requirements gathering
• Ability to be client-facing and engage stakeholders in iterative analytical processes
• Must be strong in problem solving and scientific/mathematical thinking skills, with the ability to create organized and professional material

Preferred Qualifications
• Knowledge of health plan operations, such as healthcare claims processing, membership, provider, and benefits; or equivalent combination of education/experience
• Knowledge of data collection, analysis, statistics and data presentation with experience in data mining techniques and procedures
• Experience working with administrative data, ideally health care data
• Understanding of health data formats including enrollment, services, lab and pharmacy
• Experience with Medicaid claims data, NYS Medicaid experience preferred
• Familiarity with utilization management, care coordination, quality improvement programs and population health
• Questioning, inquisitive approach to work, with the ability to learn
• Possess the ability to analyze complex data and prepare ad hoc analyses independently, with collaboration and input as needed
• Experience with presenting data via a combination of summarized data and visualizations preferred
• Superior communication skills with the ability to engage and inspire co-workers and clients
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, sometimes with competing priorities
• Experience with data governance efforts and presentation of recommendations for data integrity and consistency
• Experience with the process of software development life cycle (SDLC)

Technical Skills
• Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, mastery in MS Excel (required)
• 5 to 7+ years of experience with SQL
• Familiarity with or ability to learn relevant BI tools and data analysis systems

Salient Corporation is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, military status, veteran status, age, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, domestic violence victim status, or any other status protected by law.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire

title: Embedded Senior Data Analyst SIBU510
description:
About Sibylline

Sibylline is a leading intelligence and strategic risk consultancy in the security sector. Since 2010 we have supported businesses, governments and NGOs through the provision of high-quality risk analysis, due diligence and consultancy services. The firm provides an innovative, entrepreneurial and fast-growing working environment, offering employees ever greater exposure to high... profile clients and challenges. Sibylline offers fantastic opportunities for career progression within a successful company, and we aim to help our employees to build their own personal profiles as well-regarded analysts within the broader industry.

Key attributes of Sibylline employees are:
• Self-motivated, and auto-improving individuals who can couple initiative and boldness with good judgement
• Excellent written and spoken English
• Clarity of thought and analytical flair
• Strong, demonstrable interest in security and intelligence
• The ability to work under pressure, demonstrate leadership when required but also be able to collaborate effectively in teams
• Excellent attention to detail

About the Role

The Senior Data Analyst will support data migration using the clients bespoke service tools as well as provide reporting, metrics, and information management initiatives for a global security team. The Senior Data Analyst will create queries, sort, and assess large volumes of data utilizing the clients software analytics services as well as SQL, Python and Tableau. This data supports multiple security divisions by providing trend analysis, process improvement, and various analytical requirements in support of corporate and employee security and safety. The Senior Data Analyst will also drive architecture and deliver custom solutions on the clients software platform with a specialized focus in analytics and warehousing capabilities with experience in virtualization, migrations and automation.

Duties and Responsibilities

Essential Functions
• Run and modify SQL queries to generate lists reports in Tableau
• Manipulate data with SQL, Tableau, Excel
• Perform ad-hoc reports and analysis
• Develop processes and simple data pipelines to improve reporting efficiencies
• Collect, archive, and review data from a variety of open and proprietary sources
• Collaborate with key stakeholders to ingest volumes of data, policy, and program points
• Manage data sets in use by security analysts and operators, including facility and employee data

Note: A working knowledge and application with SQL, Tableau, and Redshift is a requirement for this position

Skills, Experience and Qualifications

Minimum
• Bachelor's Degree (or higher) in a relevant field
• Experience using software such as Redshift, Athena, Kinesis amongst others
• Strong understanding of cloud computing architecture, technical design and implementations
• Be able to determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), and develop business intelligence and data warehouse strategies
• SQL, Python and Tableau experience, with the ability to create ad-hoc queries for various purposes
• This role is highly technical, must be able to write SQL queries, do analysis, write
• reports, generate data and identify problems within data sets
• Superior proficiency with Windows-based computers, and strong technical acumen with the ability to integrate multiple travel and risk management platforms
• At minimum, working proficiency in SharePoint, Excel, and other Microsoft Office programs
• Capable of learning quickly in a fast-paced environment and handling multiple tasks simultaneously
• Excellent written and verbal communication, ability to work independently and within a team
• Exemplary critical thinking, analytical skills, and judgment

Preferred
• Familiarity with intelligence analysis tools, and tradecraft
• Familiarity with Notebook, D3, Salesforce, and related PSIM tools
• Familiarity with Lenel or C-Cure
• The ability to build high quality dashboards based on SQL extracts from Lenel will be a major focus of this position

Next Steps

Successful candidates will be invited to complete a writing assessment (at an arranged time to suit you) to test writing and analytical ability, followed by a set of psychometric tests. Shortlisted applicants will then be invited to a final panel interview. In the current environment, our interviews will be conducted virtually.

Sibylline is committed to the recruitment and selection of candidates without regard for sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, age, political beliefs, culture and lifestyle. The firm is committed to fostering a business culture that reflects these values and promotes equal opportunity

title: Data Analyst / Scientist (Python 3,MS SQL Server, MySQL, PHP, JS)
description:
To apply to this job you need to be at an expert level:

1-Python 3...
2-MS SQL Server (ms sql server management: sql queries, stored procedures, views, scheduler and etc)
3-MySQL

You will be responsible for our Data warehouse and will support business intelligence (BI) activities.

Vedal Media brings people together. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our dating websites and apps are expansive and rapidly growing. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst / Scientist 'Numbers wizard' to join our growing team.
• Do you want to be part of GROWING ONLINE BRANDS to 8-9 figures over the next 5 years with a possible IPO?
• Do you LOVE digging into data & NUMBERS and converting them into GROWTH STRATEGIES?
• Do you love Creating beautiful KPI DASHBOARDS & PPT reports that will be essential for MANAGEMENT to apply fast, agile & correct decisions?
• Do you LOVE supporting (or managing) SaaS companies GROWTH?
• Do you want to help 1 Billion people find Happiness, Love, Wealth & Awareness? (not many ppl get to make a real difference in this world)
• Do you have min. 5 yrs of experience as a Data Analyst / Scientist of ONLINE businesses?

Your main tasks will include supporting our marketing team with analysis of ongoing marketing campaigns (excel, dashboards etc) and Monitor business critical KPI's (revenue, costs, churn, conversion rates etc) and report to team and management. To succeed in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users.

Data Analyst Responsibilities:
• Support our marketing team with analysis of ongoing marketing campaigns (excel, dashboards etc)
• Understand how to make data visually appealing and simple to both navigate and comprehend for end-users
• Aggregate data from various sources to construct streamlined data pipelines and integrate data from multiple systems
• Identify key metrics and build exec-facing dashboards to track the progress of the business and its highest priority initiatives
• Identify key business levers, establish cause & effect, perform analyses, and communicate key findings to various stakeholders to facilitate data driven decision-making
• Work closely across the matrix with teams like Finance, Marketing, Product, Engineering and senior executives
• Monitor business critical KPI's (revenue, costs, churn, conversion rates etc) and report to team and management
• Call out when performance is changing, analyze, inform and act upon with the wider PPC team.
• Support PPC team in test analysis and performance, working closely with Insights & Analytics.
• Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.
• Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
• Performing requirements analysis.
• Working closely with the ad spend department and analyze their numbers

Data Analyst Requirements:
• A bachelor’s degree in Computer or related field or Math, Engineering.
• Experience with the following: Python, JavaScript, SQL, PHP
• Excellent understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms
• Demonstrated experience, familiarity and ease with handling large data sets and crunching numbers
• Information Retrieval (search/recommendation/classification) experience or Human Judgment/User Interface experience
• Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to translate complex problems into simpler terms, and effectively influence both peers and senior leadership
• A minimum of 5 years experience in data analysis or a related field.
• Must be talented at detecting patterns
• Master at using excel or google sheet
• Experience with Google Ads (familiar with interface and data sorting/report downloads) a huge plus (but not a requirement)
• Ambitious (we can provide long term career growth & self development)
• Very picky and accurate in all you do (you understand success is all in the details that 95% of people don't bother caring about)
• Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
• A track record of following through on commitments.
• Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
• A history of leading and supporting successful projects.
• Reliable & Trustworthy
• Stable & fast computer internet

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $4,000.00 - $6,000.00 per month

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):
• Please record a 1 or 2 min video or audio introduction using loom.com about yourself and your work experience and send it over to us .

Experience:
• Data analysis skills: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Job Title: Sr. Digital Insights Analyst

Duration: 12 Months (Temp to hire...

Location: Fully Remote

Description:

In this role, you will be responsible for providing Digital and Analytical Reporting, insights and data need by working with other marketing functions and building relationships across Marketing and BU owners. Understanding how data flows from multiple sources. Partnering with the enterprise and business leaders to identify the critical problems to help drive analytical solutions. Developing visualization reports, operational reporting, and providing insights to make business-critical decisions and supporting daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.

• Experience working independently

• Ability to discuss analytical needs with a business user

• Critical thinking to solve the business need

• Creative analytics visualization

• Strong Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills

• Collaborative across departments

• Organized and can multi-task

• Timely communication and meeting deadlines

Must Have
• Analyzing digital marketing data
• Excel, PowerPoint, Cognos, and Tableau
• Google Analytics
• GTM; Go to Marketing

Years of Experience : 3-5 Years

Type of Experience :

• 3+ years of experience working as an analyst in digital marketing

• Experience working on digital, business, or customer insights using data from Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics

• Providing insights to business partners using the extracted data

• Advanced SQL experience to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets from data warehouses like Snowflake

• Proficient with Tableau and familiar with Excel and PowerPoint

• Working with Retail data a plus

• Experienced with Agile methodology. Experience with JIRA a plus

• Experienced with Data Visualization tools and Web Analytics platforms (Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics).

• Ability to work with business, leadership, and technical teams

Percent of Time Spent on Task (1-100%)

1. Develop operational dashboards, and scorecards with advanced visualizations, collaborate with cross-functional business owners, and present actionable insights using various tools like Excel, PowerPoint, Cognos, and Tableau 25%

2. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand the business strategy and work towards supporting that by gathering the right data for analysis and applying compliance rules of 10%

3. Interpret financial and non-financial metrics, evaluate progress on initiatives and provide insights and recommendations to the Leadership Team 10%

4. Perform descriptive analyses using information from multiple data sources to answer business questions at 20%

5. Present findings to key stakeholders through the creation of PowerPoint and verbal presentations 10% 6. Develop presentation decks to represent findings and provide actionable insights to business users 10%

7. Work with cross-functional teams to identify relevant data sources, bring data sets together, perform data engineering, and develop, productional, and maintain analytical models to perform advanced and replicable analyses. 5%

8. Review and make recommendations for the improvement of our processes and technology by 10%

Additional requirements and description:

The position will involve working closely with IT and Data Management to understand the ingested data from Google Analytics into the data warehouse and to create and maintain documentation.

In addition, the following skills are a plus to be effective in managing the day-to-day activities while working with the owners of the different marketing vehicles like Social, PLA, LIA, and also with the Tagging and Data Collection team :

- Data studio and GA360 UI experience a plus

- Experience with GTM or other tagging tools a plus

- Experience with Glassbox a plus

title: Sr. BI & Data Analyst (DTJ)
description:
At Charles River, we are passionate about improving the quality of people’s lives. When you join our global family, you will help create healthier lives for millions of patients and their families.

Charles River employees are innovative thinkers, who are dedicated to continuous learning and improvement. We will empower you with the resources you need to grow and develop in your career...

As a Charles River employee, you will be part of an industry-leading, customer-focused company at the forefront of drug development. Your skills will play a key role in bringing life-saving therapies to market faster through simpler, quicker, and more digitalized processes. Whether you are in lab operations, finance, IT, sales, or another area, when you work at Charles River, you will be the difference every day for patients across the globe.

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Intelligence (BI) & Data Analyst for our Enterprise Data Analytics Team.
There’s never been a more exciting time to be on the Enterprise Data Analytics team at Charles River Labs! We are on a mission to make the Enterprise Data Analytics team be the backbone of today’s business, as data-driven decision-making enables business leaders to make informed choices quickly to boost revenue, improve productivity, and stay a step ahead of the market. We have already launched our own Enterprise Data Hub, the digital backbone of this company, and we need more experts and leaders in the data analytics discipline who are forward thinking, self-guided and innovative to continue to build out the hub across our lines of business, integrating all of our data, mastering data and focusing on data quality to fundamentally shift the way Charles River operates through data science and advanced analytics.

You will be joining a team with an unyielding dedication to the company purpose; Together We Create Healthier Lives. This laser focus on the patient makes the boarder Global Technology Team so exciting. As we look to our company’s future, we are embarking on a reimagination of how we do business through a Digital Journey. Our Digital Journey is about sustaining and advancing our position to unlock our next horizon of growth and become a leading ‘digitally-powered’ CRO enabling our clients to deliver innovative, safe, and effective treatments to patients as quickly and effectively as possible. In the process, we want to continue to be at the forefront of the drug development and discovery process, ultimately reducing the early-stage drug development timeline by a full year. Our collective focus over the coming, multi-year journey is to enable this extraordinary group of people - our 18,000 colleagues - to execute and achieve our ambitious business goals. We are taking Charles River to a place where Enterprise Data Analytics team will be applying the techniques of data management, data engineering, and strategy development, as well as the use of analytics techniques that range from forecasting and simulation to linear programming and optimization and we want you to join us.

This role will work collaboratively, in a consultative way, across the business units and IT, owning the modern analytics solutions that are built by the team, supporting and training business users, as well as advising on best approaches to solve business problems, automate manual solutions, or simply bring to life ‘the art of the possible’ leveraging modern analytics as a competitive advantage.

Job Responsibilities
•Engage Business Stakeholders at all levels to identify requirements for current and future products through ongoing interaction

•Data Profiling, mining, and data validation to ensure data is fit for use by the business

•Ability to see big picture and then identify key areas for deep analysis to support sound solutions

•Perform ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear and user-friendly manner

•Perform testing, resolve issues and work with developers to automate testing/data validation

•Lead requirements workshops and User Acceptance Testing for new data and analytics solutions

•Build strong business relationships that foster a collaborative and trusting approach and partnership

•Act as scrum master for the team and prepare detailed stories for developers

Job Qualifications

The following are minimum requirements related to the Senior Business Intelligent / Data Analyst position.
•BS/BA degree in Business Management, Computer Science (or related field), MBA Preferred

•7+ years of experience in writing SQL queries, data mining, data profiling, and data validation/testing

•7+ years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst / Data Analyst specializing in the Data & Analytics discipline

•7+ years of experience organizing and running User Acceptance Testing cycles and training with business users and stakeholders

•5+ years of experience with Data Governance processes to ensure consistent implementations of data sets, terminology and reporting structures for optimal data integrity

•5+ years of experience with Data Visualizations tools such as Power BI, SSRS, or Tableau

•3+ years of experience supporting users with OLAP solutions in SSAS (MDX or DAX)

•3+ years working in Agile Software Development Methodology

•Ability to translate requirements to well-written user stories to bridge the gap between business and technology

•Strong business mindset with ability to collaborate with business partners to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery

The following are strongly desired:
•Agile experience particularly as Certified Scrum Master or Product Owner

•Willingness to help mature Agile practices for the team and lead some ceremonies such as standups, sprint planning, sprint retrospectives, and backlog grooming

•Experience in Life Sciences industry with data and analytics solutions

•Experience with products using Advanced Analytics, ML, or AI capabilities

About Corporate Functions
The Corporate Functions provide operational support across Charles River in areas such as Human Resources, Finance, IT, Legal, Sales, Quality Assurance, Marketing, and Corporate Development. They partner with their colleagues across the company to develop and drive strategies and to set global standards. The functions are essential to providing a bridge between strategic vision and operational readiness, to ensure ongoing functional innovation and capability improvement.

About Charles River

Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.

With over 20,000 employees within 110 facilities in over 20 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world.

At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of 86% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2021.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Charles River Laboratories is an Equal Opportunity Employer - all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

If you are interested in applying to Charles River Laboratories and need special assistance or an accommodation due to a disability to complete any forms or to otherwise participate in the resume submission process, please contact a member of our Human Resources team by sending an e-mail message to crrecruitment_US@crl.com. This contact is for accommodation requests for individuals with disabilities only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

For more information, please visit

This employer is a corporate member of
myGwork - LGBTQ+ professionals, the business community for LGBTQ+ professionals,
students, inclusive employers & anyone who believes in workplace equality

title: Army Real Property Data Analyst
description:
Come join our diverse and innovative team and help our military achieve their mission! We have an immediate need to assist our military with a Real Property Analyst.

The ideal team member shall provide data analysis and training support to Department of Defense customers. The ideal candidate should be a great communicator with the ability to effectively describe complicated ideas to different... audiences. You must be highly organized and proficient in time management and must possess excellent writing and public speaking skills.

This position supports Army real property data analysis and user training objective for the Headquarters, Department of the Army. The ideal candidate will have a strong working knowledge of DoD and Army DPW operations and real property, GFEBS management concepts, including an understanding of the life cycle of a real property asset, an awareness with data elements and data types managed as part of the real property inventory, and a familiarity with real property guidance and directives (including DoD’s Real Property Information Model and Real Property Categorization System). The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated and highly organized individual seeking to provide high quality data analysis and decision support products to the HQDA and improve users’ understanding and knowledge of the real property inventory data and systems used to collect and report it.

Job Responsibilities:
• Provides subject matter expertise for data analysis, and the creation and maintenance of customized reports.
• Serves as a subject matter expert for mining and analyzing customer data.
• Engages in cross-team planning and education related to data analysis and data model concepts.
• Ensures compliance with service data models and recommend changes to structures as needed.
• Translates customer inquiries into requests for execution by systems personnel.
• Leads cross-functional teams, sometimes combining government and contract personnel, to achieve a desired goal.
• Develops, supports, or delivers training materials in a classroom or virtual environment.
• Prepares training materials such as module summaries, demonstrations, and presentations.
• Conduct training follow up and evaluations to identify areas of improvement.
• Organizes, directs, and manages contract operation support functions, involving multiple complex and inter-related project tasks.
• Maintains and manages the client interface at the senior levels of the client organization.
• Meets with customer and Contractor personnel to formulate and review task plans and deliverable items.
• Consults with customer and contractor personnel to formulate and review task plans and deliverables, ensuring conformance with program and project task schedules and costs and contractual obligations.

Benefits:

401(k)

401(k) matching

Dental insurance

Flexible schedule

Health insurance

Life insurance

Paid time off

Vision insurance
• US Citizen with active SECRET clearance
• Bachelor of Arts or Science
• Working knowledge of database concepts and tools, to include at least two years’ experience with Microsoft Access and SQL query language.
• Superior skills in written and oral communications using email and collaboration tools such as Microsoft Teams, presentations, public speaking, judgment, and facilitation with two or more years’ experience in formal training.
• Computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, SQL, PowerPoint, and Outlook are required

title: Data Analyst - Revenue Cycle Management
description:
At GenesisCare we want to hear from people who are as passionate as we are about innovation and working together to drive better life outcomes for patients around the world.

Purpose...

This position is responsible for creating, monitoring, maintaining, and supporting RCM application, reporting, and data processes. This position will work with additional GC IT departments and vendor IT departments to ensure required data processes are set up with the proper access, security, and frequency as determined by business requirements.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
• Create, monitor, and maintain all RCM SQL-driven processes, jobs, and data
• Create, monitor, and maintain all reporting produced by the RCM department
• Produce monthly RCM reporting packet for Operations department
• Assist with creation, monitoring, and maintenance of AutomationAnywhere processes managed by the RCM department
• Maintain documentation and data or process flow maps of RCM application, reporting, and data processes
• Maintain organization reference tables
• Provide project management support in driving progress of creation of new processes
• Coordinate data requirements and processes with vendors to facilitate vendor processes, including any cross-network file sharing
• Provide initial and supporting testing for RCM applications and processes when created or updated
• Other duties as assigned

Qualification Requirements
• Able to complete tasks, requirements, and goals under limited supervision with ability to understand and meet deadlines as workload necessitates
• Detail oriented and possesses excellent analytical skills
• Excellent organization skills
• Ensure applicable laws and regulations of working with confidential information are adhered to
• Consistently reports to work on time and prepared to perform duties of position
• Demonstrate flexible and efficient time management and ability to prioritize workload
• Communicate regularly with management about vendor or internal issues or opportunities

Education And/Or Experience
• 3 or more years of experience in role(s) which leveraged Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), including:
• creation and maintenance of stored procedures,
• creation and maintenance of jobs via SQL Server Agent
• creation and maintenance of packages via SSIS/SSRS.
• use of references, procedures, and other details across multiple databases, servers, and linked servers.
• Strong knowledge of transact-SQL and in researching language functions and parameters
• Knowledge of C# and in researching language functions and parameters
• Experience in a role where Excel reporting was produced as a pivot table or better
• Experience in role(s) which leveraged Microsoft Visual Studio
• Experience with a healthcare organization strongly preferred
• Experience using AutomationAnywhere preferred
• Experience with sFTP or FileZilla preferred
• Experience working with APIs, HL7s, and/or Mirth a plus
• High school graduate or equivalent

GenesisCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Budget Analyst - CTO
description:
OU Health Stephenson Cancer Center is Oklahoma's only National Cancer Institute (NCI)-Designated Cancer Center, and one of only 71 NCI-Designated Cancer Centers in the United States. This highly competitive accreditation ensures that our patients receive the highest standard of care and have access to the most advanced cancer treatment options.

At the Stephenson Cancer Center (SCC), we have an... exciting new job opportunity that could be right for you! The Budget Analyst - Clinical Trials Office (CTO) is responsible for providing professional-level assistance to the Budget Oce to evaluate business, operational, and technology practices and processes in order to enhance the quality and delivery of services to the University. This position assists with implementation of specic budgetary functions, to include but not limited to comparative and analytical report production and assisting with preparation and production of the annual operating budget.

Learn more about the Stephenson Cancer Center's Clinical Trials Office here.

Duties:
• Assists the Budget Oce to perform analysis of operations management information and transactions and provides interpretation of trends
• Assists the Budget Oce to identify opportunities and explore new approaches for process improvement and innovation, operational eciencies and savings which may include re-engineering existing business processes, redesign of workow, and recommend feasible IT solutions
• Assists with integrating processes and roles within the organization to maximize operating results
• Assists with launching and managing process optimization and redesign projects and other performance enhancement initiatives
• Assists with aligning business strategies with processes so that strategies are more quickly implemented and objectives achieved
• Assists the Budget Oce with creating viable process transition plans that detail how the organization will eectively move from the present to the revised state
• Assists with coordinating cross-functional eorts to focus on core process performance, strategic objectives, and customer satisfaction
• Assists with preparing analytical and statistical reports including budget data analysis, comparative studies, FTE reports, budget data projections, and State Regents reports for internal and external use
• Assists with preparing and producing the Annual Needs Request document for presentation to the University and State Regents through the design and use of customized electronic spreadsheets
• Assists with coordinating and overseeing the guideline preparation, scheduling, on-line data entry and verication, and production of Annual Operating Budget and associated increase analysis reports
• Assists with verifying and approving funding on appointment and change of status forms as well as budgetary transfers
• Interfaces with Budget Unit Heads and Dean's Oces campus-wide to communicate procedures, problems, or provide assistance, which can be rendered by the Budget Oce
• Perform various duties as needed to successfully fulll the function of the position

Education: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or other business-related field

Experience: 12 months experience in auditing, budget, accounting, or other business position

Equivalency/Substitution Will accept 48 months of related experience in lieu of the Bachelor's degree for a total of 60 months of related experience

Skills:
• Strong analytical, problem solving, decision making, interpersonal, communication and project management skills
• Signicant exposure to various operational and managerial workplace models
• Well-developed numerical skills, including the ability to perform complex nancial analyses
• Sound understanding of the principles of nance, valuation techniques, and nancial statement analysis
• Working knowledge of the technology marketplace and of available technology products and business solutions
• Fluent PC skills, including the ability to utilize basic oce and various other analytical software applications

Working Conditions:
• Physical: Sit for prolonged periods. Manual Dexterity. Use of a computer and answer telephones/
• Environmental: Standard Office Environment

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: The University of Oklahoma, in compliance with all applicable federal and state laws and regulations, does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, age, religion, disability, political beliefs, or status as a veteran in any of its policies, practices, or procedures. This includes, but is not limited to, admissions, employment, financial aid, housing, services in educational programs or activities, and health care services that the University operates or provides.

Diversity Statement: The University of Oklahoma is committed to achieving a diverse, equitable, and inclusive university community by recognizing each person's unique contributions, background, and perspectives. The University of Oklahoma strives to cultivate a sense of belonging and emotional support for all, recognizing that fostering an inclusive environment for all is vital in the pursuit of academic and inclusive excellence in all aspects of our institutional mission

Experience with Python, R, or another scripting language.

Ability to facilitate experimentation and

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
HTC Global Services wants you. Come build new things with us and advance your career. At HTC Global you'll collaborate with experts. You'll join successful teams contributing to our clients' success. You'll work side by side with our clients and have long-term opportunities to advance your career with the latest emerging technologies.

At HTC Global Services our consultants have access to a... comprehensive benefits package. Benefits can include Paid-Time-Off, Paid Holidays, 401K matching, Life and Accidental Death Insurance, Short- & Long-Term Disability Insurance, and a variety of other perks.
• * Please note this is role is onsite from day one in the Washington, DC area, remote will not work here **

Scope of work:
• Capture data, reporting and analytic requirements for financial data sets which include financial investment Operations Data, loan and equity accounting data sets, financial expenses and revenue data, treasury data and other financial data sets.
• Perform data analysis, data lineage, and profiling of data from source system to data repositories and reports. Responsible for data mapping to any “to-be” data structures.
• Create specifications for Reporting requirements and work with business users to elicit hidden requirements and clarify vague requirements, as well as ensure sign offs on requirements.
• Interact with technical teams and guide offshore development resources to help translate requirements into solutions. Responsible for providing functional and technical guidance to the development team.
• Coordinate user acceptance testing of reports and data driven solutions by working with the business users.
• Assist the Program Managers with tracking work program deliverables using the appropriate SDLC methodologies including agile scrum.
• Manage daily technical challenges and communicates to management any risks or issues.
• Develop, manage, and maintain processes, procedures, and documentation for handover to application support.

Skills/Experience Required:
• Minimum 10+ yrs. of relevant experience and master's degree plus required industry certificates; or bachelor's degree and 12+ years of relevant experience.
• Experienced IT professional working on large data and reporting applications as well a strong understanding of Operational data stores, Data Warehouses and/or Data Marts.
• Should have participated in data implementation efforts with exposure to relational database concepts, ETL fundamentals, transaction processing, and testing protocols.
• Shows an understanding of data management concepts – data quality, data lineage, data lifecycle, master/reference data management, metadata management.
• Ability to understand the meaning of the data and work cohesively with business to leverage it for better and advanced insights. Domain knowledge with accounting and financial data sets is essential.
• Has strong analytic, problem solving and logical reasoning skills with high attention to detail and the ability to multi-task.
• Proficient in the use of PL/SQL and ability to read data models, infer data flows and write complex queries.
• Hands on experience with reporting tools (like Power BI, SAP BO, Tableau).
• Excellent skills in analyzing data, gathering requirements, and working with clients and technical teams to translate requirements into solution.
• Familiarity in using agile tools such as Azure DevOps.
• Strong project management skills with a process orientation (understand problem, do analysis, interview stakeholders, write requirements, get sign off, hand off to dev, coordinate UAT etc.) and ability to leverage Agile concepts.
• Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals.

Find a purpose.

Help clients embrace emerging technologies. Create inventive solutions and meet intriguing client challenges. Solve, fix, design and innovate. Be a part of something bigger by helping clients go digital, create engaging customer experiences and transform their business.

Move ahead.

Our success as a company is built on practicing inclusion and embracing diversity. HTC Global Services is committed to providing a work environment free from discrimination and harassment, where all employees are treated with respect and dignity. Together we work to create and maintain an environment where everyone feels valued, included, and respected. At HTC Global Services, our differences are embraced and celebrated. HTC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

HTC is proud to be recognized as a National Minority Supplier and an equal opportunity employer of protected veterans.

About HTC Global Services

Shaping careers since 1990 - our long tenured employees are a testimony of the work culture. Join our global employee base of 12,000 and help us bring human expertise to tech in order to deliver purposeful solutions that amplify value
