title: Data Analyst
description:
CompanyPropak Logistics
Job TitleData Analyst
Job Description...

The Data Analyst turns data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. They conduct full life-cycle activities including performing requirements analysis and design, developing analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Reasonable Accommodations Statement

To accomplish this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation, each essential function satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to help enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Functions Statement(s)
• Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
• Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
• Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databased/data systems.
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
• Filter and clean data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
• Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
• Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
• Utilize technical expertise regarding data models, data design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
• Help to build a data warehouses for reporting needs.
• Supervise ETL processes from transactional databases to reporting databases.
• Build reports and visualizations for executives and users to run their respective business units.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

Competency Statement(s)
• Communication, Written/Oral - Ability to communicate effectively with others using the spoken word and in writing.
• Customer Oriented - Ability to take care of the customers' needs while following company procedures.
• Detail Oriented - Ability to pay attention to the minute details of a project or task.
• Interpersonal - Ability to get along well with a variety of personalities and individuals.
• Organized - Possessing the trait of being organized or following a systematic method of performing a task.
• Technical Aptitude - Ability to comprehend complex technical topics and specialized information.
• Time Management - Ability to utilize the available time to organize and complete work within given deadlines.

Site Phone Number
LocationInformation Technology - Systems
Requirements

Education: Bachelor's Degree (4-year college or technical school): Preferred, Field of Study: Information Systems, Computer Science, or related degree

Experience: 1+ years of Data Analyst experience

Certifications & Licenses: Valid Driver's License

Other Requirements:
• Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques
• Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), and programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
• Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (Excel, SAS, R, etc.)
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings

Propak Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request, by contacting Hiring@Propak.com . The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

Propak fosters a culture and environment where everyone feels welcome and can thrive. We are deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, including attracting, retaining, and promoting diverse talent across our company. We live in a diverse world, with different ideas and perspectives that come together to spark new ideas and make great things happen

title: Data Analyst
description:
As Data Analyst at Corbion, you will be accountable for generating accurate global procurement reports by managing and analyzing large data sets from various sources. You will be a strong member of a team of 4 data analysts who work closely to exceed our internal partner's expectations. Our ideal candidate is a team player with strong inter-personal skills, but also can work independently. If you... are a self-starter with a continuous improvement mindset who can manage multiple projects and demands, this might be a great role for you

This position is based at our Lenexa, KS office and reports to the Manager, Procurement Data and Process .

Responsibilities:
• Create innovative ways to report and tell a story with data; manipulate global data sets into standard reports
• Manage multiple projects with minimal oversight
• Provide internal customers reliable information in a structured and systematic way
• Ensure LX contracts and quotes are accurately, consistently maintained
• Create purchase orders and place orders for non-product related items and services based on approved procurement procedures
• Report on current contract positions, pricing, and global spend in a timely and efficient manner
• Stand as North America Operations contact for contract management

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in business or related field
• 3+ years of experience in an analytical position
• Ability to create reporting solutions with minimal guidance and innovatively present complex data to internal and external teams
• Working knowledge of procurement processes and ability to lead procurement projects
• Advanced skills in Excel, LX systems and database platforms
• Visual Basic and/or Sequel experience preferred

At Corbion, we exist to champion preservation in all its forms, preserving food and food production, health, and our planet.

About Corbion

Corbion is the global market leader in lactic acid and its derivatives, and a leading supplier of emulsifiers, functional enzyme blends, minerals, vitamins, and algae ingredients. We use our unique expertise in fermentation and other processes to deliver sustainable solutions for the preservation of food and food production, health, and our planet. For over 100 years, we have been uncompromising in our commitment to safety, quality, innovation and performance. Drawing on our deep application and product knowledge, we work side-by-side with customers to make our cutting-edge technologies work for them. Our solutions help differentiate products in markets such as food, home & personal care, animal nutrition, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and bioplastics. In 2019, Corbion generated annual sales of € 976.4 million and had a workforce of 2,138 FTEs. Corbion is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. For more information:

Corbion is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workplace. All applicants will be considered equally without regard to race, color, ethnicity, veteran status, religion, national origin, marital status, political affiliation, age, sex, sexual orientation, handicapping condition, membership in an organization or any other non-merit factors.

Corbion provides reasonable accommodation to applicants

EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

Corbion does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers. All candidates must be submitted by approved Corbion vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Talent Acquisition team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Corbion Talent Acquisition team and such candidate was submitted to the Corbion Talent Acquisition Team

title: Data Analyst- Provider Relations
description:
Job Description

Community Health Systems is one of the nation’s leading healthcare providers. Developing and operating healthcare delivery systems in 48 distinct markets across 16 states, CHS is committed to helping people get well and live healthier. CHS affiliates 82 operate acute-care hospitals and more than 1,000 other sites of care, including physician practices, urgent care centers... freestanding emergency departments, occupational medicine clinics, imaging centers, cancer centers and ambulatory surgery centers.

Community Health Systems is one of the nation’s leading healthcare providers. Developing and operating healthcare delivery systems in 48 distinct markets across 16 states, CHS is committed to helping people get well and live healthier. CHS affiliates 82 operate acute-care hospitals and more than 1,000 other sites of care, including physician practices, urgent care centers, freestanding emergency departments, occupational medicine clinics, imaging centers, cancer centers and ambulatory surgery centers.

Summary:

The Provider Relations Data Analyst role provides business analysis services and project support to Provider Relations through reporting, data analysis and dashboard development/management. The focus of this position is to work closely with Provider Relations to gain in-depth understanding of processes, operational and reporting needs while helping to identify opportunities and to improve alignment. The individual in this role uses strong problem solving, analytical and technical knowledge to develop data-driven alignment dashboards, reports, and analytics that drive strategy and execution. Serves as the dedicated internal and external data SME to track, report, and support future Provider Relations activities and initiatives using organizational metrics. This Analyst will help in developing and maintaining new and existing reporting and models, along with recommending and implementing data-driven solutions.

Responsibilities of this role will include but is not limited to:
• Develop customized analytical reports/dashboards
• Management and analysis of internal and external data sets
• Design queries, reports, and dashboards to assist leaders and team members in understanding historic and current metrics as well as predictive analysis
• Monitor and evaluate effectiveness of performance by tracking and trending data sets
• Provide ongoing reporting to the entire Provider Relations team
• Analyze business process flows and impact on technology flows
• Collaborate with Provider Relations leadership and other partners to ensure data integrity and develop appropriate auditing tools, reports and analysis methodologies
• Maintain, enhance, and streamline standardized reporting to ensure team members have timely, relevant, and accessible information and our processes are efficient and legally compliant
• Synthesize information from various data sets, develops actionable reports, to enable the Provider Relations team to make key strategic decisions in a timely manner
• Attend meetings and daily communication sessions to keep abreast of project objectives, process workflows and progress of business concepts

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university required.
• Experience managing data information systems, creating automated workflows, and developing communications required.
• Demonstrated proficiency working with databases, spreadsheets and reporting data
• Excellent writing and communication skills
• Google Platforms experience – required
• Proficiency in Google Sheets, including formulas and functions.
• Proficiency in Google Forms
• Familiarity of Google Data Studio, data structures and data connectors
• Promotes information sharing
• Ability to work within tight time-frames and meet strict deadlines
• Demonstrates analytical skills
Physical Demands:In order to successfully perform this job, with or without a reasonable accommodation, the following are outlined below:
1. The Employee is required to read, review, prepare and analyze written data and figures, using a PC or similar, and should possess visual acuity.

2. The Employee may be required to occasionally climb, push, stand, walk, reach, grasp, kneel, stoop, and/or perform repetitive motions.

3. The Employee is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions and; therefore, job functions are typically performed under conditions such as those found within general office or administrative work.

Apply Now

title: Data Analyst II (Healthcare Analytics/UM/Appeals)
description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.
Position Purpose: Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and... influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.
• Applicants for this job have the flexibility to work remote from home, preferred locations EST or CST timezone *
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims, provider, member, and encounters data. Identify and assess the business impact of trends
Develop, execute, maintain, and troubleshoot complex scripts and reports developed using SQL, Microsoft Excel, or other analytics tools
Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers
Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines and thrive in a demanding, quickly changing environment
Support the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products
Support multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required
Education/Experience:
Bachelor s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Working knowledge of SQL/query languages. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI.
Experience in emerging trend analysis, financial modeling, claims pricing, contract/network analysis, and/or ROI evaluation preferred. Familiarity with claims payment, utilization management, provider/vendor contracts, risk adjustment for government sponsored healthcare desired.
Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.
Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Data Analyst IV Healthcare Analytics
description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members.
Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time.
As a diversified, national organization, you ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility...

Position Purpose:
Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions.
Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.
Lead the planning and execution of large-scale projects and new reporting tools, translating business goals into actionable solutions
Identify and resolve data, process, and technical issues and communicate root-cause with stakeholders as appropriate
Partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with business leaders to understand market-specific levers and constraints
Leverage enterprise reporting tools to rapidly deliver data-driven insights and recommendations
Research key business problems and proactively identify opportunities for cost and utilization improvements through quantitative analysis
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required
Mentor junior analysts on analytic best practices and business need fulfilment.
Delegate tasks to junior analysts, providing guidance and validation where required Education/Experience:

Bachelor s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience.
Master's degree preferred.
5+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management or 3+ years IT experience.
Healthcare analytics experience preferred.
Experience with table creation and indexing, query optimization, and utilization of stored procedures.
Working knowledge of SQL/querying languages.
Experience with table creation and indexing, query optimization, and utilization of stored procedures.
Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R.
Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred.
Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI

Provider
Experience in provider contracting, claims pricing, financial reporting/analysis, data modeling, statistical modeling, data science, or geospatial/reimbursement analysis preferred

Regional and HBR Analytics
Experience in emerging trend analysis, financial modeling, claims pricing, contract/network analysis, and/or ROI evaluation preferred.
Familiarity with claims payment, utilization management, provider/vendor contracts, risk adjustment for government sponsored healthcare desired.

Clinical
Experience in public health (epidemiology, biostatistics), population health, social determinants of health, data science, social science, or geospatial/ROI/financial analysis preferred

Finance
Experience in Finance, Actuarial Science, or Accounting preferred.
Experience using analytic techniques & tools to explore financial performance trends and/or reconciling financial data preferred.

Fraud, Waste & Abuse
Experience in fraud/waste/abuse identification and investigation, provider billing, or clinical coding preferred; Experience with data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence, or statistical modeling preferred

Risk Adjustment
Experience in risk adjustment, clinical coding, financial reporting/analysis, or CMS/State encounters and regulatory file submissions preferred; Experience with data mining, population health, and statistical modeling preferred

Quality
Experience with HEDIS, NCQA, Medicare Star Rating System, QRS, or other quality measures preferred; Quality auditing or analysis of call center performance preferred; Experience with data mining, population health, and statistical modeling preferred

Tools & Technology
Experience with report/dashboard development, data/report automation, self-service capabilities, data design and integration, or data quality and governance preferred

Our Comprehensive Benefits Package:
Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different.

Our stores are currently located throughout Oklahoma and we are expanding into Arkansas with new stores expected to open later this year.

With our company growth, we have a need to expand our IT Department and we are looking for the right person to join our team as a Data Analyst. title: Data Analyst
description:
The data analyst will perform data analysis, maintain current reports, and implement new reports.

Tasks...

• Maintain, update, and optimize the company's routine reports in SAS.

• Create and maintain data visualization reports on Power BI and Domo.

• Perform business data analysis to provide insights and recommendations across the Customer Lifecycle - Acquisition, Underwriting, Authorization, Retention, and Collections. Support the development of predictive models.

• Implement new reports as requested.

• Ad hoc support to management or business partners.

• Provide data analysis support to other departments.

Basic Qualifications

• Bachelor of Science in a related quantitative field (Math, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, etc.) or equivalent work experience

• Experience in statistical analysis environments such as SAS or Python Knowledge of statistics, econometrics, and other quantitative methods; experience in performing data analysis and interpreting results.

• Self-driven with attention to detail and follow-through on tasks.

• Fast learner, self-learner, proactive, and used to a hands-off management style.

• Advanced proficiency in MS Excel, Word, Project, and PowerPoint required

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
Job Description:

Vendor Management Center (VMC): Responsible for all administrative and audit related functions for Third Party Vendors servicing our domestic Global Network Operations team. Manages workload distribution, job due dates and change controls as well as audit functions related to both work completed and invoicing to ensure both timely and accurate delivery and billing of work by our... vendor partners.

General Duties Vendor Management Center

Duties many include but are not limited to the follow:
• Ensuring accurate work load distribution and on-time process and completion by our vendor partners. Develop action and remediation plans with Vendors to address any backlogged or past due work or projects to ensure their timely completion.
• Works with internal parties and vendors to validate and correct work request descriptions and details. Ensure appropriate stakeholders are aware of and approve changes requested by Vendors.
• Issues regular audit requests on completed vendor work to ensure compliance with Client's specifications and local codes. Collects and reviews audit forms and performance reporting metrics for vendors at market and national levels to build Vendor Score Card reports. Provides score card results to management for further analysis and planning.
• Historically track all Vendor performance data at market, region and national levels. Identify improvement opportunities based on historical trending analysis.
• Review vendor invoice requests for accuracy based on jobs assigned, completed and job unit pricing. Address any inaccuracies with Vendor and Stakeholder parties (Client's Engineering, Field Operations, etc)
• Ensure approved invoices are paid to vendors in a timely fashion by responsible parties.
• Review performance analytics, vendor and Field Operations feed to identify potential contract improvements and other areas of opportunities.
• Basic Qualifications Vendor Management Center
• Tests Results obtained in interviews and tests for this position must meet minimum requirements established by the company, in accordance with company policy.
• Requires a comprehensive knowledge of telecommunication equipment, processes and systems as well as department policies and procedures.
• Must have excellent written and verbal skills.
• Must present a cordial and professional image of our company when working with various partners.
• Must have comprehensive knowledge of MS Office or similar software to build and maintain spreadsheets, presentations and other required documents.
• Must be a self-starter, highly organized and able to learn on your own. Must be a team player.
• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Requires additional instructions and some guidance on new or more complex assignments. Provides direction and guidance to less experienced team mates.
• Performs complex administrative and analytical duties as needed. Follows standard procedure and guidelines. Uses individual expertise to solve more complex problems.
• Associates degree in related field (project management, telecommunications, electronics e.g.) and 3-6 years of job related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience required.
• Desktop computer skills are essential.
• May be required to work day, evening, night and weekend shifts as well as overtime and holidays as required.
Compensation

The pay rate range above is the base hourly pay range that Aditi Consulting reasonably expects to pay someone for this position (compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including but not limited to, a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience, location and end client requirements).
Benefits and Ancillaries

Medical, dental, vision, PTO benefits and ancillaries may be available for eligible Aditi Consulting employees and vary based on the plan options selected by the employee

title: Data Analyst-Parts
description:
Data Analyst-Parts

Textron Aviation •...

Wichita, Kansas, United States

Position Type:

Share

Job Description:

JOB SUMMARY:

This position supports the Parts and Distribution organization in developing and optimizing strategic initiatives by generating actionable insights and recommendations from internal and external data. Data Analysts support business growth by using business intelligence software and tools to mine complex data, identify historic trends, and visualize large datasets. Data Analysts play a critical role in data governance, helping to create and maintain data standards and quality.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Performs data analysis via various data-mining and statistical techniques to gain insights from data to support business objectives.
• Serves as an internal consultant to business leaders by conducting regular and ad-hoc analyses to convert data into strategic assets.
• Collaborate cross functionally to develop and implement new processes
• Collects, manages, analyzes and interprets large volumes of data while ensuring a high level of data quality. Leverage tools to develop and maintain curated data sets for use in analysis
• Develop and maintain data reports measuring daily business activities in PowerBi, Alteryx, and other tools using query languages and formula libraries such as SQL and DAX
• Identify and acquire new data sources to further inform market intelligence and pricing strategy
• Work to improve data quality within TAPD by assisting Data Governance efforts in creating and maintaining data quality standards
• Provide recommendations to the business for new initiatives to support business objectives
• Interface with other data professionals throughout the organization to embrace cross functional growth in analytics capabilities

Job Requirements:

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor’s degree required in Business Administration, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Data Analytics, or other related field

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Drive and desire to excel in an autonomous environment
• Bias for action – ability to take initiative and act on curiosities
• Highly organized with strong attention to detail and ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects
• Ability to identify relevant metrics and present technical data to a broad audience
• Desire and ability to learn and leverage new software tools and processes in a self learning environment
• Preferred experience with PowerBi, Tableau, or other data visualization software
• Preferred experience with R, Python, SQL or Alteryx
• Strong skills with MS Office including Excel and PowerPoint

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.

Share

(Job and company information not to be copied, shared, scraped, or otherwise disseminated/distributed without explicit consent of JSfirm, LLC)

title: IT Data Governance Senior Analyst
description:
Our values define us and our culture inspires us to change lives for the better. Our employees are the heart and soul of our company, and every success we experience begins with them. Together we are committed to making a positive impact in our local communities. We champion a culture of continuous learning, work-life integration, and inclusion. We promote a digitally enabled work environment to... continuously enhance the experience of our employees and customers.

As a Data Governance Senior Analyst, you will play an important role in executing data governance-based activities such as leading committee sessions and working groups, development of data governance policies and standards, and their enforcement, and influencing the adoption and implementation of data governance and quality throughout the corporation. You will partner with data stewards and data owners, to ensure that they have the support and knowledge to embed data governance practices as a fundamental part of their processes. You will leverage third-party data governance tools to ensure data governance is integrated into the fabric of the corporation.
• Supervise the work of the Data Governance Analysts and review documents created by the committees, working groups, and analysts. Report to the executive council and review the entirety of the data governance program in front of business leaders. Help design and advise on data governance best practices with respect to the data governance program. Advise on which policies and standards must be addressed, and know how to address them. Supervise key meetings with key lines of business and IT.
• Responsible for leading root cause analysis for key data issues, helping to bridge the gap between IT and business. Responsible for defining what key metrics should be measured to evaluate the progress of data governance. Lead groups comprised of data governance, data quality, data engineering, data architecture, data visualization, and all lines of business to develop, implement, and enforce policies, standards, best practices, and procedures.
• Oversee Data Governance Tool, implement best practices, and engage data stewards across the organization to ensure collaboration and oversight for company data assets.
• Lead working groups to execute the direction of data-related committees. Participate in data-related programs or initiatives and engage necessary stakeholders. Responsible for profiling of critical data elements and establishing the associated business rules, as well as maintaining data artifacts such as data dictionary, data glossary, reference data, and other relevant sources.

Education

Bachelor Degree or the equivalent experience. Specialty IT, Data, Information Systems. (Required)

Master Degree or the equivalent experience. Specialty Business, Management, IT, Data, Information Systems. (Preferred)

Experience

5 or more years data governance or working in-depth with data in a business setting. (Required)

Certifications

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Data governance certification from an accredited affiliation. (Preferred)
• SQL Mgmt. Studio, data quality, data governance, databases, and understanding of data architecture and related standards (Preferred)
• Business subject matter expertise that can lead a group of business and IT staff to the right solution when it comes to data standards (Required)
• Excellent communications skills and foresight. (Required)

This role may perform other job duties as assigned by the manager. Each employee of the Organization, regardless of position, is accountable for reading, understanding and acting on the contents of all Company-assigned and/or job related Compliance Programs, regulations and policies and procedures, as well as ensure that all Compliance Training assignments are completed by established due dates. This includes but is not limited to, understanding and identifying compliance risks impacting their department(s), ensuring compliance with applicable laws or regulations, and escalating compliance risks to the appropriate level of management.

As a condition of employment, individuals must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship for a work visa by Fulton Bank currently or in the future.

Fulton Bank (“Fulton”) is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all qualified persons. Fulton will recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles, and ensure that all other personnel actions are administered, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, gender, gender identity, age, genetic information, marital status, disability, covered veteran status, or any other legally protected status

title: Data reporting analyst
description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time.

As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility...

Position Purpose : Responsible for analytic data needs of the business unit. Handle complex data projects and acts as a lead for other Data Analysts.
• Provide advanced analytical support for business operations within Workday and external reporting.
• Extract, load, model, and reconcile large amounts of data across multiple system platforms and sources within Workday.
• Review data to determine operational impacts and needed actions; elevate issues, trends, areas for improvement and opportunities to management.
• Develop reports and deliverables and make recommendations to management
• Model data using MS Excel
• Assist management in driving business decisions based on data
• Ensure compliance with federal and state deliverable reporting requirements by performing data quality audits and analysis.
• Assist with training and mentoring other Data Analysts.

6+ years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience. Workday experience Required. Workday Reporting, Prism Analytics and Integration knowledge.

Modules : Core HCM, Recruit, Benefits and Comp are a plus to know. Healthcare experience preferred but not required. Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Analysis within Workday and Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access.

Experience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementation.Our Comprehensive Benefits Package : Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Last updated : 2023-02-06

2. calculate following basic stats and graphs

- how unique emails are used

- what is the average # of unique emails that log in per week

- make a graph that shows the # of logins by day

- make a line graph that shows the # of times each unique email logged in

- pie chart of which browsers are used and which operating system

description:
MUST HAVE STRONG COMPANIES – INSURANCE/BANKING/FINANCIAL SERVICES/LARGE ENTERPRISE COMPANIES:

Remote anywhere in US is OK...

Summary:

The Data Analyst for the Information Security Office (ISO) will work within the ISO Governance and Engagement Team to assist in developing data visualizations, reporting, and communications for the Information Security Office.

?

Primary Responsibilities:
• Aggregate data and assist with creating reports to depict Information Security Program performance, maturity, and quantification of risk
• Data analysis and report creation in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI Desktop
• Data extracts and updates to the ISO Customer Regulatory Inquiry Team database and ServiceNow repository
• Assistance with ISO communication efforts, including messaging and delivery

?

Required Skills:
• Bachelors' Degree required:
• Excellent Excel, Power BI Desktop, JIRA, and PowerPoint skills required:
• PowerQuery and DAX coding skills:
• Knowledge and/or experience working within cybersecurity:
• Ability to work with stakeholders to develop solutions that meet or exceed expectations and deliver value
• Enjoy discovering and solving problems; proactively seeking clarification of requirements and direction; relentless about data quality; being a self-starter who takes responsibility when required
• Strong verbal and written communication skills, especially the ability to translate technical details into concise messaging easily understood by all audiences
• Demonstrated ability to produce quality work at a rapid pace and manage multiple tasks effectively

• Experience with Service Now Asset Management
• Experience with executive-level report creation
• Experience with drafting and editing communications copy and material

title: Quality Data Analyst, Tulsa Manufacturing
description:
Whirlpool Corporation (NYSE:
WHR) is the world s leading kitchen and laundry appliance company, with approximately $19 billion in annual sales, 78,000 employees and 57 manufacturing and technology research centers in 2020. The company markets Whirlpool, KitchenAid, Maytag, Consul, Brastemp, Amana, Bauknecht, JennAir, Indesit and other major brand names in nearly every country throughout the... world.

Whirlpool Corporation is consistently recognized by FORTUNE as one of the World s Most Admired Companies. Our values are the driving force behind everything we do. Integrity, Respect, Inclusion & Diversity, One Whirlpool, and Spirit of Winning propel our teams to excellence. Get to know us and see what it's like to be part of a company that is in constant pursuit of improving life at home.

Quality Data Analyst - Tulsa Manufacturing

Functional Overview

Whirlpool is seeking qualified candidates for the position of Analyst, Engineering within the Plant Quality organization reporting directly to the Quality Management System Leader. The position is located at our Tulsa, OK. The primary function of this role is to analyze data from our corporate systems to create and update weekly and monthly reports from our internal and external quality metrics. Maintain and create dashboards to manage our quality metrics and provide claim data analysis to calculate benefit / savings for Quality improvement projects.

Job Responsibilities
• Collaborate with other support functions (Safety, Operations, Materials, Engineering, Human Resources) to collect and interpret performance data in order to drive quality
• Calculate and monitor various quality metrics to ensure plant knowledge, accountability, and delivery of commitments
• Lead recoding activity through ensuring consistency of data and driving improvement of received Service Incident Rate (SIR) data
• Participate actively in regular operations and supplier reviews to ensure that supplier quality performance is properly reflected, understood, and receives appropriate responsiveness and support for improvement
• Ensure that job responsibilities are timely and accurately carried out and nurture a high level of teamwork and performance
• Retrieve data from multiple sources and be able to present analyses in form of charts, graphs, heat maps, among other formats
• Track First Pass Yield (FPY) issues to identify and highlight top Issues
• Manage Customer Assurance Lab (CAL - final line audit) failure report system
• Identify external emerging issues from our Early Warning system
• Manage multiple tasks and provide frequent oral/written communication to supervisor or related departments
• Demonstrate leadership through the development of lean activities to help drive both daily work and long-term improvements
• Responsible for day-to-day quality activities supporting Whirlpool s implementation of the industry leading World Class Manufacturing initiative (WCM)

Minimum Requirements
• Bachelor's Degree in Applied Science or Engineering
• 1
years of experience in a manufacturing environment
• 1
years of experience with statistics and data analysis

Preferred Requirements
• Master s Degree in Applied Science or Engineering
• Experience in working on Excel (V-lookup, Pivot Table, Advanced Formulae, Macros), Google Spreadsheets, Google Data Studio, Google Apps, Tableau and others
• Knowledge of SQL databases, should be able to write queries (SELECT, JOIN, Window functions, Aggregate Functions)
• World Class Manufacturing (WCM) experience
• Six Sigma Green/Black Belt and/or CQE certification
• 5
years experience in Quality role in a manufacturing environment
• 5 Why, Kaizen, Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA)
• Outstanding people skills, with the specific ability to interact as a lead player, apply critical thinking, make decisions, and conflict resolution
• Dynamic self-starter with ability to work independently and with cross functional teams
• Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills, and the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization, global team members, and the supply base
• Skilled to lead and manage multiple quality projects with minimum supervision
• Experience managing multiple assignments concurrently
• Value diversity of ideas, opinions, experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives needed to foster a competitive global business environment
RSRWH

Connect with us and learn more about Whirlpool Corporation

See what it's like to work at Whirlpool by visiting Whirlpool Careers. Additional information about the company can be found on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and YouTube.

At Whirlpool Corporation, we value and celebrate diversity. Whirlpool Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any discrimination on the basis of race or ethnicity, religion, sex, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable law.
Estimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications

title: Senior IT Analyst (Enterprise Data)
description:
Job Summary

As a part of the enterprise data team, the Data Analyst works directly with stakeholders on a variety of data-related projects and grow data literacy across the organization. The ideal candidate enjoys working in a dynamic team environment using a modern technology stack to design and develop creative data solutions...

Performs a wide variety of tasks; contributes to process improvements. Leads the work of small project teams; may formally train less experienced team members. Comprehensive knowledge of fundamental theories, principles and practices in the area of specialization. Identifies possible solutions for problems/issues of diverse scope using existing solutions. Works under general supervision.

Duties and Responsibilities
• Partner with business and IT stakeholders to build data-driven solutions that inform the decision-making process
• Collaborate with application administrators and owners to understand how product capabilities can be applied to create innovative solutions
• Understand and support the enterprise data strategy
• Design and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize data use and quality
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Work with data engineers to gather, organize, and prepare data
• Create, maintain, and optimize data solutions using reporting/analysis tools, cloud data stores, and on-prem databases
• Root-cause and resolve data issues within the enterprise data platform and delivery solutions
• Work with management to prioritize and communicate development needs and status
• Understand data/software usage patterns and identify opportunities to improve user experience
• Identify and define process/technology improvement opportunities
• Personal commitment to inclusion and diversity
• Other duties as assigned.

Skills and Competencies
• Strong communication skills, both written and oral
• Highly analytical with ability to understand, document, and communicate business requirements
• Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst on multiple project teams
• Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, and data mining techniques
• Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Spotfire, Business Objects, Power BI, etc.) and relational databases (SQL, Oracle, etc)
• Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, R Scripting, Python, etc.)
• Adept at data gathering, database queries, report writing, and presentation
• Ability to develop rapid, hands-on data and analytics prototypes that can transition to enterprise-grade solutions
• Aptitude to learn new concepts and technologies quickly and with minimal direction
• Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
• Drives results - Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances.
• Demonstrates self-awareness - Using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses.

Required Qualifications
• At least five (5) years of recent related experience working in a data analyst or technical business analyst role
• At least three (3) years of experience developing reports using Spotfire, Power BI, or equivalent software; and developing relational database queries, views, and stored procedures
• Experience with large, complex initiatives working with an in-house development team or commercial off the shelf application implementations and software vendors

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, MIS or a related field from an accredited College or University
• Preferred experience with business solutions common in the Oil and Gas Industry, such as: Procount / eVIN / Carte, Peloton Wellview, Aries, OFM, SAP ECC and PRA, Allegro

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
• Requires prolonged sitting, some bending and stooping.
• Occasional lifting, up to 25 pounds.
• Manual dexterity sufficient to operate a computer keyboard and calculator.

Continental Resources, Inc. provides equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

Continental is successful because we challenge our employees to be innovative and creative. We provide our employees with the necessary tools to be successful, and we reward them for their hard work. If you want to work in an environment that encourages teamwork and putting your ideas into action, consider joining Continental Resources.

Continental Resources is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Data Analyst
description:
Responsibilities
• Conduct complex data analysis in support of a variety of analytic solutions. Interpret data, analyze results, and provide insights to determine operational impact, trends, and opportunities.
• Develop metrics associated with core data analysis, exhibiting how better data management practices improve business value...
• Collaborate with business and technical partners to understand and evaluate their requirements regarding data and determine the optimal way to gather and present data.
• Work closely with Data Engineers, Data Modelers and Quality Test analysts.
• Analyze data from legacy systems and determine requirements to incorporate this data into Data Lake/ Data warehouse.
• Identify opportunities to analyze data with a consistent focus on increasing the ability of business team to make data-driven decisions.
• Document data dictionaries, relationships, mappings, and data flows and data lineage as set forth in standards.
• Identify and define data quality improvements and collaborate remediation with business teams.
• Communicate with organizational units on data issues and opportunities.

Education and Experience

title: Data Analyst-Parts
description:
Data Analyst-Parts

Textron Aviation •...

Wichita, Kansas, United States

Position Type:

Share

Job Description:

JOB SUMMARY:

This position supports the Parts and Distribution organization in developing and optimizing strategic initiatives by generating actionable insights and recommendations from internal and external data. Data Analysts support business growth by using business intelligence software and tools to mine complex data, identify historic trends, and visualize large datasets. Data Analysts play a critical role in data governance, helping to create and maintain data standards and quality.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Performs data analysis via various data-mining and statistical techniques to gain insights from data to support business objectives.
• Serves as an internal consultant to business leaders by conducting regular and ad-hoc analyses to convert data into strategic assets.
• Collaborate cross functionally to develop and implement new processes
• Collects, manages, analyzes and interprets large volumes of data while ensuring a high level of data quality. Leverage tools to develop and maintain curated data sets for use in analysis
• Develop and maintain data reports measuring daily business activities in PowerBi, Alteryx, and other tools using query languages and formula libraries such as SQL and DAX
• Identify and acquire new data sources to further inform market intelligence and pricing strategy
• Work to improve data quality within TAPD by assisting Data Governance efforts in creating and maintaining data quality standards
• Provide recommendations to the business for new initiatives to support business objectives
• Interface with other data professionals throughout the organization to embrace cross functional growth in analytics capabilities

Job Requirements:

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor’s degree required in Business Administration, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Data Analytics, or other related field

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Drive and desire to excel in an autonomous environment
• Bias for action – ability to take initiative and act on curiosities
• Highly organized with strong attention to detail and ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects
• Ability to identify relevant metrics and present technical data to a broad audience
• Desire and ability to learn and leverage new software tools and processes in a self learning environment
• Preferred experience with PowerBi, Tableau, or other data visualization software
• Preferred experience with R, Python, SQL or Alteryx
• Strong skills with MS Office including Excel and PowerPoint

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.

title: It data analyst
company_name: Federal Reserve Bank Of Kansas City
description:
Company

Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas CityThe IT CMDB Data Analyst position is responsible for developing, implementing, enhancing, and ensuring compliance for the Configuration Management policies, procedures, processes and standards.Job Description...

Key Activities :

Maintain current information related to Application Portfolio Management (APM) and the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), periodically review system information with the business owners and certify annually the accuracy and currency of the information maintained in the system of record.

Maintain, change and certify the accuracy of the National IT’s listing of applications, hardware and other configuration items (CIs) and the relationship of IT hardware items and software or Bank developed application IT items, CIs, and their relationship to one another.

Address monthly CMDB compliance issues based on Operation Level Agreements (OLA).

Provide data Analytics for APM / CMDB Assets and review of data fields for completeness supporting audit reviews.

Utilizes ITIL best practices as a basis for continuous process improvement.

Monitors efficiency and effectiveness of ITIL processes to identify gaps and recommend, document, communicate, and implement changes to existing policies, procedures, and processes to improve staff effectiveness.

Evaluates and analyzes technical issues and makes decisions regarding technical solutions and recommendations in accordance with customer requirements and National IT standards and policies.

Qualifications :

Typically requires at least 3 years of relevant experience.

Bachelor’s degree specializing in computer science, information systems, business or a closely related field, or equivalent combination of education and / or experience.

ITIL certification preferred.

Intermediate to advanced understanding of subject.

Experience with an asset management system / tool for application portfolio management and application server instances in the CMDB.

Experience with cloud processes, financial charge back and IT asset management best practices.

Experience with developing / implementing new process or process recommendations.

Incumbent must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless the Bank grants an accommodation based on a medical condition or sincerely held religious belief.

We offer benefits that go beyond the basics, featuring :
• Market-leading Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
• Competitive Compensation
• Flexible Work Environment
• 401k / Thrift Plan
• Tuition Reimbursement
• Professional Development Opportunities
• 401k / Thrift Plan
• Pension Plan
• Flexible Spending Accounts
• Life Insurance
• Vacation & Personal Time
• Paid Holidays
• Parental Leave
• Adoption Assistance
• Onsite Fitness Center
• Onsite Cafeteria
• Free Parking
• Additional Convenience Benefits, Discounts and More
• Subject to change based on distric

You can begin work before the screening is completed; however, continued employment is contingent on acceptable screening results.

The areas screened may include education / employment verification, criminal history, credit history, and reference checks.

Follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, and our YouTube channel - Kansas City Fed.

Full Time / Part Time

Regular

Job Exempt (Yes / No)

Job Category

Information Technology

Work Shift

First (United States of America)

We are looking for Data Analysts who can translate data into information using Python, and other DataViz tools, e.g. MS-PowerBI

Solid business level communication skills.
• Lead the identification and automation of data workflows
• Work with business leaders and other team members to identify data driven opportunities for improvement
• Collaborate with other team members to collect, synthesize, and analye data and create relevant reports
• Structuring large data sets and finding patterns from and insights from data
• Create presentations and reports using impactful graphs and other methods of visualzation
• Ensure deliverables are up to quality standards at the end of each sprint
• Document current state and work with multiple stakeholders to identify and plan the transformation journey
• Help build production quality deliverables

Qualification
• Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, or closely related field
• Masters' in the analytics field is preferred

Knowledge and Experience
• 3+ years working with Process Improvement methodologies
• Familiarity with proess mapping techniques, e.g., value stream mapping
• Excellent knowledge of databases and SQL scripting
• Excellent knowledge of Python.Python is a must have skill. and R scripting. R is a plus
• Experience with statistical software as well as with reporting and visualization tools
• Excellent communication and leadership skills
• Proved problem-solving and conflict-resolution ability
• Outstanding organizational skills
• Lean Six Sigma certification is a plus

title: Data Analyst
description:
Responsibilities
• Conduct complex data analysis in support of a variety of analytic solutions. Interpret data, analyze results, and provide insights to determine operational impact, trends, and opportunities.
• Develop metrics associated with core data analysis, exhibiting how better data management practices improve business value...
• Collaborate with business and technical partners to understand and evaluate their requirements regarding data and determine the optimal way to gather and present data.
• Work closely with Data Engineers, Data Modelers and Quality Test analysts.
• Analyze data from legacy systems and determine requirements to incorporate this data into Data Lake/ Data warehouse.
• Identify opportunities to analyze data with a consistent focus on increasing the ability of business team to make data-driven decisions.
• Document data dictionaries, relationships, mappings, and data flows and data lineage as set forth in standards.
• Identify and define data quality improvements and collaborate remediation with business teams.
• Communicate with organizational units on data issues and opportunities.

Education and Experience
• Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or Business Management required, Master's degree preferred.
• Minimum of 10 years' of experience in data analysis, requirements gathering and conducting quality assurance preferably in financial institutions.
• Minimum of 5 years of experience on working with Data Lake (Cloudera Based) and Data Warehouse (SQL Server based) Engineers.
• Strong knowledge of and experience with data requirements, databases, reporting and data preparation tools.
• Strong knowledge of data management concepts including metadata, data quality, data lineage and Governance.
• Thorough understanding of business processes and data methodology.
• Must have strong written and verbal communication skills with ability to work with all management levels

title: Data quality analyst
description:
Description

At Huntington, this is an opportunity to work cross-functionally with nearly every team in the company to elevate the organization by achieving defined quality levels through an effective system design...

Our goal is to be the Best performing Regional Bank in America, and we need data and analytics to meet that goal.

As we advance our data and analytics capabilities, we want individuals interested in performing data quality profiling, measurement and reporting for data quality issue remediation for multiple areas.

The Senior Data Quality Analyst will understand metadata for critical data and data issue management and be able to work collaboratively with internal teams and business partners to maximize resolution of data quality issues.

Detailed Description :
• Partner with key stakeholders to design and implement data quality goals to meet their business targets, including regulatory and compliance objectives
• Perform data discovery, profiling, and root cause analysis on high priority data assets
• Build and implement new data quality rules to execute against high priority data assets
• Develop recommendations and implement improvements to data quality controls and monitoring processes
• Provide support to data technology project teams responsible for building out next-generation data quality capabilities

Basic Qualifications :
• Bachelor’s degree
• Min 5 years of experience working in analyst roles in departments such as Data, Technology, Operations, Marketing, or Finance which includes min 3 yrs of experience working with data quality management frameworks, performing data analysis with SQL or other query tools to analyze data and working in a data environment and / or on data projects

Preferred Qualifications :
• At least three years of experience developing and influencing data quality strategies, including the supporting governance structures
• Hands on experience with data quality and data management tools and technologies
• Knowledgeable on data architecture, data warehousing, and big data design
• Well-developed negotiation, influencing, and partnership skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Business outcome focused
• Demonstrated perseverance

Exempt Status : (Yes not eligible for overtime pay) ( No eligible for overtime pay)

Workplace Type : Compensation Range :

Compensation Range :

The compensation range represents the low and high end of the base compensation range for this position. Actual compensation will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance.

Colleagues in this position are also eligible to participate in an applicable incentive compensation plan. In addition, Huntington provides a variety of benefits to colleagues, including health insurance coverage, wellness program, life and disability insurance, retirement savings plan, paid leave programs, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).

Huntington is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity and expression, genetic information, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

Tobacco-Free Hiring Practice : Visit Huntington's Career Web Site for more details.

Agency Statement : Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position

Last updated : 2023-02-06

title: Senior IT Analyst (Enterprise Data)
description:
Job Summary

As a part of the enterprise data team, the Data Analyst works directly with stakeholders on a variety of data-related projects and grow data literacy across the organization. The ideal candidate enjoys working in a dynamic team environment using a modern technology stack to design and develop creative data solutions...

Performs a wide variety of tasks; contributes to process improvements. Leads the work of small project teams; may formally train less experienced team members. Comprehensive knowledge of fundamental theories, principles and practices in the area of specialization. Identifies possible solutions for problems/issues of diverse scope using existing solutions. Works under general supervision.

Duties and Responsibilities
• Partner with business and IT stakeholders to build data-driven solutions that inform the decision-making process
• Collaborate with application administrators and owners to understand how product capabilities can be applied to create innovative solutions
• Understand and support the enterprise data strategy
• Design and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize data use and quality
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Work with data engineers to gather, organize, and prepare data
• Create, maintain, and optimize data solutions using reporting/analysis tools, cloud data stores, and on-prem databases
• Root-cause and resolve data issues within the enterprise data platform and delivery solutions
• Work with management to prioritize and communicate development needs and status
• Understand data/software usage patterns and identify opportunities to improve user experience
• Identify and define process/technology improvement opportunities
• Personal commitment to inclusion and diversity
• Other duties as assigned.

Skills and Competencies
• Strong communication skills, both written and oral
• Highly analytical with ability to understand, document, and communicate business requirements
• Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst on multiple project teams
• Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, and data mining techniques
• Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Spotfire, Business Objects, Power BI, etc.) and relational databases (SQL, Oracle, etc)
• Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, R Scripting, Python, etc.)
• Adept at data gathering, database queries, report writing, and presentation
• Ability to develop rapid, hands-on data and analytics prototypes that can transition to enterprise-grade solutions
• Aptitude to learn new concepts and technologies quickly and with minimal direction
• Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
• Drives results - Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances.
• Demonstrates self-awareness - Using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses.

Required Qualifications
• At least five (5) years of recent related experience working in a data analyst or technical business analyst role
• At least three (3) years of experience developing reports using Spotfire, Power BI, or equivalent software; and developing relational database queries, views, and stored procedures
• Experience with large, complex initiatives working with an in-house development team or commercial off the shelf application implementations and software vendors

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, MIS or a related field from an accredited College or University
• Preferred experience with business solutions common in the Oil and Gas Industry, such as: Procount / eVIN / Carte, Peloton Wellview, Aries, OFM, SAP ECC and PRA, Allegro

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
• Requires prolonged sitting, some bending and stooping.
• Occasional lifting, up to 25 pounds.
• Manual dexterity sufficient to operate a computer keyboard and calculator.

Continental Resources, Inc. provides equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

Continental is successful because we challenge our employees to be innovative and creative. We provide our employees with the necessary tools to be successful, and we reward them for their hard work. If you want to work in an environment that encourages teamwork and putting your ideas into action, consider joining Continental Resources.

Continental Resources is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Junior Data Scientist
description:
CGIAR is a global research partnership for a food-secure future. CGIAR science is dedicated to transforming food, land and water systems in a climate crisis. Its research is carried out by 13 CGIAR Centers/Alliances in close collaboration with hundreds of partners, including national and regional research institutes, civil society organizations, academia, development organizations and the private... sector.

The CGIAR’s Portfolio Performance Unit (PPU) is responsible for developing and implementing the CGIAR’s new Performance and Results Management System (PRMS). The PRMS offers a very rich and dynamic dataset of the 1000s of CGIAR results and innovations that are being developed globally, which is expected to be used for strategic decision-making at project, country, thematic area levels.

The PPU team is looking for a junior data analyst who can lead on-demand (statistical) analysis and basic research of the CGIAR results database and who can contribute design of infographics and other data visualizations. The candidate should have education and experience in information management, computer science, or statistics mathematics. Advanced computer skills, knowledge of additional databases such as SQL Server and MySQL are key, as well as experience in supporting data visualization, communication and statistics.

The task is expected to take 25-30hrs/ week till end June 2023 with a chance of extending based on need and performance

title: Data Analyst
description:
Beasley Media Group (BMG), LLC, is a multiplatform media company providing advertising and digital marketing solutions across the United States. BMG owns 61 radio brands as well as capabilities in audio technology, esports, podcasting, ecommerce, and events.

We are in search of a talented and experienced data analyst who loves storytelling. Our ideal candidate has technical skills for data... interrogation and knows that true insights aren't just explaining the importance of data correlation but about what a customer can do with that information.

This position will support the corporate revenue and content leadership by harnessing our first party data systems to identify, analyze and interpret trends/patterns to assist BMG in our continuing mission to create engaging content that generates revenue growth. In addition, this team member will be in active collaboration with our talent Digital Operations and Platform teams to assure that data systems are delivering actionable data for insight and analysis.

Our data analyst will also play an integral role in BMG's ongoing efforts on consumer data privacy and protection.

More specifically you will:
• Work closely with internal clients over time to understand their pain points and help translate those into requirements for queries and models you can run against their data to provide them with actionable insight
• Design tables and views that provide our analyst customers with ongoing data in the most useful formats for them to take action
• identify key insights that aren't being tracked and help broaden the coverage of what we analyze.
• Present complex data into visualizations and insights for corporate content and revenue teams
• Use your ability to identify and leverage trends in data to inform marketing strategies
• You will develop and maintain customer segmentations and help translate those into requirements for queries you can run against our first party data.
• A focus on identifying and working with the team on developing revenue-generating opportunities for programmatic and direct sales

Essentials:
• You're proactive, entrepreneurial, and collaborative; you can work well with cross functional teams of Product/Dev/QA and clients, you can spot gaps, and can manage your own work stream
• You have experience working with marketing automation tools such as Braze
• You've got multiple years of experience in data analysis, including defining KPIs for various businesses (subscription, ecommerce, publishers, apps, etc.)
• You understand the realities of data collection and have strong familiarity with tools like Amplitude (or similar), mParticle (or similar) etc. You won't use all those systems, but you have to feel comfortable understanding how different data collection systems work and how you might match up data between multiple systems.
• Familiarity with database analysis required
• You're a pro working with A/B testing tools and methodologies
• When other tools aren't available you can make magic happen in Excel

Requirements:
• 3+ years' experience in data analytics, marketing, and / or statistics
• Bonus if you've reported on and evaluated site performance, marketing campaigns, programmatic media platforms, optimization tests, CRM, and other media-based analytics
• Experience generating key insights from raw data
• Knowledge of user experience and optimization best practices
• Experience managing analytics dashboards and producing associated reports in accurate and timely manner
• Self-starter with ability to define day-to-day responsibilities in line with business objectives
• Strong written and verbal communication skills are necessary
• Software: Proficiency with Excel and ideally some experience with SQL.

Please send resume to

Beasley Media Group, LLC is an equal opportunity employer

Date: 2/3/23

title: Data Analyst
description:
Right Networks offers the only intelligent cloud purpose-built for accounting firms and professionals. Backed by award-winning around-the-clock US-based support, our fully managed IT and applications ensure customers have secure, reliable, on-demand access to their technology. We provide a curated software ecosystem that simplifies the complexity of running an accounting firm or small business... supported by a community of thought leaders, peer networks, and educational resources. Our success is made possible by leveraging decades of specialized experience in leading accounting firms and technology companies. More than 10,000 accounting firms and 60,000 SMBs count on us to run their business every day.

We have a great team, we’re growing fast, and have a winning culture based on innovation, teamwork, and mutual respect.

Job Overview

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Shared Services team reporting to the Director. As this is a new role within the team, this requires the candidate to be a self-starter and can vocalize and communicate effectively, anticipate data consistency issues, respond and reduce impact to internal stakeholders.

This is a remote work position.

Responsibilities
• Creation/Curation of Data Dictionary aligned with Data Governance
• Understand Data Origins within the various data sources + mapping capabilities
• Establish a Change Management Process for source data and data warehouse changes
• Participate in sprints and communicate changes effectively to wider teams
• Accountability and escalation point to identify, address, resolve data issues
• Contribute to ad-hoc projects in support of the wider data governance initiatives

Requirements
• At least 3 years of data analysis experience
• Support development and maintenance of business glossary, definitions, business terms + organizational nomenclature for common vocabulary
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
• Develop real-time operational dashboards for analytical reports
• Experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., PowerBI)
• Strong problem solving and analytical skills
• Outstanding organizational skills and extreme attention to detail
• Ability to work collaboratively with multiple departments across the organization
• Positive attitude and a strong desire to contribute as an essential member of the team

Benefits

To provide best-in-class solutions, we need a best-in-class team. We offer competitive salaries to recruit the best talent. We provide company paid short and long-term disability insurance, life insurance and a generous 401K match. We offer highly affordable medical, dental, vision coverage, and many other valuable benefits. We offer a generous PTO bank, and numerous paid holidays, affording you the time to be there for what is important in your life. We encourage giving back to our communities by providing volunteer paid time off. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer
