title: Biostatistician
description:
Biomedical Statistical Consulting is looking for an incredible Biostatistician to join our company and support our mission of providing best-in-class statistical services to our clients and partners. We are passionate about delivering high value and assisting Sponsors with statistical needs in regulatory Clinical trials.

Biostatistician Job Profile...

As a Biostatistician at BSC, you will lead projects with mentorship from senior staff to deliver the project statistician tasks/responsibilities. You will be involved with designing and analyzing medical devices and biological clinical trials.

Successful candidates will work on regulatory submissions and directly contribute to Company success by increasing the strength of study designs, interpretability of results, and facilitating collaboration with internal and external teams.

Biostatistician Job Description

Apply knowledge of basic and complex statistical design, analysis, and programming techniques utilized in clinical research.

Develop and reviews statistical analysis plans based on study-specific documents and sound statistical methodology.

Develop, maintain, and produces statistical programs and specifications used in creating analysis datasets, tables, listings, and figures.

Interact with the sponsor, internal, and external team members.

Coordinate with programmers and data management personnel as to database maintenance, updating, and documentation. Provide guidance for database structures for analysis.

Provide randomization schemes and appropriate documentation.

Programs/validate statistical tables with an emphasis on efficacy endpoints. Provide proper documentation and oversees the work of others who assist in programming/validating.

Understand and comply with all company policies and standard operating procedures.

Maintain a professional working relationship with sponsors, collaborating associates, and vendor personnel.

Biostatistician Requirements

Ph.D. with 1-3 years experience, or a Master's degree with 3-5 years experience in Biostatistics, Statistics, or a similar field.

3+ years CRO experience.

Lead Experience.

Knowledge of FDA and ICH Guidelines required.

Knowledge of statistical design, analysis, and programming techniques utilized in clinical research required.

Good SAS® programming skills and understanding of database structures

Ability to work on multiple projects at once

Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company's success

Good time-management skills

Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills

title: Data Integration Analyst I
description:
What You'll Do

Who We Are...

ArcBest Technologies, an ArcBest® company, is an innovative technology company that provides custom-built solutions and leading-edge technologies that help our customers and suppliers successfully navigate the complex supply chain landscape. Our team is made up of highly engaged and creative tech and analytical professionals — engineers, mathematicians, data scientists, software developers, information system specialists and more — who create smart solutions that deliver value to our customers and keep the global supply chain moving. We’re building the future of logistics.

ArcBest Technologies is headquartered in Fort Smith, Arkansas.

Our people are at the heart of our success, and we offer a workplace that embraces all cultures, perspectives, and experiences — so we can provide the best atmosphere for our employees and the best service to our customers. If that sounds like something you’d like to be a part of, we’d love to hear from you.

Learn more about who ArcBest Technologies is and what we do along with ArcBest's commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion .

What You’ll Do

We’re looking for a Data Integration Analyst I to join the ArcBest Technologies team. The Data Integration Analyst I successfully manages the execution of customer data integration projects across ArcBest and its subsidiaries. This position collaborates with IT teams within ArcBest Technologies to coordinate projects between internal and external customers to define business and technical requirements. The Data Integration Analyst I is responsible for managing integration projects from beginning to end, collaborating with stakeholders to evaluate, design, and advance solutions that enhance customer data integration between ArcBest, its subsidiaries, and customers.

Your Contribution May Include
• Manage projects from Initiation to Closure by: defining requirements, coordinating and prioritizing requests with internal and external customers, and providing stakeholder updates on projects.
• Communicate and manage expectations effectively.
• Identify opportunities for data integration (API, EDI, etc.) with new and existing customers.
• Research, troubleshoot, and resolve data integration (API, EDI, etc.) related issues.
• Evaluate existing data integration processes to identify solutions to drive improvements in customer experience.
• Develop and maintain data integration documentation and knowledge base.
• Provide technical expertise on data integration systems and processes.
• Perform ad-hoc reporting and analysis.
• Other duties and projects, as assigned.

As a Data Integration Analyst I, you will be a member of the ArcBest Technologies Data Integrations team in Fort Smith, AR. Your hours will be Monday through Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm, with irregular hours that may occur depending on workload.

Ready to apply? Before doing so, please make sure you meet the minimum requirements:

Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Business, or other related field, preferred.

Experience: Minimum, one-year experience in data integration and/or technical role, one-year experience in logistics and/or transportation industry, and one-year experience in project management.

Computer Skills: Proficient in Microsoft Office, SQL (DB2).

If you require accommodation in the application process, please contact arcbhr@arcb.com or call us at (479) 785-8963. An Equal Opportunity Employer including Vet/Disability.

REF 20611

title: Data Analyst II - Remote
description:
Talentify helps candidates around the world to discover and stay focused on the jobs they want until they can complete a full application in the hiring company career page/ATS.

Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the... care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as we help advance health equity on a global scale. Here, you will find talented peers, comprehensive benefits, a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, career growth opportunities and your life's best work.(sm)

Are you a curious thought leader who thrives on developing new solutions to solve tough business challenges through analytics? As a critical member of our Optum team, you will help rewrite the future of Hiring Company. At Optum, we make healthcare better through innovation and analysis. And we need your talents and business discipline to help fuel that mission. Are you ready to build solutions, analyze data and deliver bold, business-savvy ideas to impact the lives of millions?

As the Data Analyst 2, you will provide Analytical and Technical support Optum’s Payer Analytics Client Implementation team. You'll work closely with senior team members to assist with data processing and analysis as needed to support business analytic solutions that will create actionable insights and drive better decisions and performance for our payer and provider clients.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities
• Working with Operations and Product Development staff to support applications/processes to facilitate the effective and efficient implementation/migration of new clients' healthcare data through the Optum Impact Product Suite
• Processing and analyzing health care data using Optum Impact standard warehouse methodologies and software
• Performing claims data mapping and validations
• Reviewing and analyzing client data via quality control processes for anomalies or other issues which could compromise product functionality
• Communicating data issues and discoveries with clients during the implementation process via written documentation, conference calls and occasional on-site meetings
• Documenting issues, resolutions and programming steps pertaining to the implementation process and client data
• Working with team members on managing the data implementation process from start to finish for clients
• Supports Optum Support Desk as a functional SME for Impact/Symmetry
• Other duties as assigned

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree (or experience in Data Analytics, Computer Science, or MIS)
• 3+ years of experience with health insurance, healthcare, or pharmaceutical industry data
• 3+ years of programming experience using SQL, SAS and/or Python
• Experience with claims data mapping and validations

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with Agile project methodology terminology and processes
• Client-facing experience
• Knowledge and awareness of standard practices for quality control, audit trails, and documentation
• General knowledge and exposure using SQL, dB Visualizer, AWS, Azure, other Cloud technologies.
• Exposure to non-relational databases and tools, such as Cassandra, Kibana, JSON, JAVA, Python, and Spark
• Demonstrated awareness of when to appropriately escalate issues/risks
• Ability to work independently in a rapidly changing environment

title: Sr Data Modeller
description:
Job Title: Sr. Data Modeller with Erwin tool

Job Summary...

We are seeking an experienced Sr. Data Modeller with Erwin tool to join our Data Analytics team. The Sr. Data Modeller will play a critical role in designing and implementing complex data models and ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our data. This individual should have extensive knowledge of data modelling best practices and experience with Erwin tool. The Sr. Data Modeller will be responsible for working closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and develop data models that support the overall data strategy.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain complex data models using Erwin tool

Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and design data models that meet those requirements

Collaborate with data analysts, database administrators, and data engineers to ensure data accuracy and integrity

Participate in data modelling and data governance initiatives

Ensure data models adhere to industry standards and best practices

Develop and maintain data dictionaries and metadata repositories

Document data models and related processes

Participate in code and design reviews

Mentor and train junior data modellers

Requirements:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field

At least 7 years of experience in data modelling

Strong knowledge of data modelling concepts, methodologies, and best practices

Extensive experience with Erwin tool

Strong understanding of relational databases and data warehousing

Familiarity with data governance concepts and practices

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

title: Data Migration Analyst
description:
• *Applicants that complete BOTH skills assessment surveys will be given priority**

We have a SPOT for YOU at NavSav! We are in need of a passionate, hardworking, and experienced Data Migration Analyst. We are a rapidly growing Insurance Enterprise with 65+ locations in 16+ states. We are searching for talented people who will help us shake up the insurance world and guide the NavSav of... tomorrow. Our people bring ambition, passion, and innovation to every dimension of our company. Every member of our team is adding to our rapid growth and bringing new perspectives to every corner of our success. If this sounds like you, we are ready for you!

Benefits Included:
• Competitive Salary
• Retirement with 3% match
• Paid holidays
• Paid Time Off
• 2 Annual Wellness days
• Medical Insurance
• Vision Insurance
• Supplemental Insurance
• Dental Insurance

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead and implement the designing, planning, and full management of our company’s data migration process
• Perform source system data analysis in order to manager source to target data mapping
• Work across multiple different functional projects at one time in order to achieve most efficient and timely results, automating processes when possible
• Manipulate data inside of Microsoft Excel in order to transition from prior agency management systems into our universally used agency management systems
• Communicate regularly with Senior Leadership Team regarding migration timelines and expectations
• Other responsibilities as needed and or assigned

Requirements:
• Bachelors Degree
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Great interpersonal communication skills
• Experience with software development tools such as SQL
• Highly Proficient in Microsoft Excel and other products
• 4+ years of experience in a Data Analysis or Migrations position

title: Billing Analyst III
description:
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

Ensure that invoices accurately reflect terms and conditions agreed to by the organization, comply with accounting policies, and governmental rules and regulations...

Recommend improvements to the billing process as necessary

Provide accurate information and resolves inconsistencies as needed in billing

Assist management with developing and revising procedures used for training of new staff

Work with other departments to align procedures related to the quote to cash process

Test and makes recommendations for the Salesforce CRM system to improve processes cross functionally with other department managers involved in the quote to cash process

Review customer accounts for trend analysis data to include but is not limited to days sales outstanding (DSO), terms, payment methods, etc.

Develop, analyze, and prepare daily and monthly reports from the billing department

Participate in key account kaizens and meetings to facilitate process improvements

Process customer billings for products and services as orders are fulfilled

Work closely with the sales department to resolve disputed items on sales orders

Prepare and process sales orders, invoices, expense reports, company payments, customer payments and credit card purchases

Work closely with the service department to ensure progress billings and revenue are treated appropriately

Research and solve customer payment discrepancies

Perform customer meetings as necessary for escalated billing matters

Complete sales tax data submission to states as necessary, and monthly review of sales tax reconciliation

Requirements

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

4-7 years of relevant working experience

Proven work experience with testing and project management within system related to customer management, ERP/Financial systems or other tools utilized in billing.

Excellent interpersonal and team lead skills

Ability to act with discretion, tact and professionalism in all situations

Excellent customer service skills

Highly proficient in Microsoft office suite with advanced excel skills

Exceptional attention to detail

2-3 years of working knowledge/experience with GL Account Reconciliations

Ability to follow DI’s policies and procedures and system usage practices

Must comply with Company vaccination policy

Preferred skills and Experience

Working knowledge/experience with NetSuite and Salesforce

Education and/or Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business or Finance OR a combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and skills are acquired.

Physical Requirements/Working Conditions:

While performing duties of this job, the employee is predominately functioning in a sedentary light office position with high frequency of keyboarding, and computer use.

Supervision Level

This person reports directly to the Director of Accounting

title: Data Visualization Analyst
description:
Alderson Loop is seeking a data visualization analyst. This individual will act as a developer in the data analysis group supporting multiple Microsoft technologies. He or she will actively participate as a member of the scrum team, providing input to team velocity and sprint ceremonies, planning, demonstrations and retrospectives.

Primary Responsibilities...
• Design and code high quality deliverables adhering to standards and design principles
• Produce quality and timely deliverables
• Derive insight and understanding from large data sets through data visualization
• Build informative reports / dashboards, application of statistical methods, and deep investigation
• Support root cause analysis and resolution for complex issues regarding performance, scaling, and custom configuration
• Advanced knowledge in using data visualization effectively to tell a story and drive action by presenting information, defining and designing KPI based dashboards / reports that summarize customer insights and highlight “hot spots” for the customer

Secondary Responsibilities:
• Work with Data Engineers, Data Architects, and Data Scientists, to define back-end requirements for data products (aggregations, materialized views, tables – visualization)
• Perform data investigation to discover correlations / trends and the ability to explain them, and collaborate with internal and external customers to develop an analytics portfolio consistent with the vision and goals of our stakeholders
• Develop and support solutions in MS Dynamics 365
• Develop and support solutions in MS PowerApps

title: Miami Beach Employment Density Business Analyst
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Business Analyst to help us create a visual representation of employment density in Miami Beach. The ideal candidate will have experience in conducting data analysis and research, as well as experience working with mapping and visualization tools.

Responsibilities...

- Conduct research to gather data on employment density in Miami Beach, specifically, the number of employees per employer with a specific address

- Clean, process, and analyze large data sets

- Create a visual representation of employment density in Miami Beach using mapping and visualization tools

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the data

- Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and trends in data analysis and visualization

Requirements:

- Strong experience in data analysis and research

- Knowledge of mapping and visualization tools

- Ability to clean, process, and analyze large data sets

- Excellent communication and collaboration skills

- Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities

If you are a talented Business Analyst with experience in data analysis and visualization, and are interested in this opportunity, please apply with your resume and relevant portfolio. We look forward to hearing from you

title: Data Analyst - HYBRID REMOTE - Days
description:
Talentify helps candidates around the world to discover and stay focused on the jobs they want until they can complete a full application in the hiring company career page/ATS.

At LDRM we streamline the review, validation, compliance and submission of virtually any government-specific system application. That enables our customers to achieve predictably lower costs, greater information security... leaner operations and more effective digital government. LDRM specializes in background investigation support, records management, business automation and optimization, and administrative support. LDRM is a joint venture between two companies, DTSV and Lockwood Hills, a subsidiary of Akima. If you would like more information regarding LDRM please go to: www.ldrmllc.com THIS JOB LOOKS GREAT ON YOU! Job fit is important. It’s important for us, and it’s important for you. We want you to try us on for size. LDRM, the federal contractor providing administrative services to the National Visa Center, needs a Data Analyst to support our customer and our staff, and help transform the way government agencies manage information. In this hybrid-remote role, you’ll analyze data through research and evaluation, assess accuracy and the relevance of information. When you’re here, you are mission critical. That’s why we crafted a benefits package to help take care of you and your family in many ways, including an excellent Employee Assistance Program and Tuition Reimbursement to help you further your career. WHAT YOU’RE LOOKING FOR - Monday – Friday, 7AM – 3:30PM - Great pay for meaningful work - A 401(k) to which we contribute, health, dental, and vision plans, and more - Paid time off - We LOVE to promote from within - You’ll be respected for your knowledge and experience WHAT YOU'LL DO - Provide advice, assistance, guidance, research, and technical support in support of our government customer and program’s mission. - Work independently with direction or collaboratively. Collect and analyze data from structured research and evaluation activities, thus contributing to and presenting research findings in report form. May include but not be limited to analyzing complex problems, monitoring tasks and schedules. - Perform name check-related administrative, analytical, and research functions. Each contractor is responsible for providing accurate data to authorized requesters in the Federal Government. - Research all remaining valid records pertaining to data and apply sound judgment in determining the relevance of that information. - Review and edit written documents generated by others and communicate/work cooperatively with others. - Perform various administrative tasks as required to include creating written summaries and reports and maintaining meticulous logs and records. - Comply with all appropriate legal and regulatory requirements when reporting and to the requesting organization while relating all facts accurately with a high-quality standard.

By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information

title: Vans - Sr. Analyst, Brand Data Visualization
description:
VF’s Analytics and Insights team is building a community of boundless decision intelligence. We are accountable for building the systems, operating models, and insights that drive better, faster decisions across VF’s brands and functions. Whether it’s market and supply chain opportunities or supporting a better understanding of the consumer and how to serve them, we:
• drive decision intelligence... by curating and maintaining an evergreen suite of adaptable data product solutions and insights that drive action,
• democratize data access and usage by building and sustaining a service model that empowers and enables widespread data access and self-service, and
• build data literacy across VF by championing a culture of data-driven decision making
• With a clear aspiration to be a trusted catalyst of transformative effect across VF, we live by these values:

Discovery
• We lead with curiosity and seek to understand why before what
• We are pathfinders that push the boundaries of what’s possible and drive decisive action
• We take risks and courageously challenge the status quo

Connection
• We embrace and incubate diversity of skills, capabilities, and perspectives while emphasizing a bias for action
• We are sought out as thought partners and co-creators
• We transparently request and provide feedback for continuous improvement

Simplification
• We democratize data literacy and access, and measure our outcomes
• We create consistency and trust through practical governance that evolves and scales
• We believe truths and not tools power our competitive advantage

About the Role

The Sr Analyst, Brand Data Visualization and modelling will be a dedicated resource to VF’s Vans brand and work closely with the Vans’ Global Digital Strategy team to interface with business stakeholders and peers to meet the business’ analytical needs while managing and developing the Analytics team. In this capacity, strong leadership, training, and communication skills are important as this role will be providing guidance and recommendations to peers and business vertical leaders.

This will entail effectively translating business requirements into plans and actionable items. The successful candidate will be a global catalyst for amplifying data visualization and decisioning capabilities that spark efficiency, drive business decisions, and foster innovation and growth for the Vans brand.

While dedicated to the Vans brand, the role will report into VF Corporation’s centralized Integrated Analytics and Insights team and will benefit from the synergies, standards, and learning opportunities that come from being part of a broader VF Insights and Analytics community that spans brands, regions, and functions.

A strong understanding of BI tools, such as Tableau, Alteryx, Denodo and/or Looker, with emphasis on the ability to design intuitive and insightful visualizations is a must. Advanced understanding of data warehouses, such as Amazon Redshift, as well as data virtualization is also critical. Experience with SQL is a must.

Key Accountabilities:
• Provide thought leadership and focus on the big picture. Establish, socialize, and execute the data strategy based on key areas - people, processes, data, and technology. Align strategy, resources, project plans, and goals to business objectives
• Work cross-functionally with brand stakeholders and data lake development team to identify, analyze, and design core data models to support self-service reporting and analytics
• Creatively explore how data can continually add value to Vans. Translate ad hoc questions into flexible tools & methodologies that scale to answer broad problems across the organization.
• Apply strong storytelling acumen to develop and design presentations, reports, data visualizations and other deliverables. Summarize findings to key stakeholders and executive leadership, communicating with both technical and non-technical team members
• Embed yourself in the development lifecycle for new & existing analytics packages by creating ideas through collaboration with peers, building initial data prototypes, supporting data development, deploying visualizations for production systems and participate in the update and improvement over time.
• Evangelize the evolution of business reporting into decision intelligence, leveraging data science, modeling, and AI into data products that automate or aid in scalable decisioning
• Establish and maintain principles, role definitions, responsibilities, standards, procedures, and accountability for data development practices, reporting and visualization
• Expand technical skillset to utilize both code-based and non-code-based tools to create reporting data models efficiently and effectively
• Manage and create reporting and visualization projects involving timelines, vendor relationships, and budgets to ensure projects are delivered with the highest quality and within specified timeframes
• Develop and maintain consultative and collaborative relationships with key business stakeholders to proactively identify and address business intelligence needs
• Establish, centralize, embrace, and champion common design practices for data visualization. Drive standards and KPI’s for reporting and data visualizations within Vans while simultaneously supporting efforts to drive consistency, standardization, scalability and simplicity across VF’s brands, functions, and regions

Required Knowledge, Capabilities and Experience:
• Years of Related Professional Experience: 5-7 years
• A formal education and subsequent graduate degrees are nice to have, but we are most interested in your total experience and professional achievements.
• Advanced understanding of data modeling for reporting and analytics functions with at least Basic understanding of consumer analytics and web analytics data like Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
• Experience with multiple systems in any of the following areas including; AWS (S3, Redshift), Alteryx, Power BI, BI HANA, Tableau, SAP BODS , SQL Server, MySQL, Data Warehouse Appliances, Oracle, Teradata, Looker, SAS, SPSS, ThoughtSpot, Cognos, Datorama, Domo, Denodo, and other related products
• Demonstrated understanding of retail, wholesale, CPG, or footwear and apparel industry business processes and how data is used within them, with awareness of industry processes and data sets including Demand, Inventory and Supply Planning, Financial Analysis and Forecasting, Product Data, Point of Sale (POS) Data, Buy Planning, Marketing Campaign Management, Social Media Data – Facebook Business Manager, Google Analytics, Big Query, Google Ads, Consumer Data such as Experian Mosaic
• Proven track record of delivering and managing multiple projects and priorities demanding both rigorous attention to detail and high-level comprehensive solutions
• Design-oriented thinking focused on end-users - experience making a variety of static and interactive visualizations for a variety of audiences. Awareness of design concepts related to chart forms, typography, and the use of color. Ability to design visualizations that are intuitive to navigate, responsive, and informative.
• Experience with multiple technology service delivery models and methodologies (Agile, waterfall, DevOps)
• Proven ability to lead and drive organizational and cultural change as well as build and develop a high functioning team
• Strong project management skills

Skills and Attributes for Success
• Demonstrated critical thinking and analytical skills; ability to apply systems knowledge to troubleshoot and analyze new issues is critical
• A self-starter, able to work independently with a proactive working style
• Excellent collaboration skills - be able to listen to business stakeholders, understand their needs, plan analytical solutions that will assist them, effectively translate their needs to technical peers, and be able to set expectations around development and delivery of projects while keeping development teams on track.

How You Will Make a Difference:
• Be an owner – Take ownership of the future state of the data landscape
• Be a doer – Dive in and deliver on the promises to help achieve business value

· Be the expert – Study, research and know your space deeply

title: Data and Outcomes Analyst for Education/Research Programs
description:
Description

Position at Everyday Health - Professional...

Everyday Health Group (EHG) is a recognized leader in patient and provider education and services attracting an engaged audience of over 74 million health consumers and over 890,000 U.S. practicing physicians and clinicians. Our mission is to drive better clinical and health outcomes through decision-making informed by highly relevant information, data, and analytics. We empower healthcare providers, consumers and payers with trusted content and services delivered through Everyday Health Group’s world-class brands.

Prime Education, a property of Everyday Health Group, is looking for a Data and Outcomes Analyst - PRIME Education. The Data and Outcomes Analyst is a member of the Research Department and reports to the Sr Manager, Outcomes Reporting. In this role, you will be responsible to organize data and analyze outcomes of program questions; analysis of patient and provider data from system-based and practice improvement programs and qualitative analysis of data from education programs. The Data and Outcomes Analyst will support data management for the research team including entering metrics for routine project reporting into grant management systems.

The Data and Outcomes Analyst possesses specialized skills and experience in enhancing the quality of scientific/biomedical outcomes documents and presentations. The person in this role will possess the ability to understand research methodologies and assist in statistical analysis to test unique research hypotheses. You will collaborate effectively with the professional research team and is integral to the coordination, collection, and output of real-world healthcare data. You will also participate in the analysis of data collected from healthcare systems, community based practices, and health care providers participating in PRIME sponsored quality improvement research and education studies. You will focus on strategies that can implement and optimize data collection and storage, and work with the research team to effectively uncover and relay meaningful and measurable stories related to the project and educational outcomes. The Data and Outcomes Analyst reports to the Sr Manager, Outcomes Reporting although you will also work closely with other key personnel involved in the company’s research and study designs.

Position Duties:
• Participate in the planning of real-world data collection for CME and research-based projects
• Organize and track outcomes data from CME and research-based programs/projects, including timely, accurate assembly of qualitative data sets from live and virtual programs
• Plan and perform ongoing qualitative data analyses related to projects/programs, and identify opportunities to assemble qualitative data for story-telling to supporters and other stakeholders
• Assess quantitative and qualitative data and outcomes to assist in identifying the impact of the education related to the data
• Assist in the development of presentations, scientific abstracts, and communications that convey a story about the value of a program/project
• Assist in the completion of timely and compelling interim and final outcomes reports
• Conduct editorial review of interim and final outcomes reports
• Liaise with the technology team to design or integrate strategies and methods for improved data capture and data reporting
• Conduct timely and efficient quality testing of survey databases to ensure data accuracy and the timely reporting of data
• Other duties as assigned

Candidate Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in a scientific or biomedical field; Masters or Academic degree preferred
• Ability to work independently, multi-task and balance several deadlines/production deliverables simultaneously
• Strong skills in proofreading and editing
• Ability to analyze the integrity and validly of the scientific /biomedical research methods and data
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite including PowerPoint, Excel, and Word
• Attention to detail and good written and verbal communication skills
• Excellent organizational and time management skills

Our Culture and Values

We created our values together to guide our collective purpose and pursuits. We are collaborators and problem solvers. We empower one another to make informed decisions and to be enabled towards action. We embrace success. We recognize that innovation can spark and be born from any of us no matter our individual role or background. We encourage open mindedness and sensitivity to each other and our environment. Our personal and professional passions get ignited, nurtured and supported. We value that doing is greater than talking as the most measurable means of impact. Our collective purpose to deliver enlightened audience experiences with trusted brands is what drives the success of our business and our professional satisfaction.

Life at Everyday Health

At Everyday Health Group, a division of Ziff Davis, we work in a culture of collaboration and welcome those who desire to join our growing global community. We believe in careers versus jobs and people versus employees. We seek enthusiastic individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit looking for an environment that rewards your best work.

Everyday Health offers competitive salaries in addition to robust health and wellness benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability benefits, Flexible Spending accounts, 401(k) with company match, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Pregnancy and Parental leave, Family Planning Support via Maven, Flexible Time Off, Volunteer Time Off, Fitness Reimbursement as well as employee-focused engagement and education programs, including Employee Resource Groups and company-sponsored events. If you’re seeking a dynamic, flexible work environment where you can see the direct impact of your performance, then Everyday Health is the place for you. Everyday Health Group has employees located in 38 states as well as offices in NYC, Asheville, NC, London England and Mumbai, India.

Everyday Health Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all employees.

title: Health Plan Analyst- Provider focus
description:
About the Role- Data Analyst to work on the Provider Data (HealthCare Providers that are contracted with the company's Health Plan)

Team- Health Plan Informatics...

Current Team Size- 20

Position Reports To- Director of Health Plan Informatics

No. of Positions: 1

Role Requirements:

Business Experience
• Must have Business Knowledge in Health Plans, Good Communication, and be able to work with Stakeholders - Willing to Innovate
• Subject matter expertise in health plan data such as claims, Provider Contracting, Provider network, Access to Care
• Ability to understand business requirements and translate that to technical specifications
• Ability to learn multiple tools and socialize, engage, and adopt business stakeholders on these tools
• Multi-Tasker & Must be able to work on the Analysis - and drive Actionable Insights from the Data and explain to Stakeholders

Technical Skills
• SAS (SAS Enterprise, BASE SAS, PROS SQL)
• SQL
• Exposure to Tableau or Power bi - No need for development but must be able to look at the data and gather insights

Data Exposure- Required & Good to have
• Medical Claims Data - Medicaid, Medicare, Medicare Advantage, 3rd party Health Plans
• Health Plan Data Analysis - Exposure to Provider side of Data - Work with data that looks at Health Care provider Contracting, Retention, etc
• Health Care Code like - ICD (Diagnosis Codes ), CPT Codes ( Procedure Code), DRG ( Diagnosis Group), and CCD (Continuity Of Care)

Type of Projects they will be required to work on:
• Leveraging data to evaluate members (administrative, cost, quality perspective) and to identify opportunities for improvement and cost savings
• Subject matter expertise in health plan data such as claims , Provider Contracting, Provider network review, Access to Care
• Infrastructure building (report documentation including but not limited to writing business (technical) requirement documentation, producing quality check documentation etc.)

Education Requirements:
• Bachelor or Master in Public Health, Data Science, or similar

Certifications Required:
• None

Years of Experience Required
• 4 to 5 +

Any Supervisory Responsibilities Requirement for the Role
• None

VISA Requirements
• All Visa Types, will accept OPT, Sponsorship, Student,

Working Location
• Remote
• States Ineligible for Remote Work -Ohio, Washington, North Dakota, Wyoming

Vaccination Requirement
• Covid-19 Vaccine & Boosters Required

Remote POsition

12 months Contract...
• Experience as a data scientist with preference in data analysis & forecasting algorithms
• Python, PySpark development experience a must

• Good communication skills

title: Data Quality Analyst Intern
description:
SupplyHouse.com, an innovative e-commerce company, is looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Quality Analyst Intern to work with our Product, Systems, and Insights (PSI) Team virtually this summer! This individual will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of our data by performing quality checks, and identifying and resolving any issues. They will work... closely with our Insights Team to develop and implement processes to improve data quality and maintain data integrity. They will also work with data to uncover key insights critical to defining our business strategies.

This is a remote-based role within select states in the United States. At this time, we are only able to employ those located in the following states: Florida, Georgia, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, and Washington.

This position may require travel to our NY office headquarters up to two times during the program for internal meetings and team-building activities. The cost of travel for employees out of the area will be covered by the company. Additionally, our offices are always available for staff to use as much as desired.

Location: Remote (Florida, Georgia, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, and Washington)

Length of Program: June – August

Salary: $20.00/hour

Schedule: Standard business hours are Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. EST. However, there is some flexibility as per our Flex-Time Policy.

What is PSI (Product, Systems, & Insights)?

The Product, Systems, & Insights Team within our Marketing department is a group of Project Managers, Product Owners, and Insights Analysts who help the company plan and execute innovations to its website, app, and internal business processes.

Responsibilities:
• Learn about our website and app analytics tagging and suggest improvements
• Perform quality checks on data to ensure accuracy and completeness
• Identify, document, and resolve any issues with data quality
• Work with a cross-functional team to implement fixes for data issues
• Collaborate with the Insights Team to develop and implement processes to improve data quality
• Assist with the creation and maintenance of data dictionaries and documentation
• Help optimize growth initiatives to drive customer acquisition and retention
• Build a testing and analysis-based culture
• Run A/B tests, build custom reports and dashboards, and analyze data to make strategic marketing and UX decisions

Requirements:
• Rising senior working toward a Bachelor's degree in a STEM or Business field
• A focus in Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science, or another data-heavy domain is preferred
• Strong attention to detail as well as an ability to identify patterns and trends in data
• Excellent problem-solving skills
• Proficiency in SQL and Excel
• Passion for working on data quality and analysis projects
• Ability to communicate effectively with cross functional partners

Benefits:
• Gain Experience – Gain real-world, hands-on experience.
• Build Connections – Connect with other interns and team members throughout the company.
• Have Flexibility – Standard business hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. EST. However, feel free to utilize our “Flex-Time” policy to adjust your start and end time slightly.
• Collaborate – Working in a team atmosphere is vital to our success and everyone here plays an important role.
• Stay Engaged – Be on the lookout for our virtual activities, events, and giving back initiatives!

We are looking for motivated, passionate students who are hoping to continue working full-time following graduation. Please submit your resume if you are interested in applying!

Please know that we are unable to sponsor work visas or temporarily hire candidates that are authorized to work for a defined period of time in their field of study for this position

title: Analyst II, Master Data Management
description:
Details
• Department:Mission Inspired Transformation
• Schedule:8-hour day shift, Monday-Friday...
• Location:Remote

Benefits

Paid time off (PTO)

Various health insurance options & wellness plans

Retirement benefits including employer match plans

Long-term & short-term disability

Employee assistance programs (EAP)

Parental leave & adoption assistance

Tuition reimbursement

Ways to give back to your community
• Please note, benefits and benefits eligibility can vary by position, exclusions may apply for some roles (for example: PRN, Short-Term Option, etc.). Connect with your Talent Advisor today for additional specifics.

Responsibilities

The Resource Group, a subsidiary of Ascension, is a business transformation services organization that specializes in resource and supply chain management.

Through implementation of its User-Directed Integrated Solutions, The Resource Group transforms the resource and supply function by delivering value through Operations and Logistics Optimization, Strategic Sourcing, and Change Management. Although it specializes in these areas, as its core, The Resource Group is rooted in the ideals of hospitality and believes that success is measured by the satisfaction of the customer. The Resource Group’s success has allowed it to expand and serve various healthcare systems looking to decrease non-payroll expenses and increase operational efficiencies. Today, The Resource Group serves over 2,700 locations including over 155 acute care hospitals across 22 states and Washington D.C.

This success and value are delivered by The Resource Group’s people, and it is the people and culture that enables The Resource Group to achieve success while working toward the common goal of lowering the cost of healthcare.

As Such, The Resource Group Believes In
• Hiring talent from all industries and demographics to foster innovation and diversity of thought and experience
• Investing in the people who deliver long-term success to our Participants
• Transforming the way our associates develop so they can help transform the organizations we serve
• Creating a culture of continuous learning to prosper in an ever-changing business environment

The Resource Group offers exciting opportunities for all levels of professionals and views resource and supply management as a dynamic career with opportunities for growth and advancement within and across disciplines and teams. Positions are available across a number of strategic resource and supply management roles, allowing multiple entry points into The Resource Group. Learn more about our company our culture and our remote work options at TheResourceGroup.com

This role falls within The Resource Group's Operations and Logistics Optimization Solution. Operations and Logistics Optimization comprises six communities working together to align inventory and data management, operational procedures, and key performance indicators, and to deliver a cost-effective, highly-efficient managed distributor model. By combining a culture of hospitality with leading operations and logistics processes and controls, these communities of skilled associates ensure resource and supply management runs silently in the background and operates in service of physicians, clinicians, leadership, and associates.

The Master Data Management Community oversees all supply chain data management functions as well as develops and implements data tools to assist The Resource Group’s Participants with data management, forecasting, and analysis.

As an Analyst II in the Master Data Management Community, you will support any and all Master Data Management tool/resource development, implementation, and maintenance. You will also be responsible for data cleansing to ensure accurate ordering and procurement by caregivers and requisitioners. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to train supply chain requisitioners and other stakeholders who may use the aforementioned data tools.

Responsibilities
• Maintain integrity of supply, services, and vendor data through standardized governance procedures, continuous data cleansing, and process automation
• Perform reconciliation to ensure synchronization between all data systems
• Understand The Resource Group contracting process flows
• Collaborate with The Resource Group’s Contract Design and Sourcing teams to ensure data accuracy in negotiated contracts
• Successfully cleanse and load contract and item data into ERP system(s)
• Identify contract and item discrepancies and escalates as applicable

Requirements

Education:
• High School diploma equivalency with 2 years of cumulative experience OR Associate's degree/Bachelor's degree OR 4 years of applicable cumulative job specific experience required.

Additional Preferences

Previous Internship experience preferred

Enterprise Resource Planning or Product Information Management system experience preferred

Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets proficiency (advanced)

The Resource Group’s value is delivered through its people, and it is our people and culture that enables us to achieve success. We have created an environment where individuals can thrive while working toward the common goal of lowering the cost of healthcare. Passion and hard work are necessary to accomplish this goal, and we are always looking for people who bring a fresh perspective. In addition to the experience listed below, all Resource Group associates embody the following soft skills and attributes: Nice, Bright, High-Energy, Inclusive, Willing to Give Away Power, Inspired by Mission, Invigorated by Change.

Why Join Our Team

Ascension associates are key to our commitment of transforming healthcare and providing care to all, especially those most in need. Join us and help us drive impact through reimagining how we can deliver a people-centered healthcare experience and creating the solutions to do it. Explore career opportunities across our ministry locations and within our corporate headquarters.

Ascension is a leading non-profit, faith-based national health system made up of over 150,000 associates and 2,600 sites of care, including more than 140 hospitals and 40 senior living communities in 19 states.

Our Mission, Vision and Values encompass everything we do at Ascension. Every associate is empowered to give back, volunteer and make a positive impact in their community. Ascension careers are more than jobs; they are opportunities to enhance your life and the lives of the people around you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Ascension will provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all associates and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, gender, sexual orientation, gender identification or expression, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, genetic information, carrier status or any other legally protected status or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

For further information, view the EEO Know Your Rights (English) poster or EEO Know Your Rights (Spanish) poster.

Pay Non-Discrimination Notice

Please note that Ascension will make an offer of employment only to individuals who have applied for a position using our official application. Be on alert for possible fraudulent offers of employment. Ascension will not solicit money or banking information from applicants.

This employer participates in the Electronic Employment Verification Program. Please click the E-Verify link below for more information.

E-Verify

title: Jr. Data Analyst
description:
Insight Global is looking for a Data Analyst to join one of our financial clients in Minneapolis, MN. The team you will be joining supports business priorities by assisting the entire data science spectrum. You will assist in dataset creation including data extraction, derived and dependent variable creation, and data quality control for analytics, model development, and validation. You will also... be identifying business problems and determining appropriate solutions for them through data. There will be some Business Analyst aspects to this role. Qualified candidates will be strong communicators and great team players, but also be able to take ownership of their duties and work independently.

Requirements:
• Master's Degree
• 1-3 years of Data Analyst experience in a data rich environment
• Data visualization experience -- Power Bi, QuickSight, etc.
• Basic SQL experience
• Basic Python experience
• Local to Minneapolis and willing to work 3 days onsite in downtown (flexible on which days)
• Go getter with great communication who is able to thrive as a teammate but also able to take ownership of their own work

Preferred Requirements:
• Experience with AI/ML platforms like Dataiku, SageMaker, etc.
• Business Analyst experience

title: Data Analyst-Parts
description:
JOB SUMMARY:

This position supports the Parts and Distribution organization in developing and optimizing strategic initiatives by generating actionable insights and recommendations from internal and external data. Data Analysts support business growth by using business intelligence software and tools to mine complex data, identify historic trends, and visualize large datasets. Data Analysts play... a critical role in data governance, helping to create and maintain data standards and quality.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Performs data analysis via various data-mining and statistical techniques to gain insights from data to support business objectives.
• Serves as an internal consultant to business leaders by conducting regular and ad-hoc analyses to convert data into strategic assets.
• Collaborate cross functionally to develop and implement new processes
• Collects, manages, analyzes and interprets large volumes of data while ensuring a high level of data quality. Leverage tools to develop and maintain curated data sets for use in analysis
• Develop and maintain data reports measuring daily business activities in PowerBi, Alteryx, and other tools using query languages and formula libraries such as SQL and DAX
• Identify and acquire new data sources to further inform market intelligence and pricing strategy
• Work to improve data quality within TAPD by assisting Data Governance efforts in creating and maintaining data quality standards
• Provide recommendations to the business for new initiatives to support business objectives
• Interface with other data professionals throughout the organization to embrace cross functional growth in analytics capabilities

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor's degree required in Business Administration, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Data Analytics, or other related field
QUALIFICATIONS:
• Drive and desire to excel in an autonomous environment
• Bias for action - ability to take initiative and act on curiosities
• Highly organized with strong attention to detail and ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects
• Ability to identify relevant metrics and present technical data to a broad audience
• Desire and ability to learn and leverage new software tools and processes in a self learning environment
• Preferred experience with PowerBi, Tableau, or other data visualization software
• Preferred experience with R, Python, SQL or Alteryx
• Strong skills with MS Office including Excel and PowerPoint
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified

description:
Job Description

DATA ANALYST WITH SQL SERVER, POWER BI - ONSITE LOCATION: NEWARK NEW JERSEY...

DATA ANALYST DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Data Analysts collect data, to help company make the right decisions. This work encompasses several duties and responsibilities, including:

• Work with executives and other business leaders to identify opportunities for improvement • Create reports for internal teams and/or external clients • Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data • Use graphs, infographics and other methods to visualize data • Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions • Structure large data sets to find usable information • Work with a team of analysts and other associates to process information • Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings

JOB QUALIFICATIONS: • 4+ years of experience working as Data Analyst • Ability to write good SQL for data analysis a must – MS technologies such as MS SQL Server, Azure, Power BI, & SSIS • Experience with managing production support teams is a must have • Self learner and ability work independently is a must • Exposure Programming language – Python good to have • Exposure to Data Science good to have

title: Consumer Research & Data Analyst
description:
Req ID: 72652

Job Location: Tulsa Tulsa OK...

Areas of Interest: Business/Technical Analysis

Pay Transparency Salary Range: Not Available

BOK Financial (BOKF), Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top 25 U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in ten states – Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Arizona, Colorado, Kansas/Missouri, New Mexico, Nebraska and Wisconsin. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies. .

Bonus Type

Discretionary

Summary

We're building a culture at BOK Financial where amazing people (like you) can bring their best, be their best and work for the best. You've come to the right place to grow your career. The Consumer Research & Data Analyst provides expertise and actionable guidance to management through the analysis of consumer and market data, as well as the impacts of industry, financial services, and regulatory trends.

Job Description

The Consumer Research & Data Analyst provides expertise and actionable guidance to management through the analysis of consumer and market data, as well as the impacts of industry, financial services, and regulatory trends. Provides information and detailed analysis to guide business decisions. Serves as a strategic thought leader around data insights including client surveys. Develops strong working relationships with internal departments and line of business partners to understand business issues, key performance indicators, strategies and plans. This role will handle a high volume of work exhibiting attention to detail.

Team Culture

We celebrate each other’s wins, big and small. We respect, honor and praise one another for a job well done. We are transparent. We are involved, committed, and collaborative. Simply put: We Achieve More Together.

How You'll Spend Your Time
• You will extract and decipher complex data, perform a broad range of analyses and employ analytical tools to illustrate emerging trends. This position provides actionable guidance by determining the meaning of complex data and formulating clear, concise, and compelling written/verbal conclusions or recommendations based on analyses.
• You will exercise sound judgment in researching problems, evaluating various solutions, and using data to inform decision making that impacts the Division’s bottom line. You will also partner with various line of business leaders and managers to identify, address, and satisfy data needs for various LOB projects; develop ad hoc reports and analyze as requested by management; provide day-to-day support for specialized data requests.
• You will ensure data quality and validation controls are in place to support accurate data representation; effectively communicate and document segment models and their business implications. This position will formulate recommendations regarding segmentation, acquisition, retention, cross-selling and integrated communications.
• You will build tools and pipelines for gathering data from multiple sources into a coherent view, ensure high quality work products and on-time delivery of all initiatives. Proactively assists project teams in establishing requirements and resource needs, removing road blocks. Assist in building effective launch plans, participates in launch to ensure success, and provides critical feedback regarding defects and opportunities.
• You will research relevant industry, financial services, and line of business issues to build upon knowledge base, identifying trends and sharing insights with team; anticipate and identify issues inhibiting the attainment of assigned goals; develop and implement problem resolution.

Education & Experience Requirements

This level of knowledge is normally acquired by completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics and 2+ years of relevant professional business experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Ability to develop optimized SQL queries joining multiple databases to deliver customized inquiries
• Familiarity with PowerBI and the ability to partner with internal stakeholders to drive new and innovative PowerBI tools
• Strong conceptual thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills, including the ability to analyze complex problems that include interrelationships and dependencies in order to identify common themes and solutions
• Advance understanding of the data models in the domains - Customer, Products (Deposits, Loans, Cards, Payments) & related services).
• Strong aptitude to collect and analyze information and make appropriate recommendations including source to target, target to source - data mapping, business rules, data validation.
• Self-motivated, disciplined, and task focused
• Strong time management and organizational skills to effectively handle projects in a fast-paced, high-volume, and deadline intensive environment
• Highly detail-oriented
• Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality
• Well-developed written and oral communication skills to effectively represent self and the Division, as well as the ability to present complex information and issues in a clear concise manner
• Working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
• Experience with descriptive and exploratory data analysis.
• General knowledge of financial products and services
• General knowledge of marketing standards, principles, guidelines, and rules

Advertising Source

BOK Financial is a stable and financially strong organization that provides excellent training and development to support building the long term careers of our employees.
With passion, skill and partnership you can make an impact on the success of the bank, our customers and your own career!

Apply today and take the first step towards your next career opportunity!

If you are interested in a career with BOK Financial text "BOKF" to 25000 to engage with Olivia our virtual recruiting assistant.

BOK Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for training, compensation, transfer, promotion and other aspects of employment for all qualified applicants and employees without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information or veteran status.

Please contact
recruiting_coordinators@bokf.com
with any questions

title: Data Analyst - Hybrid
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

Reports to: Director of Research and Evaluation...

Location: Kansas City, MO

Hybrid: 2 days in office, 3 days remote (technology provided)

Status: Exempt, Full-time

Salary: Annual salary based on experience

Benefits: Medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD, Life Insurance, PTO, Holidays, leave program, 401k including employer contribution, and others

Operating hours: 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST

Key Performance Indicators:

90% successful and timely resolution of incoming data requests

Successfully forecast data within 10% margin of error

Ensure that at least 80% of data are tracked accurately and consistently across the organization

90% internal customer satisfaction rate

RESPONSIBILITIES

The Data Analyst role will report to the Sr. Director of Research and Evaluation and will play a key role at KC Scholars. This role will be responsible for assisting in completing internal data analyses, data forecasts, and reports.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Research & Data Management (75%)

Design and develop interactive graphics and dashboards

Transform datasets and quantitative analysis into compelling visuals for infographics, reports, and webpages

Clearly articulate findings to internal and external audiences through reports, presentations, and other data products

Coordination (15%)

Work cross-functionally to ensure that all KC Scholars teams are appropriately leveraging data visualization capabilities

Respond to ad hoc visualization requests across the organization

Leadership (5%)

Identify opportunities to tell new data stories

Misc (5%)

Occasional other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Education:

Bachelor's degree in data analytics, data science, statistics, or a related discipline

Work Experience:

2-3 years of relevant data analytics and reporting experience in a highly analytical environment

2-3 years of experience in building interactive data visualizations (dashboards, charts, maps, etc.) in Tableau

Experience in data cleaning, data manipulation, and data analysis in one or more programming languages (SAS, R, SPSS, etc.)

Additional Knowledge, skills, and competencies:

Excellent writing and verbal communication skills

Knowledge of Salesforce, SQL, and/or Microsoft Dynamics is preferred, but not required.

Physical requirements:

Ability to lift up to 15 lbs.

Ability to work in an office and remote environment.

Ability to travel from and to work and occasionally to regional sites as the organization grows.

Ability to interact with others via technology, face-to-face and collectively.

TO APPLY

To apply, please follow this link, and be prepared to upload your resume.

KC Scholars firmly supports the principle and philosophy of equal opportunity for all individuals, regardless of age, race, gender, creed, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected category pursuant to applicable federal, state, or local law

title: Staff Data Analyst (Senior eDiscovery Manager)
description: Position Summary... What you'll do... Are you ready to join a team that supports eDiscovery case work for the world’s largest retailer? The eDiscovery manager role is a part of the Global Governance Strategy, Risk & Operations team supporting Global Investigations (GI), Workplace Investigations, Legal Investigations (LI), and other investigative bodies within the Walmart organization. This role... includes the execution of investigation case workflows, electronically stored information (ESI) policies, protocols, procedures, systems, and management of the eDiscovery investigative lifecycle. You’ll make an impact by: You have practical and real-world experience with Relativity. You support a team of investigators or legal professionals with workflow design, case-level support, reporting, and portfolio management activities. You have practical and real-world experience providing consultative services to support the entire EDRM, including advising on approaches for eDiscovery scoping and developing review strategies. You have strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills and can confidently interact with senior leadership and stakeholders. You leverage technology tools to identify trends, risks, business needs, and performance barriers. You can conduct technical training and maintain technical workflow documentation. You can balance a substantial workload with advanced soft skills such as time management, organization, communication, adaptability, critical thinking, creativity, teamwork, leadership, work ethic, and self-awareness. You’ll sweep us off our feet if… You have experience with RelOne. You hold Relativity-specific certifications. You have experience with eDiscovery industry tools (for example, Relativity/RelOne, Nuix, iPro, Brainspace, EnCase) and can perform technical troubleshooting within these tools to resolve any questions or errors within the data set. You have experience executing advanced unstructured data analytics (for example, conceptual searches, categorization, machine learning algorithms). You can develop efficient review workflows with or without the help of a managed document review team. You have extensive excel experience for tracking and reporting on metrics to measure case performance, turnaround times, and outcomes. You are comfortable building relationships, leveraging internal partnerships, and working collaboratively on a cross-functional team. You are process-minded and actively seek out opportunities for improved efficiency. You respond under pressure by prioritization or in a strategic that is beneficial to the customer and the team. You have successfully led through transformative change, and you have a bias towards action and execution. Equal Opportunity Employer   Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.   Who We Are Join Walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. Yes, we are the Fortune #1 company. But you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. Join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement.  From day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. careers.walmart.com Minimum Qualifications... Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications. Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 3 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 2: Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 1 year's experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 3: 5 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Preferred Qualifications... Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. Data science, data analysis, statistics, or related field, Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, Related industry experience (for example, retail, merchandising, healthcare, eCommerce), Successful completion of assessments in data analysis and Business Intelligence tools and scripting languages (for example, SQL, Python, Spark, Scala, R, Power BI, or Tableau) Primary Location... 702 SW 8TH ST, BENTONVILLE, AR 72716, United States of America About Walmart: Fifty years ago, Sam Walton started a single mom-and-pop shop and transformed it into the world's biggest retailer. Since those founding days, one thing has remained consistent: our commitment to helping our customers save money so they can live better. Today, we're reinventing the shopping experience and our associates are at the heart of it. You'll play a crucial role in shaping the future of retail, improving millions of lives around the world. This is that place where your passions meet purpose. Join our family and create a career you're proud of

title: Data Analyst
description:
Itero Group is a Women-Owned Small Business focused on bringing simplicity to complex transformations. We empower clients in both the private and government sectors to become more optimized, digitally enabled, and data-driven organizations through our comprehensive business consulting and innovative delivery solutions.

Itero Group's dedicated team members are experienced thought leaders... tenacious workers, and creative thinkers.

We hire people who are passionate about being catalysts for change - in our company, for our clients, and throughout our communities and we empower people to express their ideas, create better practices, innovate better products, and become better professionals.

We have been named a Great Place to Work three years in a row, offer a competitive salary and benefits package.

We are hiring a Data Analyst for a remote position.

We are seeking a motivated, career, and customer-oriented Data Analyst to join our team in the Reston, VA (or remote) to provide unparalleled support to multiple federal agencies through the Continuous Diagnostics &
Mitigation (CDM) Program. The CDM Program is a high-profile, high-visibility, cybersecurity modernization and risk management program where you can contribute innovative solutions and consult with multiple federal agencies to enhance their Information Assurance (IA) programs and continuous monitoring capabilities.

This position also requires developing analysis and reporting of Data, including identifying data gaps. The successful candidate will bring a consultative approach to data analysis in solving our clients' cyber security problems, coupled with demonstrated experience designing and developing enterprise data solutions for Federal government clients.

This is not a database administrator role, but a hands-on Data Analyst position.

Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will: * Review, Identify, Analyze data from multiple source Cyber Security tools at multiple agencies.
• Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports based on the customer needs.
• Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
• Acquire data from primary and other data sources and maintain databases/data systems
• Run ad-hoc reports from source systems and work with Tool SMEs, integration developers in identifying data defects.
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Analyze source data and types, identify data requirements for destination systems.
• Analyze, interpret, and report on data based on Data Dictionary &
Logical Data Models guidance.
• Work with Agency and Agency representatives in resolving data quality, completeness, and accuracy issues.
• Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
• Ensure mapping of data elements provided by COTS products to the Logical Data Model
• Other duties as assigned

Position Requirements * Proven working experience with large Data set from multiple systems including machine data, cyber security tool data and other relevant data that is used within an enterprise for security posture.
• Proficient at querying data in MS/Azure SQL server and Elasticsearch/Kibana for data issues, gaps, and trend
• Writing reports and presenting findings
• Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
• Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL, MySql etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
• Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
• Experience in translating derived requirements by analyzing Logical Data Models and Data Dictionary to provide data mapping from source systems.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Experience with collaborating with other roles, such as solution architects, data engineers, data scientists, AI engineers, database administrators, and developers.
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in Data Analytic work for mission critical systems within Fed/CIV, DOD, or Client
• Minimum of 5 years of experience performing or assisting in the analysis of enterprise IT logs, data, and/or information preferably in Security Operations
• Experience collaborating with Federal clients to mature operational processes, reduce redundancies, and develop innovative solutions
• Experience understanding organizational needs, proposing solutions, and managing project execution efforts designed to deliver overall program benefits for Government Agencies
• Experience collaborating with US Government Agencies, state or local governments, or commercial entities to develop IT service program maturity in accordance with Federal IT mandates and best practices
• Experience in conducting assessments of an Enterprise by reviewing technical documentation, conducting interviews and workshops to identify gaps and develop a tailored solution is highly desired
• Demonstrated experience in security solution design using existing as well as emerging technologies to deliver enterprise solutions
• BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Additional Skills * Excellent communication and relationship skills to articulate given analysis and build consensus among clients and technical stakeholders
• Demonstrated ability to present to senior leadership and client audiences
• Strong interpersonal and collaborations skills working in a team-oriented environment
• Ability to effectively prioritize and handle multiple agencies simultaneously
• Microsoft Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
• Experience with JIRA and Agile development practices
• Certification: Security+CE plus

Security/Clearance Requirements * Must be a US citizen and pass a background investigation
• Able to obtain and maintain a Client Suitability/Entry on Duty (EOD) and agency clearances
• Active Secret or Top Secret clearance desired

If you are looking for a role where you will lead with integrity, create and innovate, inspire excellence, be a respected member of the team, drive results and have fun, we look forward to connecting with you!

Itero Group is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, age, sex, color, physical or mental disability, religion, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, or political affiliation
