title: Data AnalystScientist
description:
Job Description

WANT TO BUILD AND DEPLOY ADVANCED MACHINE LEARNING MODELS...

Interested in being the hero of the day? Look no further!

As big data experts, the company specializes in software engineering, data management, augmented reality, internet of things, and cloud computing. With their Innovation Lab, they SOLVE CUSTOMERS' DATA AND TECHNOLOGY CHALLENGES using modern technologies.

A DATA ANALYST/SCIENTIST is needed to help implement NLP, text analytics, machine learning, prediction, and simulation modeling for a client. The team needs your help analyzing data and answering questions. Because you don't know what's going on, the environment can be very exciting. You have different types of challenges at different times, so you get to be the hero of the day! This is an ONSITE POSITION in DAYTON, OH.

YOUR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Help define project objectives and strategies by applying analytic techniques.
• Leading and guiding client and project teams around the methodology.
• Analytically solve complex problems that require a deep understanding of methodologies and principles.
• Build and deploy machine learning models to provide tactical and strategic insights.

REQUIREMENTS:

MUST HAVE’S:
• Advanced experience in corporate IT environments.
• Minimum of 5 years Machine Learning (ML) experience.
• 8 years of experience with a master’s degree OR 5 years with a PhD in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, Mathematics, Operations Research, Statistics, or Engineering.
• Must have or be willing to obtain Secret Clearance (this requires US Citizenship)

SELF-ASSESSMENT QUESTIONS:
• Do you have experience in machine learning?
• Do you have or are willing/able to obtain a Secret clearance?
• Do you have advanced experience in data presentation?
• Do you have a related M.S. or Ph.D. degree?

If you said yes to these, then apply!

TECH STACK:
• Python, PySpark, Databricks, HDFS
• Nifi, Tableau, DevOps, Apache Atlas, Kylo, AWS EMR, RDS, Athena
• AWS Sagemaker, Athena
• Open-source ML software, like SciKit Learn, SparkML, TensorFlow, Horovod, Petastorm

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
• Company has two divisions: Government (Air Force, Navy, Army) and Commercial (Retail, Commerce, Healthcare, Banking, Insurance, Energy)
• Has been in a high growth phase for the past 2-3 years.
• Smaller team: 1 other Data Scientist
• Company provided training opportunities!

INTERVIEW PROCESS:
• THIS IS AN ONSITE POSITION IN DAYTON, OH.
• Only candidates who are US citizens or green card holders will be invited for a client interview.
• Interviews within 1-2 weeks:
• One 30-minute interview with Director of Data Science
• One 30–45-minute technical interview with two data scientists

CONTRACT TERMS:
• SALARY: $120,000 - $140,000
• ON SITE AT WRIGHT-PATTERSON AIR FORCE BASE 3+ DAYS/WEEK
• Long term, full-time, permanent, unlimited assignments.
• Relocation is not included/not supported.
• Desired start date as soon as possible.

EXTRA BENEFITS:
• Competitive Salary
• Generous PTO
• Medical Insurance
• Dental & Vision Insurance
• 401K Match
• Short/Long term Disability Insurance

Our preferred partner is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. Acceptable candidates must successfully pass a drug test and background screen.

Company Description

As big data experts, the company specializes in software engineering, data management, augmented reality, internet of things, and cloud computing. With their Innovation Lab, they solve customers' data and technology challenges using modern technologies

IDR is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our industry-leading client in the pharmaceutical industry!

The Data Analyst will work on Business Intelligence initiatives, as well as develop and analyze reposts using Power BI...

This role has a Hybrid Schedule which requires onsite work in Dallas, TX 2 days per week.

Desired Skills:
• 4 + years of experience as a Data Analyst
• 3 + years of experience developing/analyzing reports using Power BI

Why IDR?

title: GIS Data Analyst/Developer
description:
I am seeking a talented and experienced GIS Data Analyst/Developer to help us build a platform for studying population density changes in a city. The ideal candidate will have a background in GIS and data analysis, as well as experience with software development and data visualization.

Responsibilities...

- Collect and clean GIS data on population density and other relevant factors for cities

- Use GIS software and data visualization tools to create maps and other visualizations of population density changes

- Analyze the data to understand patterns and trends in population density changes, and to identify the causes of any changes

- Develop and maintain the platform for studying population density changes, including the data collection, analysis, and visualization components

If you are a talented and motivated individual who is passionate about using GIS data to understand population density changes, I would love to hear from you

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst (Market Research)

Fully Remote...

6-Month Contract

$60-80/hr

It's time to inspire greatness. If you are interested in storytelling using data and research, using an analytical mind to extract deep insights to leverage data, then this Marketing Research Analyst role is perfect for you. In this role, you will identify key market stats, help strategists and managers understand the data you found, and be a part of an industry that is changing how the world views healthcare systems.

THE COMPANY

A leading healthcare advertising agency is focusing its branding/advertising within an industry that matters. This agency focuses its resources on healthcare/hospital services to bring better health to more people nationwide. As a research data analyst, you will be collaborating with multiple teams and VPs to enhance analysis and quality within their data practice.

THE ROLE

Track, report, and analyze the performance of marketing activities, ad-hoc analytic requests, and development/automation of regular analytics reports by the client
Analyze external and internal customer data using internal business intelligence platform, database spreadsheet (Excel) models, web analytics tools, statistical analysis tools, and campaign management software tools
Analyze A/B and multi-variate tests and communicate results
Provide actionable overall market and customer insights to address key strategic questions

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

A successful Research Data Analyst within this role will likely have the following skills and experience:

2-4 years of work experience in marketing research, statistical or data analysis (or academic equivalent)
2-4 years of experience in statistical analysis (SAS or R)
Experience with Sisense or similar data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Deep understanding of SQL and writing queries to extract, transform and load data
Excellent analytical skills and a high degree of business acumen
Proven ability in handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills

NICE TO HAVE

Background working within the Snowflake platform

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your resume to Fareeda Elsayed via the Apply link on this page

title: BMG Data Analyst
description:
Beasley Media Group (BMG), LLC, is a multiplatform media company providing advertising and digital marketing solutions across the United States. BMG owns 61 radio brands as well as capabilities in audio technology, esports, podcasting, ecommerce, and events.

We are in search of a talented and experienced data analyst who loves storytelling. Our ideal candidate has technical skills for data... interrogation and knows that true insights aren’t just explaining the importance of data correlation but about what a customer can do with that information.

This position will support the corporate revenue and content leadership by harnessing our first party data systems to identify, analyze and interpret trends/patterns to assist BMG in our continuing mission to create engaging content that generates revenue growth. In addition, this team member will be in active collaboration with our talent Digital Operations and Platform teams to assure that data systems are delivering actionable data for insight and analysis.

Our data analyst will also play an integral role in BMG’s ongoing efforts on consumer data privacy and protection.

More specifically you will:
• Work closely with internal clients over time to understand their pain points and help translate those into requirements for queries and models you can run against their data to provide them with actionable insight
• Design tables and views that provide our analyst customers with ongoing data in the most useful formats for them to take action
• identify key insights that aren’t being tracked and help broaden the coverage of what we analyze.
• Present complex data into visualizations and insights for corporate content and revenue teams
• Use your ability to identify and leverage trends in data to inform marketing strategies
• You will develop and maintain customer segmentations and help translate those into requirements for queries you can run against our first party data.
• A focus on identifying and working with the team on developing revenue-generating opportunities for programmatic and direct sales

Essentials:
• You’re proactive, entrepreneurial, and collaborative; you can work well with cross functional teams of Product/Dev/QA and clients, you can spot gaps, and can manage your own work stream
• You have experience working with marketing automation tools such as Braze
• You’ve got multiple years of experience in data analysis, including defining KPIs for various businesses (subscription, ecommerce, publishers, apps, etc.)
• You understand the realities of data collection and have strong familiarity with tools like Amplitude (or similar), mParticle (or similar) etc. You won’t use all those systems, but you have to feel comfortable understanding how different data collection systems work and how you might match up data between multiple systems.
• Familiarity with database analysis required
• You’re a pro working with A/B testing tools and methodologies
• When other tools aren’t available you can make magic happen in Excel

Requirements:
• 3+ years’ experience in data analytics, marketing, and / or statistics
• Bonus if you’ve reported on and evaluated site performance, marketing campaigns, programmatic media platforms, optimization tests, CRM, and other media-based analytics
• Experience generating key insights from raw data
• Knowledge of user experience and optimization best practices
• Experience managing analytics dashboards and producing associated reports in accurate and timely manner
• Self-starter with ability to define day-to-day responsibilities in line with business objectives
• Strong written and verbal communication skills are necessary
• Software: Proficiency with Excel and ideally some experience with SQL.

Please send resume to bmg.platforms@bbgi.com

Beasley Media Group, LLC is an equal opportunity employer

Date: 2/3/23

title: Assistant HR Data Analyst-Corporate Human Resources (Kansas City, MO)
description:
Description

The HR Data Analyst is responsible for the data management, reporting, visualization and analysis of our workforce. This individual will support our human resources team in the development of data driven insights across all functional areas of human resources (e.g., talent acquisition, performance, development, retention, engagement, rewards, etc). The HR Data Analyst must have... experience working with large amounts of data and have the ability to collaborate across teams to provide people and organizational insights through HR business intelligence. This role will sit onsite at the World Headquarters in Kansas City, Missouri.

Duties/Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with human resources team members and business partners to understand and identify business needs, make recommendations, and deliver data.
• Collect, compile and join datasets from multiple sources and human resources information systems (including Applicant Tracking, Learning and Performance Management systems)
• Develop standard and ad hoc reports.
• Collaborate to ensure reports are accurate, timely and high quality.
• Analyze data to discover information, business value, patterns and trends to help guide business decisions.
• Produce reports and visualizations to communicate results and interpretations of trends; effectively communicate findings and provide recommendations to all levels of leadership.
• Work effectively with IT teams on data integrations from multiple HR systems and the data warehouse
• Proactively manage requests and client expectations. Resolve issues in a timely manner and escalate issues when needed.
• All other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Business, Analytics or related field from an accredited program required.
• Demonstrate exceptional judgement and discretion when dealing with highly confidential people and organizational data.
• Excellent verbal/written communication, including the ability to synthesize technical information and communicate it to a non-technical audience.
• Experience building data visualizations that effectively communicate information.
• Experience using Power BI (Power Query) to collect, transform, model, visualize and share data.
• Experience building secure data models for role-based access control.
• Strong proficiency in MS Excel
• Ability to select and join disparate, complex data sets.
• Experience with the Microsoft Power Platform preferred.

EEO/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

Job Business Analysts

Primary Location US-MO-Kansas City

Other Locations United States

Schedule: Full-time

Travel: No

Req ID: 230530

#LI-JP #COR

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Job Description

The CCO Analytics team is a one-stop data team focused on meeting operational needs as the business scales. We’re working hard to build the infrastructure and dashboarding solutions needed to keep Cash going strong...

As a Senior Data Analyst for CCO, you will use your skills to support the organization’s and leadership stakeholders’ data needs. You will build data visualizations that provide insights into how the business is performing, and impactful insights that will drive the business forward. You will drive QA efforts for all CCO data developments such as Reports, ETLs and Dashboards. You will manage data governance efforts and have the drive to improve the business and provide insightful data that will help people become key participants in the economy.

You will:
• Conduct organizational, operational, financial, and analytical studies
• Be a primary contact for executive stakeholders within CCO, driving high-business initiatives and answering high-level business questions for leadership across all data verticals
• Work with various stakeholders and provide them with executive level reports that indicate the pulse and health of their line of business
• Analyze trends, provide insights and gather recommendations, narrative and statistical reports
• Develop QA processes and perform in-depth QA for CS data verticals, to ensure completeness and accuracy, while ensuring optimization techniques and practices are followed for ETLs, scripts and dashboards
• Produce ad-hoc data analysis that answers pivotal questions about the business
• Develop control structures to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels
• Monitor data governance leading processes, policies and standards
• Identify process improvement opportunities for the data analytics team
Qualifications
• 5+ years of analytics experience or equivalent, preferably in an operations environment, or a related degree
• 3+ years of working with customer success CX metrics/KPIs
• 3+ years managing executive level stakeholder relationships and providing executive level reporting
• 2+ years of managing data governance efforts experience in a support or financial organization
• Robust Customer Experience Metrics Best Practices knowledge
• Strong business analysis and writing skills
• Tableau Certification or Data Visualization tool Certification
• Ability to communicate and partner with both business and technical teams
• Advanced technical skills including, but not limited to, SQL, Tableau, Looker and cloud environments
• Clear understanding of statistical knowledge such as, but not limited to, A/B testing, linear regression, ANOVA
• Excellent organization skills, attention to detail and strategic mindset
• Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment

title: Senior Data Analyst + Product Owner (100% Remote)
description:
ImagineX is a rapidly growing technology consulting firm with an obsession for consistently delivering excellence to clients while always remaining passionate for what we do. At IX we understand that happy consultants make happy clients, so nothing is more important to us than a strong culture, solid leadership, collaboration, open communication, and supporting our people each and every day.

We... are looking for a Senior Delivery Consultant with expertise as Business/Data Analyst/Product Owner. You will provide services to support the customer's application security solution in order to enhance the functionality, evolve and improve the overall solution, and to provide ongoing operational and adoption support to maintain the solution. This is a full-time/direct hire position but we are open to contractors or contract to hire as well.

At ImagineX you will enjoy working with a sharp, energetic & fun group of consultants. No big egos allowed! We offer unlimited PTO, 401K match, exciting projects, and the opportunity to work with a variety of bleeding edge technologies. Be a leader, have a voice, and make an impact at ImagineX Consulting!

Duties:

Act as a point of contact for solution questions, reports of issues, and enhancement requests

Lead daily stand-ups and other stakeholder review meetings

Drive resolution of questions and reported issues through consultation with relevant team members or stakeholders

Conduct training and education sessions to support Solution usage and adoption

Support resolution of data defects and/or anomalies

Develop functional requirements for net new controls

Function as the intake point for changes to existing and net new requirements

Provide functional support and direction to the Data Engineer

Document and execution of User Acceptance Testing of the solution

Technical / Functional Skills

Bachelor's Degree

Management consulting experience (Big4 preferred but not required)

5+ years of Data (Business) Analyst experience gathering and documenting business requirements in support of the customer's vision

2+ years experience with supporting a platform or data solution

Understand thoroughly the application's business space and its underlying data, inputs, and outputs

SQL knowledge - ability to read and understand SQL handed off

Collaborate with technical staff to define the customer's requirements from an implementation perspective and assess feasibility of proposed designs and solutions

Partner with development staff to triage and remediate production support issues

Work with the customer and team to refine the priorities within the Product Backlog

Ability to work independently and proactively, and is committed to excellence in client delivery

Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement

Strong experience with sharing information using MS Excel with knowledge of vlookup

title: Data Analyst, Digital (Remote)
description:
Overview

The Digital Data Analyst is responsible for the overall analytic support of the IDEAL Digital Center of Excellence. They provide analytic support for a set of global businesses in the IDEAL family. Additionally, they create dashboards and reports that transform analytics into digestible formats while also drawing insights and providing opportunities and recommendations from data sets... This position is central in the creation and adoption of a data-driven culture. The position reports to the Director of Digital Marketing.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
• Develop on-going and ad hoc reports & analyses that encompass all aspects of the digital experience: customer, website, social media, lead generation and nurture, A/B testing etc
• Utilize end-user data to create customer insights that will help inform personas and targeting
• Ability to see patterns and insights across digital tactics and draw them together
• Utilize Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Marketo, Salesforce and other various tools to create reports and dashboards
• Create scheduled reports that align to identified KPI’s and present them on-time, in a digestible format that should include visuals, value-add insights, successes & failures and opportunities
• Use both post tactic assessment as well as predictive and anomaly detection tactics to drive businesses forward
• Manages all user access to digital platforms
• Act as knowledge center for digital analytic tools at IDEAL

Qualifications

Qualifications:
• Four-year college degree in Data Science, Analytics or other related major.
• High proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel. Experience with basic and advanced formulas, v-lookups and pivot tables is a must. Knowledge of macros preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Solution oriented, self-starter
• Analytic mind-set
• Ability to turn large datasets into meaningful out puts
• Attention to detail and drive for results
• Possess and business acumen in order to understand operational interaction between departments
• Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our team.

About Us...

The Middleton Group is a growing family-owned business, a privately held group of companies located near Branson in the town of Hollister, Missouri. The group of companies include: Memco, Inc., an industrial and safety products supply company, and M&M Poultry Equipment, Inc., a Poultry Processing Equipment company. The organization has 6 warehouse locations throughout southwest Missouri, Arkansas, Alabama, and Virginia.

Job Summary:

We are seeking an individual who is motivated, team-oriented, organized and takes direction well. You must possess a logical mind set and excellent people skills to work closely with IT Director and staff. This candidate must be able to handle high stress situations and tight timelines while still producing a good end product.

Job Responsibilities:

The data analyst will be responsible for data collection, representation, and maintenance within the company’s systems. They will be responsible for updating existing reports, creating new reports as requested, and recommending action to fix dirty data that they encounter. This position will also be largely responsible for planning, implementing, and maintaining a sales forecasting solution (3rd party, not in house) in the near future.

All of the data that we’re using will be stored in either a Microsoft SQL server or SharePoint lists. We are currently in the process of migrating all reporting from Crystal Reports to Power BI. All reporting in the company was built with either Crystal Reports, Power BI, or Excel.

Requirements

Education and Experience:
• 5+ years of computer experience
• Ability to gather and analyze statistical data and generate reports
• Ability to troubleshoot and solve problems and client issues while being courteous and non-technical to staff
• Experience with database relationship links and querying is required
• Valid Driver’s License

Qualifications and Education Requirements

Preferred 2+ years of experience in a similar role.
• Required skills
• Data Visualization Techniques
• Excel
• Microsoft SQL
• Crystal Reporting Suite
• SharePoint Online (enough to pull and work with data in the backend)
• Power BI

Compensation and Benefits:
• Competitive wage; commensurate with experience
• Benefits package available

Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Flexible spending account
• Health insurance
• Health savings account
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Professional development assistance
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We are an essential company. Vaccinations are not required.

Experience:
• Computer operation: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: One location

title: SIU Data Analyst (Hybrid Work Options)
description:
A company built to serve you. It's your career, Shelter it!

Special Investigations Unit Data Analyst...

$49,962 - $72,744 / year

Job Level: Individual Contributor

What You Will Be Doing:

This position requires expertise with data analysis, investigates suspicious behavior, and communicates new insights to SIU and other departments. Identifies needed data from a variety of sources and programs while fine tuning a fraud detection and analytical platform. Analyzes extensive “big data” to find complex fraud schemes and trends in all geographic areas. Effectively identifies and obtains needed data and information from business intelligence tools and various data sources to build solutions for Special Investigations Unit to help detect, investigate, and reduce insurance fraud.

What We're Looking For:

Minimum 3 years' experience in fraud investigation and Designation of Certified Insurance Fraud Analyst (CIFA) are preferred
Superior analytical, investigative, problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
A keen eye for detail, accuracy, and strong critical thinking skills with advanced judgment capability.
Strong data analysis skills that preferably includes experience with MS Excel, MS Access, SAS programming, SQL skills, and business intelligence tools.
Superior interpersonal skills to effectively function in lead roles, train others on system and procedures, and conduct meetings.
Ability to manage time effectively, maintain schedules to meet deadlines, and work well within a team environment.
Extensive multi-tasking and prioritization skills to excel in fast-paced environment with frequently changing priorities.
Business knowledge in insurance, claims, and other business processes for enhancing analysis.
Ability to perform the essential functions of the position, with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Shelter's uncompromising commitment to excellence doesn't stop with our customers. We recognize our employees are what make us a premier organization in the insurance industry. Shelter Employees enjoy such benefits as:

Health, Dental, Voluntary Vision and Prescription Drug Insurance
Savings and Profit Sharing 401(k)
Paid Time Off for Sick and Personal Leave, Vacation and Holidays
Vitality Wellness Program
'Dress for Your Day' Dress Code
Flexible Scheduling
And much more!

#IND1#

If interested, please apply by:

02/17/2023

title: Data Analyst
description:
Overview:

For over forty years, Collins Engineers, Inc. (Collins) has provided specialized civil and structural engineering services to the transportation, marine, site development, and construction industries. In the last five years, we have expanded our offerings to include Software as a Service (SaaS) for our clients’ asset and maintenance management. We encourage independent, critical... thinkers who grow and expand the ways in which we serve our public and private clients. We foster an environment of personal and professional growth, as well as individual responsibility, throughout our many offices and specializations.

The Chicago, IL office has an opening for a Data Analyst position. This position reports directly to the Atom Group Manager, or as assigned.
Position Description:

TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
• Writes SQL queries to visualize data and create custom reports using business intelligence tools
• Ensures high data integrity through troubleshooting and analysis
• Assists with bug reporting and troubleshooting reported issues using business analytics tools
• Assists with data cleansing and data validation for migration large sets of data

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in related fields (Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Economics, etc)
• Knowledge of Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, and Slides)
• Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Teams, Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
• Knowledge of relational databases and data warehouses (BigQuery, etc)
• Knowledge of business intelligence tools (Google Looker Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
• Proficient in basic data analysis using Excel and Google Sheets
• Working knowledge of SQL and intermediate proficiency
• Interpersonal communication skills

Additional Information:

View physical demands and our commitment to safety. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

As a federal contractor, Collins Engineers is a drug and alcohol-free workplace.

Notice to Third Party Agencies

Collins Engineers, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action/M/F/Vet/Disability Employer.

For more information, please download the below documents:

EEO is the Law Poster | EEO is the Law Supplement | Pay Transparency Policy Statement
• Note: to enable links and learn more about our benefits and culture, please view this posting on the Collins website at https://www.collinsengr.com/careers/benefits

title: Senior Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
Company Description

It all started with an idea at Block in 2013. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic ecosystem, developing unique financial products, including Afterpay, to provide a better way to send, spend, invest, borrow and save to our 47 million monthly active customers. We want to... redefine the world’s relationship with money to make it more relatable, instantly available, and universally accessible. This is our mission, and it’s why working at Cash App means so much more than a job.
Today, Cash App has thousands of employees working globally across office and remote locations, with a culture geared toward innovation, collaboration and impact. We’ve been a distributed team since day one, and many of our roles can be done remotely from the countries where Cash App operates. No matter the location, we tailor our experience to ensure our employees are creative, productive, and happy.
Check out our locations, benefits, and more at cash.app/careers!
Job Description

The CCO Analytics team is a one-stop data team focused on meeting operational needs as the business scales. We’re working hard to build the infrastructure and dashboarding solutions needed to keep Cash going strong.

As a Senior Data Analyst for CCO, you will use your skills to support the organization's and leadership stakeholders' data needs. You will build data visualizations that provide insights into how the business is performing, and impactful insights that will drive the business forward. You will drive QA efforts for all CCO data developments such as Reports, ETLs and Dashboards. You will manage data governance efforts and have the drive to improve the business and provide insightful data that will help people become key participants in the economy.

You will:
• Conduct organizational, operational, financial, and analytical studies
• Be a primary contact for executive stakeholders within CCO, driving high-business initiatives and answering high-level business questions for leadership across all data verticals
• Work with various stakeholders and provide them with executive level reports that indicate the pulse and health of their line of business
• Analyze trends, provide insights and gather recommendations, narrative and statistical reports
• Develop QA processes and perform in-depth QA for CS data verticals, to ensure completeness and accuracy, while ensuring optimization techniques and practices are followed for ETLs, scripts and dashboards
• Produce ad-hoc data analysis that answers pivotal questions about the business
• Develop control structures to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels
• Monitor data governance leading processes, policies and standards
• Identify process improvement opportunities for the data analytics team

Qualifications
• 5+ years of analytics experience or equivalent, preferably in an operations environment, or a related degree
• 3+ years of working with customer success CX metrics/KPIs
• 3+ years managing executive level stakeholder relationships and providing executive level reporting
• 2+ years of managing data governance efforts experience in a support or financial organization
• Robust Customer Experience Metrics Best Practices knowledge
• Strong business analysis and writing skills
• Tableau Certification or Data Visualization tool Certification
• Ability to communicate and partner with both business and technical teams
• Advanced technical skills including, but not limited to, SQL, Tableau, Looker and cloud environments
• Clear understanding of statistical knowledge such as, but not limited to, A/B testing, linear regression, ANOVA
• Excellent organization skills, attention to detail and strategic mindset
• Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment

Additional Information

Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.
Zone A: USD $138,200 - USD $169,000
Zone B: USD $128,500 - USD $157,100
Zone C: USD $121,700 - USD $148,700
Zone D: USD $110,600 - USD $135,200

To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information.

Benefits include the following:
• Healthcare coverage
• Retirement Plans including company match
• Employee Stock Purchase Program
• Wellness programs, including access to mental health, 1:1 financial planners, and a monthly wellness allowance
• Paid parental and caregiving leave
• Paid time off
• Learning and Development resources
• Paid Life insurance, AD&D. and disability benefits
• Perks such as WFH reimbursements and free access to caregiving, legal, and discounted resources

This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.

Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.

Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Posting Title: Data Analyst

What does a successful Data Analyst do at Fiserv...

Fiserv is a world-class data and analytics organization delivering the next generation of powerful data insights and decisioning solutions to financial institutions, fintech, consumer/business credit bureaus, government agencies and merchants.

As a successful Data Analyst, you will work within Output Solutions to support reporting and data needs for the business.

What you will do:

You will work requests (internal and external client requests, tickets, emails etc.) and/or be involved in projects which require data analysis and efficiency metrics reporting using tools like Power BI and Excel.

You will be required to query data from different sources, create refresh schedules, set process flows, update, and maintain distribution lists, format report extracts, and build dashboards.

In this role, you can look forward to performing data reviews, profiling, generating data-driven business insights, and strategy recommendations to improve ROI.

You will be generating insights through data mining, analysis, and machine learning. You will be expected to build and maintain datasets and queries used for reporting and analysis, manage monthly ETL processes, performs data reconciliations, create recurring and ad-hoc reports, or data extracts as requested for both internal and external consumption.

You will work closely with various teams to understand how to support operations via report visualizations, alert notifications, automating reporting functions, and designing and implementing data solutions required to optimize workflows by the business.

What you will need to have:
• High school diploma or equivalent is required
• 3+ years’ hands-on experience with business analysis, capacity planning, and/or workforce management
• Experience with Power BI, Proficient in MS Office Tools

What would be great to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Management/Business or related field
• Knowledge of programming languages (C#, VB.Net, Java, PL/SQL)
• Proficient with Structured Query Language (SQL)
• Formulate a solid understanding of our reporting platform, data infrastructure, business drivers and how data is used to inform and direct decisions and behaviors
• Identify source data issues, open and escalate incidents as needed
• Mine and clean data in preparation for analysis
• Design dynamic self-service dashboards, develop models, and analytics solutions as applicable

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us!

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Description

A-LINE STAFFING IS NOW HIRING A DATA ANALYTICS COORDINATOR IN COLUMBUS, OH. The DATA ANALYTICS COORDINATOR would be working for a Fortune 500 company and has career growth potential. This would be FULL TIME / 40+ HOURS PER WEEK...

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN THIS POSITION, PLEASE CONTACT ROB SUFFREDINI AT (586)710-7950 OR ROB@ALINESTAFFING.COM

DATA ANALYTICS COORDINATOR COMPENSATION
• The pay for this position is $32.10 per hour
• Benefits are available to full-time employees after 90 days of employment and include health, optical, dental, life, and short-term disability insurance
• A 401(k) with a company match is available for full-time employees with 1 year of service on our eligibility dates

DATA ANALYTICS COORDINATOR HIGHLIGHTS
• This position is a contract assignment with potential to hire on permanently based upon attendance, performance, and business needs
• The required availability for this position is Monday - Friday 40hrs weekly, Hybrid

DATA ANALYTICS COORDINATOR RESPONSIBILITIES

· Analyzing various spreadsheets​

· Working within SFTP Client and uploading data to the Cardinal Health SFTP Site​

· Analyzing data; exception handling

· Merging data files - adding corrections to original file

· Querying from Database

· Maintaining up-to-date information to provide client with the most timely and accurate updates available

· Written and/or verbal communication with internal and external clients

· Assisting with other projects as needed

DATA ANALYTICS COORDINATOR REQUIREMENTS

· Bachelor's degree preferred, high school diploma with equivalent experience acceptable

· Minimum 2 yrs. work experience

· Strong written and verbal communication skills

· Team Player

· Organized and detail-oriented

· Savvy technical skills

· Intermediate skills in Microsoft Office products (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word)

· Customer service, problem solving, and analytical skills required

· Database skills required

· SFTP and FileZelle skills preferred but not required

· Work from home ready

· Covid Vaccination

If you think this DATA ANALYTICS COORDINATOR position is a good fit for you, please reach out to me - feel free to call, e-mail, or apply to this posting! ROB SUFFREDINI (586)710-7950 ROB@ALINESTAFFING.COM

title: Data Analyst
description:
Overview:

For over forty years, Collins Engineers, Inc. (Collins) has provided specialized civil and structural engineering services to the transportation, marine, site development, and construction industries. In the last five years, we have expanded our offerings to include Software as a Service (SaaS) for our clients’ asset and maintenance management. We encourage independent, critical... thinkers who grow and expand the ways in which we serve our public and private clients. We foster an environment of personal and professional growth, as well as individual responsibility, throughout our many offices and specializations.

The Chicago, IL office has an opening for a Data Analyst position. This position reports directly to the Atom Group Manager, or as assigned.
Position Description:

TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
• Writes SQL queries to visualize data and create custom reports using business intelligence tools
• Ensures high data integrity through troubleshooting and analysis
• Assists with bug reporting and troubleshooting reported issues using business analytics tools
• Assists with data cleansing and data validation for migration large sets of data

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in related fields (Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Economics, etc)
• Knowledge of Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, and Slides)
• Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Teams, Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
• Knowledge of relational databases and data warehouses (BigQuery, etc)
• Knowledge of business intelligence tools (Google Looker Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
• Proficient in basic data analysis using Excel and Google Sheets
• Working knowledge of SQL and intermediate proficiency
• Interpersonal communication skills

Additional Information:

View physical demands and our commitment to safety. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

As a federal contractor, Collins Engineers is a drug and alcohol-free workplace.

Notice to Third Party Agencies

Collins Engineers, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action/M/F/Vet/Disability Employer.

For more information, please download the below documents:

EEO is the Law Poster | EEO is the Law Supplement | Pay Transparency Policy Statement
• Note: to enable links and learn more about our benefits and culture, please view this posting on the Collins website at https://www.collinsengr.com/careers/benefits

title: Data Analyst, Digital (Remote)
description:
Overview

The Digital Data Analyst is responsible for the overall analytic support of the IDEAL Digital Center of Excellence. They provide analytic support for a set of global businesses in the IDEAL family. Additionally, they create dashboards and reports that transform analytics into digestible formats while also drawing insights and providing opportunities and recommendations from data sets... This position is central in the creation and adoption of a data-driven culture. The position reports to the Director of Digital Marketing.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
• Develop on-going and ad hoc reports & analyses that encompass all aspects of the digital experience: customer, website, social media, lead generation and nurture, A/B testing etc
• Utilize end-user data to create customer insights that will help inform personas and targeting
• Ability to see patterns and insights across digital tactics and draw them together
• Utilize Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Marketo, Salesforce and other various tools to create reports and dashboards
• Create scheduled reports that align to identified KPI’s and present them on-time, in a digestible format that should include visuals, value-add insights, successes & failures and opportunities
• Use both post tactic assessment as well as predictive and anomaly detection tactics to drive businesses forward
• Manages all user access to digital platforms
• Act as knowledge center for digital analytic tools at IDEAL

Qualifications

Qualifications:
• Four-year college degree in Data Science, Analytics or other related major.
• High proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel. Experience with basic and advanced formulas, v-lookups and pivot tables is a must. Knowledge of macros preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Solution oriented, self-starter
• Analytic mind-set
• Ability to turn large datasets into meaningful out puts
• Attention to detail and drive for results
• Possess and business acumen in order to understand operational interaction between departments
• Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst (Market Research)

Fully Remote...

6-Month Contract

$60-80/hr

It's time to inspire greatness. If you are interested in storytelling using data and research, using an analytical mind to extract deep insights to leverage data, then this Marketing Research Analyst role is perfect for you. In this role, you will identify key market stats, help strategists and managers understand the data you found, and be a part of an industry that is changing how the world views healthcare systems.

THE COMPANY

A leading healthcare advertising agency is focusing its branding/advertising within an industry that matters. This agency focuses its resources on healthcare/hospital services to bring better health to more people nationwide. As a research data analyst, you will be collaborating with multiple teams and VPs to enhance analysis and quality within their data practice.

THE ROLE

Track, report, and analyze the performance of marketing activities, ad-hoc analytic requests, and development/automation of regular analytics reports by the client
Analyze external and internal customer data using internal business intelligence platform, database spreadsheet (Excel) models, web analytics tools, statistical analysis tools, and campaign management software tools
Analyze A/B and multi-variate tests and communicate results
Provide actionable overall market and customer insights to address key strategic questions

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

A successful Research Data Analyst within this role will likely have the following skills and experience:

2-4 years of work experience in marketing research, statistical or data analysis (or academic equivalent)
2-4 years of experience in statistical analysis (SAS or R)
Experience with Sisense or similar data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Deep understanding of SQL and writing queries to extract, transform and load data
Excellent analytical skills and a high degree of business acumen
Proven ability in handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills

NICE TO HAVE

Background working within the Snowflake platform

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your resume to Fareeda Elsayed via the Apply link on this page

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Piper Companies is looking for a Senior Data Analyst for a client of ours that is a purpose-driven company that helps organizations turn employee feedback into useful business intelligence and credible employer recognition through Top Workplaces.

This a fulltime/direct position with our client. It's 100% remote...

Your mission as a Senior Data Engineer is to work cross-functionally across all areas of the company to

help design and build the data integrations, management, models and analysis that inform the complex

decisions we make as we grow and evolve our SaaS-based products and processes.

In This Role You'll...

• Apply database modeling and database exploration skills with data architecture strategy and

• design principles to support metrics, analytics, AI/machine learning, and self-service business

• intelligence across the company.

• Carry out work related to development, transfer, verification, security, integrity, manipulation, and

• maintenance of all data assets.

• Focus on data architecture and strategy responsibilities to drive data insights and analytics,

• marketing effectiveness, channel optimization, improved customer experience, customer

• acquisition, and metrics used to measure compliance and improve operational efficiency

• Gather detailed business requirements from clients, and work on data designs to support

• applications/metrics, design data interfaces and data architecture for data product deliverables,

• Oversee ETL/ELT processes

• Build out, maintain, and look after our dbt, Looker and other data models ensuring good quality

• and consistency, enhancing our data models with new sources or additional information as

• needed

• Maintain documentation

• Formulate and execute strategy around new reporting technologies

• What You Bring to the Role:

• Prior experience with Snowflake or comparable cloud data platforms

• Familiarity with Looker/Tableau or other data visualization tools

• Experience with Python in an automation/analytics capacity

• Proficiency in SQL (LookML a plus)

• Advanced database and data manipulation skills

• Strong analytical skills

• Keen attention to detail with an ability to identify and reconcile data inconsistencies

• Stellar communication skills - including the ability to effectively communicate complex technical

• issues to a non-technical audience and engage in productive dialog involving multiple viewpoints

• or conflicting perspectives

• Ability to design and build solutions that align technical goals with business goals.

• Must be able to successfully work on multiple projects simultaneously and work under tight

• deadlines in a results-oriented environment.

• Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience

Nice to Have's:

• Familiarity with dbt for data transformation

• Microsoft Azure & Azure Application Insights

Benefits

3 weeks paid time off

Company pays a portion of individual health care premium

Option to participate in a company-sponsored 401(k), with

company match dependent on

employee contribution

Training and education

Tuition reimbursement program

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Billingsley Company has an exciting opportunity for a Marketing Data Analyst to support our overall marketing endeavors across the company. This role will be responsible for helping to drive business decisions based on analytics and marketing insights, optimizing campaign effectiveness, and playing a key strategic role in the overall marketing function within Billingsley. This position will... engage with all of Billingsley's portfolios including Multifamily, Office, Retail, Events and Industrial.

Job Responsibilities:

Support the Marketing team using analytics and customer insights across all verticals

Use data to scale trends and customer insights

Develop benchmarks based on meticulously gathered data

Provide analysis, reporting, and actionable recommendations to marketing leadership

Collect and analyze large datasets from multiple sources

Help develop and manage key marketing funnel metrics to drive revenue growth and enable forecasting

Proactively surface potential problems within the marketing funnel and work with Marketing & Operations teams to create action plans

Leverage data to tell a story and present it through data visualizations in compelling dashboards and reports, to aid in decision making

Quantify the impact of marketing campaigns using cutting-edge platforms and data modeling

Create presentations and deliverables based upon data analytics and modeling

Supervise usage metrics across marketing platforms and digital functions

Additional day-to-day business responsibilities include:

Participating in team meetings

Maintaining status reports and timelines

Qualifications

Job Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in data science, statistics, or similar field (or equivalent work experience) required

3+ years of experience in prior strategic analytical roles, heavily focused on marketing analytics, business analytics, digital marketing or similar analytics field work-related experience

Superior quantitative analysis skills

Proven ability to develop compelling data models and presentations

Proficiency with numerous modern data science and marketing technologies

Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics and data intelligence tools like Tableau, Power BI, Azure or Google Data Studio

Experience analyzing demographic datapoints using software like Claritas, ESRI and US Census data

Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite Word, Excel, Sharepoint, OneDrive

Proficient in marketing and advertising terms and processes

Self-starter with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and remain organized under tight deadlines

Be a solutions-oriented thinker, working closely with various individuals and teams to provide positive ideas and recommendations to overcome sales and marketing challenges

Benefits and Perks:

Competitive salary

Robust benefit package, including Medical, Dental, and Vision

Company-paid Life and Disability coverage

401(k) with generous company match

Employee apartment lease discounts available

Monthly employee recognition awards

Career path and growth opportunities available

Fun and team-oriented culture

title: Data Analyst
description:
Junior Data Analyst - Warrington - SQL / Excel

4 days a week in the office

Salary up to £38K DOE

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join a well-established B2C Ecommerce company based in Warrington who are looking for a Data Analyst to join their team. With a team of 12 people, you'd be given lots of opportunity to grow and bring your own ideas to the team.

You'd be working as the sole Data Analyst in the company but there is an external agency working on data projects that you'd be working closely with, so you'd get great autonomy on projects and ability to really make the role your own.

Skillset:
• At least 1 year working as a Data Analyst or similar role
• Technical knowledge regarding data models and data mining
• Data Cleansing and acquiring data from primary and secondary sources
• SQL
• ETL
• Reporting - PowerBI / Tableau
• Statistics - Excel / SSPS / SAS
• Analytical Skillset and Mindset
• Report writing and presenting data
• Experience in Ecommerce / B2C ... fashion / clothing all beneficial but not necessary

This role would be reporting to the Head of Marketing and Ecommerce and would be an integral position within the business. You'd be given a great opportunity to grow with the business and to expand your skillset as well as being encouraged to bring your own ideas to the table and grow the data function internally.

The company are based in Warrington and people work 4 days a week in the office, it's just off the M62 so is very accessible from many areas if you can drive.

This is an urgent requirement so don't hesitate to apply or call Becky on 0161 4861599 or email your CV to Rebecca.atkins@

Junior Data Analyst - Warrington - SQL / Excel

title: Data Analyst - Remote - Up to £75k
description:
Data Analyst - Remote - Up to £75k

I'm currently working with a client who specialises in providing end-to-end solutions for clients across a range of industries. They are a rapidly growing consultancy who are looking for talented, enthusiastic people to join their multi-disciplinary team. Founded over 10 years ago they have gone from strength to strength and continue to do so as they expand their services and take on more complex challenges for their clients.

The role itself is a Data/Performance Analyst position. You will be working with major clients in the public sector to help analyse the performance of digital services and advise on the best technologies and frameworks to suit their specific needs. This opportunity will provide you with the chance to learn new technologies and develop your existing skills further whilst working towards your career aspirations.

This is a salaried position of up to £75,000 depending on experience. They offer a fantastic benefits package... including 25 days holiday + bank hols, flexible working, pension contributions of up to 6%, learning budget, childcare vouchers and much more!
They pride themselves on being an employee orientated business and as such, they strongly believe in providing a healthy work life balance. Applicants will be working mainly remote, but with an expectation to travel as and when required.

I am looking for...
• Strong experience with Google Analytics is essential
• Experience with Data Studio (preferred) or other visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau)
• Experience with Splunk (desirable)
• Project Management experience (bonus)
• Experience working in agile and scrum environment
• Strong Communication skills

This is a great opportunity to join an outstanding organisation who pride themselves on empowering their people and making a bigger impact on society.

If this is of interest then get in touch ASAP. Send across your CV to or alternatively, give me a call on

Key Skills: Google Analytics, Analytics, Data Studio, Splunk, Datadog, Power BI, Tableau, Agile, Scrum, Digital, Performance, Performance Analyst, Data Analyst, Analyst

This role offers hybrid working, 3 days office, 2 days home.

Reporting to the Head of Reporting and MI, the successful Data / MI Analyst will form part of a small but highly skilled team responsible for the delivery of a high quality "middle and back office" analysis and reporting.

Taking responsibility for collecting and processing data from relevant systems
Reconciling data between systems
Support on system provider oversight
Support on manager engagement relating to operational matters
Preparation and development of monthly and quarterly data packs
Maintaining working documents relating to cost information
Working proactively with colleagues to develop reporting

Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Demonstrable experience of... providing data and reporting in a fast-paced environment
Strong attention to detail and the ability to deliver against deadlines

title: (75B) Senior Data Analyst
description:
People at Pret work hard, have fun, learn a lot and really grow. Right now, we’re looking for a passionate Senior Data Analyst to join us.

The Role

Pret has become the nation’s favourite for freshly made food and organic coffee and is now a high street staple in the UK and major cities globally. Pret is seeking a Customer focused Senior Data Analyst to help all our markets & business through the next phase of its data journey. The role will report into our Analytics & Data Science Lead as part of the central Data & Insight function.

This role is focused on helping teams across Pret become more data centric understanding the data we have available and using analysis and data science techniques to ensure that decisions are made based on this data. With huge amounts of customer data being captured from every interaction these customers have with Pret, this Senior Data Analyst will work closely with our Marketing, Trading and Digital Product teams to help them understand performance... build our customer segments who can be targeted with appropriate communications or promotions.

It is important for the successful candidate to be an effective and credible collaborator both physically in person and virtually across our markets, working hand-in-glove with the both our global teams as well as the stakeholders across each market. This role represents an exceptional opportunity for a passionate data analyst to help Pret truly understand their customers and use this to build relationships with those customers driving engagement and value.

Responsibilities
• Supporting our Analytics & Data Science Lead and wider Data team with requests from across the business
• Using SQL and Python to analyse data sets and help the business to answer specific questions or better understand behaviours and trends that can help inform decision making
• Analysing customer behaviours to understand key acquisition and retention drivers and working with the Digital Marketing and
• Trading team in order to utilise this data
• Building out customer segments based on behaviours including value, recency, products purchased and other factors in order to enable targeted communications and promotions
• Analysing customer churn and building models to identify key characteristics or behaviours that flag that customers have a higher propensity to churn and therefore are at risk
• Providing actionable insight that will influence commercial decisions, improve customer engagement and drive the efficiency of our activities
• Supporting the creation and timely delivery of high-quality data reports to key stakeholders
• Utilising data visualisations and storytelling to demonstrate the value of insight to senior stakeholders
• Being a key point of contact for the business on important questions related to customer data and insight
• Monitoring trends in data and making suggestions for how we can improve the quality and veracity of both the internal and external data sources that we collect and use as a business

Skills and experience
• 5+ years working in a senior data analyst role with experience in a fast-paced environment, answering key business questions with analytical rigour
• Extensive experience in bringing data to life either agency or client side with a particular focus on analysing customer data from a segmentation and acquisition / retention perspective
• Extensive experience using SQL and Python
• Experience working with Databricks / Snowflake a plus
• A data driven, strategic thinker with a pro-active approach to delivering quality and value
• Ability to meet deadlines and a capable communicator in conveying research results, whether written, verbal or via presentation to all levels of management
• A good knowledge of Pret a Manger and its current propositions
• Ability to establish, develop and foster effective relationships across the business
• Experience with reporting solutions (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik) also a plus
• An aptitude for problem solving
• Able to communicate complex ideas clearly and simply

Pret Behaviours
• Passion
• Clear Communication
• Team Working
• Great Execution
• Open to Change
• Business Sense
• One Pret

Pret offers:
• Competitive salary and annual bonus
• 33 days holiday a year including Bank Holidays
• Private healthcare
• Life assurance
• Pret pension scheme
• Season ticket loan
• Free lunch and drinks
• 50% discount in Pret shops worldwide
• Great reward and recognition events
• Legendary parties

The deadline for applications for this role is Monday 13th February 2023

title: Intelligence and Data Analyst Development Programmes (I&DADP) ...
description:
MI5 and MI6 are part of the UK’s Intelligence Services. Working together, we safeguard Britain’s people, interests and businesses from threats including cyber-attacks, espionage, terrorism, and organised crime. To succeed in our mission, we rely on data. On our Intelligence and Data Analyst Development Programmes (I&DADP), you’ll help shape operations, learn new skills - and build a rewarding career right at the heart of national security.
At MI5, you’ll be based in London and start on a three-month training period before carrying out three data analyst postings within the organisation. Curious and logical, you could be working in a range of different areas that help build our capability or training others to develop their analytical skills. You could also be working closely with Intelligence Officers and external partners. In every role, you’ll develop advanced data analysis techniques that’ll help to protect the UK. You’ll be taught everything you need to know on the programme, so... you don’t need to be a data expert to join – just yourself.
At MI6, you’ll join the Data Analysis Programme in Cheltenham for two years, learning how to turn raw data into vital intelligence. For the first six months, you’ll do a mix of formal and on-the-job training in technical and analytical tools. You’ll then apply this knowledge to make connections, identify trends, and solve problems as part of our investigations. Working with your analysis team and multi-agency partners, you’ll support operations and use tools you won’t find anywhere else. And once the programme finishes, you’ll have the opportunity to work in London or even abroad.
For both programmes, there’s no ‘type’ of person who works in data. It’s a job, not a label. You’ll be naturally curious, determined and genuinely interested in building a career in this field. With your attention to detail, you’ll spot things others don’t and enjoy working collaboratively. And while you don’t need coding or programming skills to join, you will have (or be expecting) a 2:2 degree in any subject or have work experience where you have demonstrated the key skills required for the role.
At MI5 and MI6 diversity and inclusion are critical to our mission. We therefore welcome and encourage applications from everyone, including those from groups that are under-represented in our workforce such as women, those from an ethnic minority background, people with disabilities and those from low socio-economic backgrounds. Find out more about our culture, working environment and diversity on our websites MI5 and MI6.

To be eligible to apply, you must be a British Citizen. If you hold dual nationality, of which one component is British, you will nonetheless be considered. Candidates must normally have been resident in the UK for seven out of the last ten years. This is particularly important if you were born outside the UK. You can apply at the age of 17 years, if successful you will not be offered a start date prior to your 18th birthday. Full eligibility details can be found on our websites MI5 and MI6

title: Consumer Data Analyst
description:
Do you love data? Are you excel skills from intermediate to advanced? Would you like an opportunity at a market leading international brand? If you answered yes to all 3 of those questions, it could be worth reading the information below about the opportunity we have for a passionate data expert to make a real difference to growing team. Candidates will only need 1 -2 years data experience, as this is just one step up from an entry level role.

We have an exciting opportunity to be part of a motivated, energetic team driving a European retail business forwards. The role is a brand-new position created to support the department with the exciting growth plans ahead. This position will drive their data analysis and reporting forwards to deliver insights that they can then act upon to deliver further growth & efficiencies. The role will be integral in helping to deliver their digital strategy over the coming years.

The ideal candidate will be highly passionate about data, and happy... working in an agile fast moving environment. The ability to analyse raw data in many formats is key, as is the ability to generate and communicate the results efficiently. They use a number of specialist tools & software programs that will be essential for the delivery of the role, and whilst existing experience is not required, you will need to be both digitally and technically savvy to build the understanding of these quickly, and guide your own learning requirements where necessary.

Key duties are:
• Become a Subject Matter Expert of our various data sources
• Compile weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly reports across markets that succinctly highlight the key findings, trends and opportunities
• Work collaboratively with agencies to analyse reports and provide additional data insight to help further optimise activity
• Complete ad-hoc analysis to prove or disprove trading hypotheses that will help them to understand their customers better and ultimately help us to drive trading efficiencies e.g returns rate analysis, sales analysis, etc.
• Support projects by providing analysis for the initial business case, setting up reports to track results and delivering data to enable decision making throughout the process
• Assist the Head of Department with compiling data to inform sales & overheads forecasts

The role is hybrid based with 50% of the time at needed in the office, which due to its rural location would in most scenarios require you to drive. If this sounds of interest do please send us your CV through and we can contact you to set u a conversation if you have the required experience.

Due to their location this position it would suit applicants from Birmingham, Solihull, Leicester, Northampton, Coventry, Lutterworth, Market Harborough, Wellingborough, Huntingdon or Peterborough. If this sounds of interest and you're happy working in Nuneaton 3 days a please do send us your latest CV and we can arrange a confidential conversation.

Zero Surplus is East Anglia's premier market research recruitment agency, based just outside Cambridge, recruiters source staff for small and international B2B & B2C businesses across Cambridgeshire and the East of England.

For registration purposes please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.

Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding text boxes or images. Any data we collect from you will be stored and processed in accordance with Zero Surplus' Privacy Policy

title: Data Analyst
description:
SSE has big ambitions to be a leading energy company in a low carbon world. Following our commitment to invest £12.5 billion in low carbon projects over the next 5 years, we have significant growth plans and are well on our way to achieving our ambition to build a world that's more sustainable and inclusive for you, your family, the community you live in and for generations to come.

Join us on our journey to net zero and help us power change.

About the Role

Base Location: Glasgow (Waterloo Street or Eurocentral)

Salary: £33,945 - £39,463 + a range of benefits to support your family, finances and wellbeing.

Working Pattern: Permanent | Full Time | Flexible First options available

As part of a growing data team, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in the growth of SSEs commercial insights capability & driving a data-led culture. As a data analyst you will work closely with users and stakeholders to ensure that their needs are met through our data service offerings and... support effective commercial decision making. You will be responsible for creating, managing & developing a suite of insights tools, including dashboards and KPIs, and developing the teams reputation as a trusted partner within the Procurement & Commercial department.

- Lead the ongoing delivery & optimisation of regular business reports & KPIs

- Deliver high quality of customer service & data outputs to users & stakeholders to maintain trust and credibility of data function.

- Support transition from legacy data management tools to new cloud-based solutions including PowerBI.

- Lead delivery of data capability programme to stakeholders, including creation, maintenance of materials.

- Support ongoing delivery of insights roadmap which looks to help understand our users better and help develop bespoke insights dashboards specific to their needs, utilising both internal & external sources of data to provide effective solutions.

What do I need?

To be considered for this role, we would love you to have:
• Data analysis and synthesis - You can apply analytical techniques to present an effective data solution for end-users.
• Communication - You demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills and understand how to share insights with stakeholders.
• Data management - You can understand data sources, data organisation and storage.
• Data visualisation - You can interpret requirements and present data in a clear and compelling way, using graphical representations and data visualisations. Experience using PowerBI would be beneficial.
• Logical and creative thinking - You can apply logic and creativity to approach a problem.
• Experience working as an analyst within a procurement/commercial environment (preferable)

About our Business

At SSE, we own more than 500 property assets and several thousand land assets, which are located across the length and breadth of the UK and Ireland. Our Procurement & Commercial, Property and Facilities Management teams are responsible for helping the business to procure services and materials in a timely and cost-effective way, and for ensuring SSE offers a safe, modern, fit-for-purpose property portfolio. We work right across the SSE Group, ensuring our businesses gets the best possible service and value from our supplier network, as well as ensuring all service providers are compliant and continue to meet contractual obligations and business need.

What's in it for you?

We offer an excellent package with 34 days annual leave entitlement. Enhanced maternity/paternity leave, discounted healthcare, salary sacrifice car leasing and much more, view our full benefits package on our careers site.

As an equal opportunity employer we encourage diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applicants from all protected characteristics and commit to providing any reasonable adjustments you need during the application, assessment and upon joining SSE. Search for 'Inclusion & Diversity at SSE' to find out more.

What happens now?

All applications should be made online, and I'll be back in touch after the vacancy closing date to let you know the outcome.

If you would like to discuss any working flexibly requirements or adjustments you may require throughout the recruitment and selection process, please contact Francesca on francesca.thorn@sse.com / 01738 344763.

Before commencing your role with SSE, you'll need to complete our pre-employment screening process. This will consist of a criminality and credit check.
