title: Data Analyst
description:
SSE has big ambitions to be a leading energy company in a low carbon world. Following our commitment to invest £12.5 billion in low carbon projects over the next 5 years, we have significant growth plans and are well on our way to achieving our ambition to build a world that's more sustainable and inclusive for you, your family, the community you live in and for generations to come.

Join us on our journey to net zero and help us power change.

About the Role

Base Location: Glasgow (Waterloo Street or Eurocentral)

Salary: £33,945 - £39,463 + a range of benefits to support your family, finances and wellbeing.

Working Pattern: Permanent | Full Time | Flexible First options available

As part of a growing data team, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in the growth of SSEs commercial insights capability & driving a data-led culture. As a data analyst you will work closely with users and stakeholders to ensure that their needs are met through our data service offerings and... support effective commercial decision making. You will be responsible for creating, managing & developing a suite of insights tools, including dashboards and KPIs, and developing the teams reputation as a trusted partner within the Procurement & Commercial department.

- Lead the ongoing delivery & optimisation of regular business reports & KPIs

- Deliver high quality of customer service & data outputs to users & stakeholders to maintain trust and credibility of data function.

- Support transition from legacy data management tools to new cloud-based solutions including PowerBI.

- Lead delivery of data capability programme to stakeholders, including creation, maintenance of materials.

- Support ongoing delivery of insights roadmap which looks to help understand our users better and help develop bespoke insights dashboards specific to their needs, utilising both internal & external sources of data to provide effective solutions.

What do I need?

To be considered for this role, we would love you to have:
• Data analysis and synthesis - You can apply analytical techniques to present an effective data solution for end-users.
• Communication - You demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills and understand how to share insights with stakeholders.
• Data management - You can understand data sources, data organisation and storage.
• Data visualisation - You can interpret requirements and present data in a clear and compelling way, using graphical representations and data visualisations. Experience using PowerBI would be beneficial.
• Logical and creative thinking - You can apply logic and creativity to approach a problem.
• Experience working as an analyst within a procurement/commercial environment (preferable)

About our Business

At SSE, we own more than 500 property assets and several thousand land assets, which are located across the length and breadth of the UK and Ireland. Our Procurement & Commercial, Property and Facilities Management teams are responsible for helping the business to procure services and materials in a timely and cost-effective way, and for ensuring SSE offers a safe, modern, fit-for-purpose property portfolio. We work right across the SSE Group, ensuring our businesses gets the best possible service and value from our supplier network, as well as ensuring all service providers are compliant and continue to meet contractual obligations and business need.

What's in it for you?

We offer an excellent package with 34 days annual leave entitlement. Enhanced maternity/paternity leave, discounted healthcare, salary sacrifice car leasing and much more, view our full benefits package on our careers site.

As an equal opportunity employer we encourage diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applicants from all protected characteristics and commit to providing any reasonable adjustments you need during the application, assessment and upon joining SSE. Search for 'Inclusion & Diversity at SSE' to find out more.

What happens now?

All applications should be made online, and I'll be back in touch after the vacancy closing date to let you know the outcome.

If you would like to discuss any working flexibly requirements or adjustments you may require throughout the recruitment and selection process, please contact Francesca on 01738 344763.

Before commencing your role with SSE, you'll need to complete our pre-employment screening process. This will consist of a criminality and credit check

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Your new company

Hays is working with a national group providing workforce solutions and with over 100 branches and managed locations. With great new projects and functions being put in place, the team and organisation is growing and are on the lookout of a Senior and a Junior Data Analyst to start and shape the future or their data analytics and visualisation. This company has a fantastic culture and offers great opportunities for growth and progression with a great work-life balance and benefits.

Your new role

This permanent full time hybrid role is a brilliant opportunity for candidates in analytics and business intelligence looking for a great challenge and career within this company. You will work in a newly created role and department having a great input and voice within the strategy team. You will work in this exciting project from the start advising and putting in place initiatives with a hands on attitude and experience reporting and using different methods and... techniques. You will report to the Digital Strategy Manager organising, analysing and interpreting data to support stakeholder's decisions.

What you'll need to succeed
• Great experience in data analytics and visualisation.
• Excellent Microsoft Excel skills
• Knowledge extracting information from SQL and No-SQL databases.
• Usage of Power BI or Tableau to create and develop of Business Intelligence suite.
• Proven experience with Python or R and databases.
• Great management and communication skills both verbal and written.

What you'll get in return
• Senior Data Analyst up to £50,000 dependent on experience.
• Junior Data Analyst up to £35,000 dependent on experience.
• Hybrid working with 3 days in the office and 2 working from home.
• On going training and growth internally.
• Pension.
• Bonus

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst/Insight Analyst
• £50,000-£80,000
• Knutsford (on site)
• Flexible start times between 8am & 9:30 with 4pm finishes
• 25 days holiday + bank
• Pension 8% employer contribution
• Private medical BUPA
• On site restaurant which is completely FREE
• Free breakfast, lunch and sweet treat trolly everyday
• Free on site gym, machines, squat racks coupled with group classes including yoga & karate. Towel service, shower facilities and drying area.
• On site parking
• Share options after one year of service
• Parental leave: 26 weeks at full pay, plus return to work bonus.
• Daily transport support with shuttles to the train station, environmentally friendly car hire and bike storage

About the business & the role .

Are you a Data Analyst looking for a new challenge in a company with more benefits than we have ever seen!

We are partnered with a highly reputable cyber security business based on the outskirts of Knutsford in Cheshire. The business is a globally recognised for... delivering cyber security software across more than 150 countries.

The business has been going through steady growth since its inception with over 20% revenue growth year on year. The business has remained privately owned meaning the benefits and development opportunities can constantly be developed.

In order to help growth initiatives the business formed an analytics and insight function which they are now in a position to expand (hence this advert).

Whilst being a very successful business the data journey is still in its infancy and the aim it to bring in some top talent to help mold the future of the data work within the business.

Based just off the M6 the offices are easily commutable from Manchester, Stockport, Wilmslow, Warrington, Crewe, Nantwich, Chester, Macclesfield and Northwich.

The business offer lots of scope for your future development, with planned out and achievable goals for you to get to the next step.

What Technical skills do you need?
• Experience of working in a commercial Data Analyst or Insight Analyst role
• Experience of building ETL processes to enable effective analysis and presentation of data
• Strong SQL skills
• Ability to write SQL queries
• Experience of working with PowerBI or other visualisation tools
• Would LOVE to see some Python but not required

What's next?

Since there is an awful lot to tell about this business the best way to find out more is to apply and someone will be in touch, alternatively email any questions to danb

title: Data Analyst
description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: Manchester City Centre

Salary: £25,000 - £40,000

A fantastic opportunity to join my client, an asset management leader, as a Data Analyst has presented itself. If you're a Data Analyst with experience in the financial sector, this could certainly be the opportunity for you! If you're interested in a great salary, a fantastic office view of the city, and bi-weekly lunches with the rest of the Insights & Analytics department, then apply today!

Responsibilities:
• Collect and analyse large sets of financial data to identify trends and patterns.
• Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights.
• Present findings to senior stakeholders, both internal and external, and make recommendations based on the analysis.
• Keep updated on industry trends and regulatory requirements.

Requirements:

• High level of proficiency in SQL.

My client is offering a competitive salary and benefits package alongside brilliant opportunities for growth and advancement within the company. If you have a passion for data analysis and believe that you could add value to the team and make a positive impact in the industry, then apply today for immediate consideration!

title: Data Analyst
description:
LOCALiQ are a digital agency within the Newsquest media group. We are looking to recruit a data and insights analyst and it’s never been a better time to join us on the next chapter of our growth plans.

As a business, we pride ourselves on our commitment to self-learning and continuous opportunities for growth across the group. We don’t stop there you will also receive a generous holiday allowance and perks such as paid volunteering day, standard benefits like a workplace pension, and on your birthday celebrate on us with a day off. This role is a hybrid or a fully remote working role.

The Role

This exciting position will have you at the heart of our subscription data, you will be identifying consumption habits and preferences. You will perform 'deep-dive' data analysis to provide actionable insights that drive subscriber acquisition and retention. The role works hand to hand, day in, day out with colleagues in our Product, Subscriptions, Editorial, and Commercial teams to deliver... insights through data, define and provide reporting, and identify risks and opportunities. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work with data across our suite of digital products, delving into new products and reporting on your findings. This role is a bespoke service role and you will partner with senior-level employees to break down data for growth projects across the group. You will deal with ad-hock requests creating dashboards and metrics for growth, churn data, and much more.

Skills and experience

This role is all about our readers, so experience working in a user-centred environment, particularly with a product or subscription element, would be highly advantageous. You are highly numerate and analytical and you excel at breaking down a problem or task. When working alone, you get on with it, when working with a team, you are proactive, collegiate, and pragmatic.
Equally important are your excellent communication skills and your ability to present complex information in an easy-to-understand manner with clear, evidence-based recommendations.
A few years of solid experience with a major analytics tool such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics is a given. Other skills that would be extremely advantageous...
• Advanced working knowledge of Excel
• Background in working with large and complex datasets.
• High proficiency with a BI tool such as PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, or similar
• An excellent understanding of SQL
• Coding experience in a relevant language such as Python or R

Benefits
• We've got some great offices for you to work from but you can also work from home.
• No weekends or evening work
• A competitive basic salary
• Workplace Pension
• Perks & Discounts
• Cycle-to-work scheme
• Company Laptop
• Opportunities for team building and training days

LOCALiQ is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sectors of the community regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage/civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation

title: Insight and Data Analyst
description:
Joining part of a retail giant, you will be a key hire for an amazing team who are looking for a Data Analyst who will be an instrumental part of their growth strategy in 2023 by using data to help the business make the right decisions to facilitate this.

Optimising data will be your passion and adding value to an organisation and developing a successful career will be the very reason this is your dream role.

Client Details

Part of a retail giant, our client are a £30m turnover organisation who plan to achieve growth in 2023 and you will be a key part in making this happen.

A welcoming organisation and team, our client attracts the very best talent in the industry due to their brand, culture and careers that they are able to offer their employees.

Description

As the Insight and Data Analyst, you will be collaborating with the wider marketing team and helping them make better informed decisions by your ability to interpret data and make suitable recommendations.

You will be... passionate about working in a commercial and customer focused role and want an opportunity for a well established business to reach their potential through your skills, talent and experience of optimising data.

Focusing on customer journey and behaviour you will be spending your time evaluating data from both their website and third party websites.

Want to know a little more info. Here is more detail on your duties
• Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data joining platforms and data analytics software to accelerate and enhance business data analysis.
• Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
• Build and maintain cross departmental KPI dashboards that surface meaningful insights for real time decision making
• Proactively interpret data, analyse results, interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports and executive summaries to key stakeholders
• Work with department heads to prioritise business and information needs
• Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Profile

If you are an experienced Data Analyst with knowledge of Tableau, Power BI and an advanced Excel user, we would love to speak to you

We are looking for someone who is ambitious and determined to fast track your career within a forward thinking business.

You will ideally have a degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics but if you have strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Power BI, Tableau etc), ...then we definitely want to speak to you

Job Offer
• Opportunity to develop a long term career
• Hybrid working
• Great team environment
• Generous discounts on goods

title: BI Data Analyst
description:
BI Data Analyst

£40,000 per annum

Northampton

Hybrid - 2 days per week in the office - mainly so you can work with the key stakeholders to develop reports and MI from the data stack they are working on.

Valid right to work is essential- this role will not offer sponsorship at any time.

Role and Responsibilities

A fantastic opportunity for an BI Data Analyst to join a financial services company who are employed by Local Authorities in England and Wales to collect outstanding financial debts.

As a Data Analyst with strong MSBI & SQL skills, you will be working with a key data supplier who produce a large daily data transfer, which gets loaded into the centralised system; you will then be responsible for extracting as much value from the data as possible to develop that data into usable reports.

You will be responsible for designing and completing bespoke analytic work, in collaboration with operational stakeholders who represent key business functions to develop data driven... business initiatives, developing solutions within SQL databases, and turning raw data into meaningful insight.

You will help drive business decision making through rigorous analysis and presenting insights clearly and effectively to non-technical stakeholders.

This role will suit a Data Analyst with strong SQL and MS Stack BI tooling experience.

Have you got what it takes?

-Excellent knowledge of SQL ideally with 2+ years' experience in SQL focused role

-Experience creating / modifying stored procedures and functions.

-Knowledge of Designing data structures and models

-Fantastic analytical ability.

-Familiarity working with ETL packages and tools like SSIS.

-Ideally an excellent working Knowledge of excel with familiarity using VBA

What can you expect?

Being a BI Data Analyst will work in a fully supported environment that is keen to leverage your skills and experience and help you to grow and develop.

We are based in Northampton, we run normal business hours on Monday to Friday, (core hours 9am to 5pm).

title: Graduate Data Analyst (Belfast) - Summer 2023 Intake
description:
Our people love the exciting and meaningful work they do, the cutting-edge resources and technology they have access to, the benefits we offer and the great community we’ve built. Want to join them?

MAIN PURPOSE OF THE ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES IN THE BUSINESS: 

 

As a Graduate Data Analyst in Kainos you will is responsible for matching the needs of data insight with understanding of the available data. Data analysts work closely with customers to produce insight products including reports, dashboards and visualisations but also contribute to project understanding of existing data structures so that inputs and outputs are fully understood. 

Most of our work comes through repeat business and direct referrals, which comes down to the quality of our people. The success of our Data Engineering teams means that customers are bringing us an increasing number of exciting data projects using cutting-edge technology to solve real-world problems. We are seeking more high calibre people to... join our Data & Analytics capability where you will grow and contribute to industry-leading technical expertise. 

 

MINIMUM (ESSENTIAL) REQUIREMENTS:  

· Currently studying, or already completed, a relevant degree or equivalent qualification  

· Experience of discovering, gathering and wrangling data from various data sources for analysis 

· Able to understand the client’s business challenge and work with colleagues to identify data visualisation and dashboard approaches to help address the customer needs. 

· Understand how to identify missed opportunities for data insight. 

· Basic understanding of data model and modelling techniques. 

· Clear written and verbal communications; able to explain findings and techniques to a non-technical audience. 

· Awareness for the importance of stakeholder engagement and understands how to gather data requirements. 

· Familiar with the production of data analysis outputs such as profiling reports, data quality reports, etc. 

· Good SQL knowledge; able to read and understand XML and JSON. 

· Able to advise managers on the estimated effort and technical implications of data insight products. 

· Ability to prioritise and work to deadlines. 

· Ability to work collaboratively with others. 

 

 

DESIRABLE: 

 

· Experienced with structured and unstructured data 

· Able to review and comment on data models– for example pointing out why models are defective and suggesting improvements. 

· Able to give feedback and mentor more junior colleagues 

· Experience of Power BI, Tableau and 

· Experience of Google Analytics (other web analytics tools) 

· Experience in combining qualitative and quantitative datasets 

· Experience of system performance analysis. 

 

 

Assessments are likely to take place in Nov/Dec 2022. If we hold a second wave of assessments you may not be contacted until the New Year.

These roles will commence in Summer 2023.

At Kainos, we recognise many of the greatest ideas and innovations come from a diverse mix of minds, backgrounds and experiences, and are committed to cultivating an inclusive working environment that drives changes in Technology. Therefore, we particularly welcome applications from groups who are typically under-represented in this sector including women, non-binary and transgender people. Read about flexible working, parental leave and other benefits here. All appointments will be on the basis of merit. 

WHO YOU ARE:
Our vision is to enable outstanding people to create digital solutions that have a positive impact on people’s lives. Our values aren't abstract; they are the behaviours we expect from each other every day and underpin everything that we do. We expect everyone to display our values by being determined in how obstacles are overcome; honest when dealing with others; respectful of how you treat others; creative to find solutions to complex problems and cooperative by sharing information, knowledge and experience. These values, applied collectively, help to produce an outstanding Kainos person, team and culture.

We're an inclusive bunch at Kainos and we believe in equal opportunity. We welcome applications from all walks of life, including those with criminal records. Everyone who is offered a position here undergoes a basic background check , however no one is treated differently due to their background where it isn't relevant to the role. It's important to note - failure to reveal information which is relevant to the position sought, could result in us having to withdraw the conditional offer of employment.

In short: Having a criminal record will not exclude you from a career with Kainos. This depends entirely on the nature and requirements of the position, together with the circumstances and background of offences. Kainos has a policy on the recruitment of ex-offenders (available on request

title: Business Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
The Business Data Analyst, assigned to a specific client's Global Corporate Security team will support reporting, metrics, and information management initiatives. The Business Data Analyst will create queries, sort, and assess large volumes of data utilizing SQL, Python, and possesses in depth knowledge of data visualization tools, such as Tableau and/or other BI.

Essential Functions:
• Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
• Run and modify SQL queries to generate list reports from data sources.
• Manipulate data with SQL, Tableau, Power BI, or other BI visualization tools.

• Create dashboards and interactive custom visualizations using BI tools.
• Develop processes and simple data pipelines to improve reporting efficiencies.
• Collect, archive, and review data from a variety of open and proprietary sources.
• Collaborate with key stakeholders to ingest volumes of data, policy, and program points.
• All other... duties, as assigned. Education, Experience, and Certifications:

Bachelor's degree and at least ten to fifteen years of experience in visual and graphic design, SQL, Python or other data analytics programs, or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company.

Competencies:
• E SQL, Python, Tableau, or equivalent BI tools experience, with the ability to create ad-hoc queries for various purposes - This role is highly technical, must be able to write SQL queries, do analysis, write reports, generate data, and identify problems within data sets.
• Master level visualisation skills in corporate environment.
• Excellent written and verbal communication.
• Exemplary critical thinking, analytical skills, and judgment.
• Able to carry out responsibilities with little or no supervision.
• Attentive to details and accuracy.
• Able to work in a fast-paced environment under multiple deadlines and competing priorities.
• Serve as an effective team member.
• Strong customer service and results orientation.

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions;
• Exposure to sensitive and confidential information.

• Evenings and weekends, as required, to ensure the successful completion of work assignments.

title: Project Data Analyst
description:
Overview

Our Digital Strategy transforms the way we design, construct and deliver high technology projects for our clients. We are developing a highly connected workforce with fast and reliable access to data that will enable us to deliver innovative, sustainable solutions to our clients. It's an exciting journey and we want you to be part of it.

The successful applicant will work within the digital team and be responsible for supporting the Digital enabled Project Delivery (DePD) procedures and Ways of Working underpinning Lean Delivery.

Reporting directly to the Piping & BIM Manager you will support our project and business leadership teams by developing dashboards, apps and reports in PowerBI, support local Collaboration Platform (SharePoint) administration and definition capture helping us drive our digital project delivery.

Responsibilities
• Implement the PM Group DePD strategy & methodology at a project level
• Power BI Report development - Developing visual reports, KPI... scorecards, and dashboards using Power BI desktop.
• Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business intelligence.
• Analytical thinking for translating data into informative reports and visuals.
• Responsible for design methodology and project documentaries.
• Should be able to develop tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with data warehouse standards.
• Act as local administrator for SharePoint, collating site setup requirements and liaising with the global digital team to enable initial setup and roll out of our
• Collaboration Platform and the Project Portal(s), maintaining security groups, allowing access to specific employees or departments, as well as setting permissions for editing abilities etc.
• Very good communication skills must be able to discuss the requirements effectively with the internal teams and client teams.
• Provide on boarding DePD training to project team members (including trade partners and 3rd parties) throughout the lifecycle of the project

Qualifications
• Experience in Power BI, Power Query, DAX and Datasets
• Knowledge of SharePoint and other Microsoft related software applications
• Relevant qualifications and/or degree in related subject
• The ability to work to tight deadlines under strict time pressures
• Have the ability to prioritise and organise support activities and deliver multiple tasks
• A keen eye for well formatted documents which utilise the correct type of visualisation for the data reported
• A strong track record in building reports, databases and processes with simple refresh methods
• The ability to communicate summarise key findings both written and verbally
• Knowledge of workflows throughout the project lifecycle (EP,CM,CQV)
• Excellent organisational, collaborative and people skills
• Strong facilitation, analytical and design skills.
• Personable, confident with excellent communication skills.
• Strong sense of teamwork with a ‘can do’ attitude

D&I

Inclusion and Diversity are core to our culture and values. Wherever we work, we commit to a culture of mutual respect and belonging by building a truly inclusive workplace rich in diverse people, talents and ideas. Valuing the contributions of all our people and respecting individual differences will sustain our growth into the future.

PM Group is committed to ensuring our hiring process is fair and accessible to all and will provide candidates with disabilities with reasonable accommodations required to participate in the recruitment process. If you require any assistance in this regard, please let us know

title: GIS Data Analyst
description:
Exciting opportunity for a GIS Data Analyst to join an established organisation on a remote contract.
Your new company
Join a leading organisation in regional NSW focused on delivering high quality services to a large customer base.

Your new role
In this role, you will be responsible for the analysis of data quality in order to identify issues and provide key information relating to network reliability and connectivity. You will give oversight, maintenance and remediation of data as well as data assets. You will be integral for combining data from varied and disparate sources into a centralised source for business use. Liaising closely with the business, you will translate business requirements into data extraction and reporting requirements.

What you'll need to succeed
• Demonstrated experience in a similar role, extracting and analysing GIS data
• Proven analytical skills with the ability to identify outliers and anomalies
• Experience in collating and presenting data to support... decision making
• Previous knowledge using SmallWorld will be highly regarded
• Prior experience working within the energy industry preferred
What you'll get in return
This is an exciting opportunity to work with a dedicated team and support the network and data services team. The initial contract length is 6 months with potential for extension. You will be able to work remotely on the East Coast of Australia.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or contact me now at kira.bauske@hays.com.au. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

LHS 297508 #2734419 information_technology

title: Business Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
The Business Data Analyst, assigned to a specific client's Global Corporate Security team will support reporting, metrics, and information management initiatives. The Business Data Analyst will create queries, sort, and assess large volumes of data utilizing SQL, Python, and possesses in depth knowledge of data visualization tools, such as Tableau and/or other BI.

Essential Functions:
• Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
• Run and modify SQL queries to generate list reports from data sources.
• Manipulate data with SQL, Tableau, Power BI, or other BI visualization tools.
• Perform ad-hoc reports and analysis.
• Create dashboards and interactive custom visualizations using BI tools.
• Develop processes and simple data pipelines to improve reporting efficiencies.
• Collect, archive, and review data from a variety of open and proprietary sources.
• Collaborate with key stakeholders to ingest volumes of data, policy, and program points.
• All other... duties, as assigned. Education, Experience, and Certifications:

Bachelor's degree and at least ten to fifteen years of experience in visual and graphic design, SQL, Python or other data analytics programs, or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company.

Competencies:
• E SQL, Python, Tableau, or equivalent BI tools experience, with the ability to create ad-hoc queries for various purposes - This role is highly technical, must be able to write SQL queries, do analysis, write reports, generate data, and identify problems within data sets.
• Master level visualisation skills in corporate environment.
• Excellent written and verbal communication.
• Exemplary critical thinking, analytical skills, and judgment.
• Able to carry out responsibilities with little or no supervision.
• Attentive to details and accuracy.
• Able to work in a fast-paced environment under multiple deadlines and competing priorities.
• Serve as an effective team member.
• Strong customer service and results orientation.
• Computer skills; Microsoft Office. Working Conditions:

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions;
• Exposure to sensitive and confidential information.
• Regular computer usage.
• Occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
• Ability to adjust focus between close and distance vision.
• Evenings and weekends, as required, to ensure the successful completion of work assignments.
• Travel, as required.Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law. Pinkerton also adheres to all local, state, federal, and country hiring requirements

title: Data+ Programme
description:
Please note we are not currently interviewing/recruiting for our Data+ programme. However, if you wish to register your interest please apply and we will be in contact with you, once we begin hiring for the programme.

As an Analyst within our Data+ programme you will embark on our development programme.

Our dynamic Data+ programme is designed for Graduates with a passion for all things Data! Whether you are looking to specialise in Data Science, Data Engineering, Architecture or BI & Analytics, the Data+ development programme will support you in meeting and exceeding your career goals.

This role is available in multiple locations across the UK. Our main locations are Manchester and London, as this is where our Grayce's offices are. However, we also have opportunities in Cambridge, Birmingham, Leeds, Norwich, Southampton and more.

Building your skill stack

You will begin with a 3-week data bootcamp, where you will join other graduates and work together to build your foundations in... the data space. With accredited qualifications and training provided by our talented Grayce data coaches, you will have every opportunity to improve and develop your skills.

Once you have completed your initial training, you will embark on your first client project, working in a data role and putting your skills to use in a client-facing environment. We will support you every step of the way as you gain accreditations and move your career forward.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for talented graduates who share our values: We are human and we care. We are looking for conscientious and empathetic individuals who care about others in our community and are committed to giving their best every day.

If you have excellent attention to detail and organisational skills, are curious, self-motivated with a drive to continuously improve and produce high quality solutions then Grayce is the place for you.

As a Data Analyst we would love to speak to individuals who have:
• A degree with a 2:1 minimum, ideally with analytical focus & data handling such as STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics).
• Flexible and adaptable communicator who can work collaboratively
• A love for problem solving and ability to make sense of something complex
• An ambition to work with data and an understanding of how it can help organisations make better decisions
• Knowledge and understanding of key tools such as Excel, Tableau or Python

What can we offer you?
• Competitive salary – with the opportunity for this to increase as part of our yearly appraisal process (You could double your salary in the space of 3 years)
• Industry-recognised qualifications fully funded by us
• Mentors and coaches, ensuring that you are developing your skills and consistently delivering your best
• Pension scheme
• Grayce funded social events throughout the year such as #TogetherFest
• The opportunity to get involved with several initiatives from Sustainability and EveryOneEmpowered to Our Grayce Employee Forum
• Employee Assistance Programme which is a confidential service that offers 24/7 support for a wide range of concerns, from mental health to legal support, 365 days a year

About Grayce

We are Grayce; a unique hire, train and deploy management consultancy business, founded in 2012 with a #DeeperPurpose to kickstart, support and accelerate emerging talent careers. We are plugging the change, data and tech skills gap, providing FTSE100/250 organisations with emerging talent services. We provide our established and well renowned client base access to our highly capable and high-quality Grayce Project Analysts to support transient project endeavours or to support their own strategic capability build for leaders of the future. We are looking for exceptional people, whose values align with ours, to join us on our #DeeperPurpose mission to kick-start more emerging talent careers in change, data and tech.

At Grayce; We are Human & We Care | We are trusted, and we deliver excellence | We are Change Makers & Succeed Together

Please note that the successful candidate must, by the commencement of employment, have the right to work in the UK.

Kickstart your career with Grayce by applying today

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst
Walsall - Retail / Hospitality
£55,000-£65,000 (Mon to Fri / Hybrid working)

Our client is a forerunner in the Retail / Hospitality industry who after a very successful fiscal year are looking to continue the growth of their business with an exciting new investment initiative. With plenty of projects on the horizon and fantastic growth forecast in a highly competitive sector, the client is looking for a commercial and analytically astute individual to join their head office team. The role boasts the opportunity for significant professional and personal development in a high support and high challenge culture.

What does the Data Analyst role involve?
• Compile financial activity for the line manager on a periodic basis and create reports for the company executives and the board to clearly present your analysis.
• Project manage crucial development enterprises for the company while organising, co-ordinating, and directing data-related project activities.
• Manage... relationships with stakeholders through effective and professional communication.
• Work with other teams and their respective HOD's to amalgamate data sources across the company and provide crucial insight and information required to make important business decisions and evaluate future options.

Do you have what they are looking for?
• To thrive in this role, you will need to be proactive, have excellent attention to detail, be resilient, deadline-orientated and be self-motivated.
• An ability to identify both short and long term data requirements of the business, and to interpret, solidify and present that data across all levels of the company.
• You will have a track-record of successful Data Analysis and will have experience as a key player in punctual data project reviews, reports and delivery.
• You must have held a similar level of responsibility previously and be self-sufficient in a dynamic and ever-changing day-to-day role.
• You will have strong commercial skills and business acumen with a highly organised and detailed approach to data.

If you are interested in this Data Analyst role and possess the skills necessary, please apply to AdMore Recruitment.

This role is being managed by AdMore Recruitment limited, a leading specialist to the Retail, Hospitality and Consumer sectors providing support to our clients across the UK.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

By applying to this vacancy you are consenting to AdMore Recruitment contacting you and processing your data in line with our Privacy Policy under GDPR (General Data Protection Regulations). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your right to access, erase or restrict the holding or processing of your data please contact us

title: Market Data Analyst
description:
We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.

About The Unit

The Continental Europe business unit is one of three commercial business units in Yara Europe Region together with BU Nordics and BU South. BU Continental is comprised of the commercial teams - agronomy, marketing, and sales - of several major European markets, including UK and Ireland, France, Germany and Benelux, Poland, Czech Republic, Romania, and Ukraine. At the BU level are roles working across these markets, supporting business development of core fertilizer products as well as digital agronomic tools and services to customers in these markets.

The Market Data Analyst role is responsible for analyzing user data from our digital tools and services to provide meaningful insights which enable effective, data-driven decision making for the markets within the business unit and... the business unit overall. This position will support the local commercial teams to understand and interpret data from various tools including Atfarm, N-Tester, N-Sensor, Megalab, Yara Premium Program, Salesforce, and Request for Quote. This analysis will be used to implement actions for improving growth, engagement, and retention of customers and product, and service development opportunities of our digital solutions, in line with our strategic ambitions.

The Market Data Analyst will report to the Marketing & Agronomy Director and act as a trusted advisor to the local teams and as a liaison towards other units within the regional and global organization when it comes to use of relevant data for marketing, commercialization, development, and continuous improvement of our digital solutions.

Responsibilities
• Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations on acquisition, retention, and activation to support implementation and market development of Yara's digital offering
• Guide and facilitate discussions concerning identification of opportunities for growth, activation, and churn reduction through data-driven analysis and insights and contribute to marketing strategies
• Analyze data and provide insights to support product development and improved user experience of our digital tools and services
• Dive into behavioral data to support markets in understanding the user-base and, together with the local commercial teams, determine how to optimize marketing, user journey, and user experience of the digital tools
• Improve existing dashboards and develop new dashboards or information-sharing tools to make data more accessible and understood by relevant stakeholders; prepare and present recommendations, reports, and findings using relevant visualizations
• Oversee KPIs, establish a dynamic reporting cycle, based on which decide on and implement responsive actions
• Map and structure data from existing sources, for example Atfarm, Premium Program, RFQ, to create integrated 360° views of customers to support customer-centricity across our portfolio of products, tools, and services

Profile
• At least Bachelor degree in business analytics, data science, marketing, user experience, agribusiness, statistics or any other related field
• Minimum 5 years of experience in market data analyses and growth and engagement; experience in the agricultural industry - an advantage
• Experience participating in strategic discussions, interpreting and integrating data from various sources and clearly communicating the findings from analyses to a diverse collection of stakeholders to drive and support decision-making
• Excellent data analysis skills with strong business acumen and understanding of how data insight can meet business needs and contribute value
• Experience increasing retention and engagement, managing churn, translating insight into improvements and implementing feature adoption strategies
• Proactive, resourceful and experienced working in a complex matrix organization with excellent collaboration, listening and communication skills
• Experience with digital marketing and other user-data oriented products
• Good understanding of Yara's business in Europe, its strategy and change agenda - an advantage

Additional Information
• Periodical visits to the local markets throughout the year for workshops are expected
• Operational language - English, knowledge of any other language spoken in the Continental Europe markets (i.e., French, German etc). is an advantage
• The location for this role can be any Yara site relevant to Continental Europe markets

Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply.

Contact details

Rūta Povilaitytė

Senior HR Advisor

ruta.povilaityte@yara com

Allison O'Dell

Director, Marketing & Agronomy

allison.odell@yara.com

Apply no later than

February 22, 2023

Knowledge grows through differences

Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive work environment is not only the right thing, but also the smart thing to do. To deliver on this, Yara has firmly anchored Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) in our business strategy and has more than 400 employees worldwide involved in D&I ambassadors networks

title: Data Analyst
description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: Manchester City Centre

Salary: £25,000 - £40,000

A fantastic opportunity to join my client, an asset management leader, as a Data Analyst has presented itself. If you're a Data Analyst with experience in the financial sector, this could certainly be the opportunity for you! If you're interested in a great salary, a fantastic office view of the city, and bi-weekly lunches with the rest of the Insights & Analytics department, then apply today!

Responsibilities:
• Collect and analyse large sets of financial data to identify trends and patterns.
• Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights.
• Present findings to senior stakeholders, both internal and external, and make recommendations based on the analysis.
• Keep updated on industry trends and regulatory requirements.

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in a relevant field - Finance, Economics, Mathematics etc.
• 1+ year of experience as a Data Analyst - experience in... finance is desirable but is not essential for this position.
• High level of proficiency in SQL.
• Expert user of MS Excel.
• Strong experience with data visualisation tools (PowerBI, Tableau).
• Excellent communication skills with previous experience presenting to stakeholders.

My client is offering a competitive salary and benefits package alongside brilliant opportunities for growth and advancement within the company. If you have a passion for data analysis and believe that you could add value to the team and make a positive impact in the industry, then apply today for immediate consideration!

If this company sounds like a great fit for you, please APPLY and get in touch immediately with Will on or email will co . uk to discuss interview availability.

Established in Didsbury, ITECCO has grown to become one of the UK's most successful and fastest growing IT recruitment companies in the UK

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced and enthusiastic Senior Data Analyst to join our amazing team in London or Leeds. You will work directly within our client teams and will play a high visibility role with our amazing high-profile clients. This will require a commercial mindset and full understanding of various data sources and processes to promote data usage effectiveness.

We’re looking for someone who can advance and direct effective data analytics while considering current and forthcoming technology, processes and data across the business and industry. You will need to input and customise marketing effectiveness models as well as create regular client insight reports using our innovative proprietary technology suite, ARMalytics®

How You’ll Make An Impact

You will come in and hit the ground running. Demonstrating your strong technical skillset, sharing knowledge and upskilling members within the team.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will demonstrate strong... technical skills whilst making it digestible for stakeholders both internally and externally. This will involve piecing together information and analyses through excellent storytelling, pulling out actionable recommendations and insight. There will be an active push to build relationships with senior agency stakeholders to understand client objectives and ensuring that scope aligns accordingly. There is a fantastic opportunity to share your knowledge both technical and non-technical especially with our wider client facing business units in London, Leeds and Amsterdam.

The role also requires and provides a strong link with our data science hub through research and development projects which will provide an opportunity for skill and career growth.

Why join ARM?

Want to work for the fastest growing performance marketing agency in the UK? Want to work with one of the most influential boards in the UK advertising industry?

All Response Media is the 14th largest marketing agency in the UK. We manage over £250M of ad spend across TV, Digital and Offline in the UK and over £100M across the EU. We provide you with the chance to work across industry-leading clients like Adobe, Norton, Brooks Running and Omaze, as well as high-growth potential start-ups.

Building relationships is what we’re all about. Many of our people started in entry level roles, accelerating through the business into more senior positions, including becoming Board Directors. We strongly believe in promoting from within ARM, giving you the support, ownership and responsibility to fast track your career!

At ARM, we give our people a clear road map for your future progression and development as well as the training and support required to achieve your goals and aspirations. Come and join us and you’ll benefit from being mentored by our amazing Board and you’ll be given opportunities to work closely with Business Owners, Founders and Entrepreneurs in the industry.

We strongly encourage integration across all disciplines including Digital, Data, Systems and Offline. This means we are flexible with our people and there will be opportunities to evolve your role and place within the business to suit your skillset and career goals.

What will be the main focus of the role?
• Analysing the effectiveness of marketing campaigns across all media channels, from TV to digital video, social, search, radio, print, out of home and others
• Communicating to clients regarding data ingestion, automation, and reporting
• Regular access to and involvement with clients with respect to existing and new data science and attribution initiatives
• In depth client data, process and business analysis and understanding towards producing advanced insights
• Assisting in the interpretation of statistical models and helping to build stories with data and model outputs
• Help to increase the understanding of statistical models for a non-technical audience
• Identifying and analysing issues around attribution and modelling
• Working directly with wider client team with advanced data queries
• Help to improve data literacy within client teams
• Continuously exploring ways to provide All Response Media with a competitive advantage
• Planning and presenting innovative ideas to ensure ARM evolves
• Working alongside other seniors to develop a better all-inclusive full-user-path advertisement response analysis across all and multiple media channels
• Assisting analytics automation inside and outside our proprietary operational system
• Promoting the democratisation of data through our agency business through engagement with and training for all key client-facing and internal departments
• Ensuring repetitive tasks are automated and refined where possible
• Considering data privacy and security to protect company and client data

Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree (master’s preferred) in Statistics, Econometrics, Data Science, or any other related field
• Proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint
• Strong programming knowledge: MS SQL, and R or Python Experience in research and data analyst position (3 years) preferably in Media
• Experienced in statistical and econometric modelling in a commercial environment
• Performing data mining and auditing techniques
• Quantitative and data interpretation skills
• Strong verbal and written communication skills including translating results to a non-technical audience
• Exceptional attention to detail
• Creative and innovative problem-solving skills
• Strong prioritisation and time management skills
• Proactive, self-motivated, and curious commercial mindset
• Works well under pressure and achieve results within scheduled timeframe

Benefits
• Competitive salary and bonus
• 25 days annual leave + bank holidays
• Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
• Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
• Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
• Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
• Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
• Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
• Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
• Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
• Media, technical and managerial training and qualifications, including through the IPA and LinkedIn Learning

Progression and development Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Re

title: Data Analyst - Modeller
description:
Does the world of data inspire you?

Do you want to develop new skills, contributing to a wide variety of projects in an environment that values technical excellence and collaborative working?

We believe that every dataset tells a story and we're looking for data enthusiasts with experience in data analysis and visualisation to join our rapidly expanding Data and AI practice.

About Us

We're an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen's Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy... working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!

About the Role

In Data at BJSS you'll join multi-disciplinary teams of some of the brightest and best in the industry. You'll work in a fast moving, agile environment building data models and ontologies, and analysing and profiling datasets. You'll design ETL processes and services and create powerful dashboards to bring data insights to life.

You'll help us deliver some of the most exciting digital programmes around, for clients in a range of industries by:
• Applying cross-disciplinary thinking and working collaboratively with other members of your team
• Building a deep understanding of business domain and user needs and ensuring business value is unlocked as early as possible
• Thinking holistically and treating data as a business service
• Designing BI as centre of excellence for business data

About You

We're looking for people who will go an extra mile to understand our clients' strategic and operational challenges and help us to design and deliver innovative solutions.

You'll have worked with:
• ETL tools or have experience profiling and cleaning the data. Preferably with Pandas or SQL
• Data visualisation tools. Primarily Power BI, Tableau or Qlik
• DB model design tools, like Erwin, and know different modelling techniques (Kimball, Inmon, )
• Experience with AWS or Azure would be helpful.

Above all you'll be passionate about unlocking the power of data to deliver business value.

Some of the Perks
• Flexible benefits allowance - you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
• Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
• Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
• 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
• Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
• Discounts - we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
• An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
• Flexible holiday buy/sell option
• Electric vehicle scheme
• Training opportunities and incentives - we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
• Giving back - the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
• You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
• We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join- quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
• GymFlex gym membership programme

Please note: any applicants must be able to gain valid SC clearance.

BJSS is committed to equal opportunities and diversity so we want to ensure that our recruitment and selection processes are fair to all who wish to apply.

We encourage you to feel confident to let us know if you require any adjustments to be made to the application or interview process to help support you. You can do this by speaking to your BJSS recruitment contact

title: Data Analyst - Home Delivery Service
description:

Function: Customer Engagement
Location: Nottingham/Hybrid

Closing Date: Friday 17^th Feb 2023

We have an exciting opportunity within NHS Supply Chain for a Data Analyst to join our Customer Engagement team. The purpose of this role is to support to enable efficient processes for implementing and managing Home Delivery customers. To develop strong working relationships with customers and support them with Home Delivery system and data queries. title: Data Analyst/ Senior Data Analyst (Statistics/Python/BI...
description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Overview:

The Agoda Content department is currently looking for a curious and questioning self-starter and proactive analyst, who will help drive decision making with insights from content, marketing and partner performance data.

You will get the opportunity to own analytical projects to direct our department’s focus, and prioritize our actions. By joining Agoda, you will become part of a truly international team, with leading experts of different backgrounds coming from 50... countries around the world. This is a genuine opportunity to gain valuable experience in a challenging and cutting-edge tech environment. The ideal candidate would have a passion for high-converting content, great user-experience, data and analysis tools and methods. This position reports to the Associate Director of Content Operations, in Bangkok, Thailand.

Main responsibilities:
• Understand Content goals and KPIs and be able to align reports and insights based on them. Identify and investigate trends, anomalies and opportunities to improve Agoda’s Content strategy
• Identify content opportunities that drive customer value, bookings and conversion
• Help build business cases around the opportunity and get buy-in from stakeholders
• Ensure appropriate data/tools/dashboards to measure execution and enable deeper analysis
• Track execution and report up in regular updates
• Work with product, data/BI team and IT to create data resources and build appropriate reporting
• Work with Content team leads to understand their business needs and identify opportunities in terms of team actions prioritization and focus
• Use multiple data sources to report Content projects insights and impact; support Content tests and experiments
• Encourage and train the Content team in best practice use of Agoda data, analysis techniques and interpretation
• Coordinate with other Cross Functional departments like Analytics, Partner Services, and Product Owners
• Use Web-Analytics for Research and Analysis

Requirements:
• Bachelor degree or higher
• 2+ years of relevant experience
• Experience / knowledge in statistics, SQL, Python/R, Tableau and advanced Excel – required
• Ability to demonstrate data manipulation using data warehouse and create meaningful insight and visualization
• Experience / knowledge in Vertica and / or Impala – advantage
• Experience in generating data and / or preparing experiments for product development – advantage

Professional characteristics:
• Attentive to detail and committed to data integrity
• Keen and curious nature; able and willing to share your opinion
• Organized; able to manage multiple, competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines
• Able to communicate effectively; fluent in English – both spoken and written

title: Data Analyst - 3053
description:
Job Title: Data Analyst, Academic

Salary: £23,000 - £29,000

Contract: Fixed Term 12 months

Location: Cambridge

We are Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a world-leading academic publisher and assessment organisation, and a proud part of the University of Cambridge.

There has never been a better time to work with Cambridge University Press & Assessment. Our global business is developing at pace have a fixed term contract for an experienced Data Analyst to join our friendly and dynamic Business Analysis & Systems Team.

Our mission is to contribute to society through the pursuit of education, learning, and research at the highest international levels of excellence. Which is why every year, we give vital support to millions of people in more than 170 countries around the world. From teachers and learners to researchers and academics, we help to build confidence, unlock potential, and enable success. We give people the opportunity to show what they've learnt, we spread... knowledge, spark enquiry, and aid understanding.

We achieve this by embracing change, and continuously focusing on our customers' needs. And by collaborating, and carefully listening to our customers and to each other, we keep moving forward, keep innovating, and keep finding newer and better ways of doing things.

The Role

The Business Analysis and Systems team work with a range of project teams and initiatives collecting and managing data to help inform business decisions and processes. In this role the Data Analyst will be working predominantly in the Open Research area of Academic to support business transformation activities. This is a fixed term role to provide support to the team who are undertaking several large data projects. The role will undertake data cleansing, data manipulation and analytics where needed. It is expected that the person will support several strategic projects throughout the year working under the direction of the Business Analysis and Systems team managers as appropriate

Key responsibilities:

To assist across the Academic product group with all data analysis activities relating to strategic projects ensuring that maximum business value is extracted from all our data sources. In particular, this role will:
• Support the work of data migration and transformation activities for new systems deployments
• Work on large scale projects to collect and transform data from a range of sources including data cataloguing and normalisation.
• Be deployed flexibly across a range of portfolio projects and strategic initiatives as the business has need.
• Support Strategy Analyst in devising long term data analytics capabilities for Board level decision making.

About You

Principle Skills:
• The successful candidate will be educated to degree level or equivalent ideally in a Business Administration or Data Science area.
• Experience using Power BI tools is essential and experience of Python or other programming languages would be an advantage.
• Experience of engaging with a wide range of stakeholders and in working independently with small teams would be an advantage.
• Experience in data cleansing and migration practices and large scale data normalisation tasks would be essential.
• Ability to work independently and deliver to tight timelines.
• Good written and verbal communication skills are also essential as the postholder will be engaging with business stakeholders regularly to explain and disseminate data.

Benefits

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive package of benefits to help with your life both inside and outside of work:
• Generous contributory pension
• 28 days annual leave, plus bank holidays
• Annual performance related bonus and increases (discretionary)
• Employee discount and cash back scheme at 2,500 retailers
• Cycle scheme
• Season Ticket Loan
• Subsidised staff restaurants
• Support for professional qualifications
• Discounted access to the University of Cambridge Sport Centre, along with various other local gyms.

The key to our work is our colleagues, whose shared commitment enables us to have an ever-greater impact. We are a united, vibrant, and respectful global community of people, and we ensure that every individual is recognised, listened to, and cared for. And because our impact is amplified when our people are empowered, we give everyone the opportunity to develop in their own way. Whether you want a career that's linear, or want to follow your own path, we'll support you, and help give you the resources and training you'll need to be bold and take ownership of what you do.

The closing date for application is 21st February, with interviews to take place shortly after the campaign closes to start as soon as possible

Cambridge University Press & Assessment is committed to being a place where anyone can enjoy a successful career, where it's safe to speak up, and where we learn continuously to improve together. We welcome applications from all candidates, regardless of demographic characteristics (age, disability, educational attainment, ethnicity, gender, marital status, neurodiversity, religion, sex, and sexual identity), cultural, or social class/background.

We believe that diversity of thought, background, and approach create better outcomes. More importantly, fostering an inclusive culture is the right thing to do, and it's part of how we achieve our purpose: to contribute to society through the pursuit of education, learning and research at the highest international levels of excellence. Ensuring that anyone, no matter who they are, feels they belong here is an essential part of who we are and the contribution we make to society, and to our planet.

To enable an environment which our people can thrive in, our customers benefit from, and where work complements life, we empower everyone to manage their time and capacity, and to prioritise their wellbeing. That's why from day one everyone at Cambridge University Press & Assessment can discuss flexible working options to find the best solution for them and their role

title: Investment Data Analyst - Opportunity for 2023 within Investment...
description:
Our client, a highly successful and rapidly expanding investment management organisation, are looking to hire a Financial Data Analyst. If you work within financial business intelligence and you’re looking to leap forward in your career, this could be the opportunity for you.

You’ll play a key role within the company, working to build an Azure data warehouse and produce dashboards/reports for stakeholder consumption

Salary: £40,000 to £45,000 pa, DOE

Office in central Brighton - Hybrid Working

Must have the right to work in the UK without sponsorship

You’ll be responsible for standardising, analysing and presenting varied data from a wide range of sources. You’ll need to be able to understand data trends and patterns within complex data sets in order to identify issues and make suggestions as to how these issues can be rectified. There are ample opportunities for progression within this role; in five years’ time, you could be managing a team.

Key Responsibilities:
• Centralising... and standardising a broad array of data.
• Maintaining systems and evaluating processes in order to facilitate improvement.
• Identifying, interpreting and understanding complex data trends and patterns.
• Assessing data quality and integrity.
• Creating and updating dashboards and reports for stakeholders.

What we’re looking for:

The ideal candidate for this role will be highly communicative and self-motivated, as well as having a strong desire to develop their skills.

Key Experience:
• A Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics and/or a Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance or Business.
• Proficient in using Excel/VBA, SQL/SSRS and R/Python.
• Experience working with cloud technologies - Ideally Microsoft Azure.
• Experience working with BI reporting tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
• Experience working with ETL frameworks.
• Experience working with financial / accounting / private market data.
• A good knowledge of financial and investment performance concepts

This is an exceptional opportunity to jump ahead in your career and improve your future. If you’re looking to take the next step in your path to success, please apply or contact Elliot at Red Robin Recruitment for more information.

Please note that we are acting as a recruitment agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Market Data Analyst
description:
We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.

About The Unit

The Continental Europe business unit is one of three commercial business units in Yara Europe Region together with BU Nordics and BU South. BU Continental is comprised of the commercial teams - agronomy, marketing, and sales - of several major European markets, including UK and Ireland, France, Germany and Benelux, Poland, Czech Republic, Romania, and Ukraine. At the BU level are roles working across these markets, supporting business development of core fertilizer products as well as digital agronomic tools and services to customers in these markets.

The Market Data Analyst role is responsible for analyzing user data from our digital tools and services to provide meaningful insights which enable effective, data-driven decision making for the markets within the business unit and... the business unit overall. This position will support the local commercial teams to understand and interpret data from various tools including Atfarm, N-Tester, N-Sensor, Megalab, Yara Premium Program, Salesforce, and Request for Quote. This analysis will be used to implement actions for improving growth, engagement, and retention of customers and product, and service development opportunities of our digital solutions, in line with our strategic ambitions.

The Market Data Analyst will report to the Marketing & Agronomy Director and act as a trusted advisor to the local teams and as a liaison towards other units within the regional and global organization when it comes to use of relevant data for marketing, commercialization, development, and continuous improvement of our digital solutions.

Responsibilities
• Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations on acquisition, retention, and activation to support implementation and market development of Yara's digital offering
• Guide and facilitate discussions concerning identification of opportunities for growth, activation, and churn reduction through data-driven analysis and insights and contribute to marketing strategies
• Analyze data and provide insights to support product development and improved user experience of our digital tools and services
• Dive into behavioral data to support markets in understanding the user-base and, together with the local commercial teams, determine how to optimize marketing, user journey, and user experience of the digital tools
• Improve existing dashboards and develop new dashboards or information-sharing tools to make data more accessible and understood by relevant stakeholders; prepare and present recommendations, reports, and findings using relevant visualizations
• Oversee KPIs, establish a dynamic reporting cycle, based on which decide on and implement responsive actions
• Map and structure data from existing sources, for example Atfarm, Premium Program, RFQ, to create integrated 360° views of customers to support customer-centricity across our portfolio of products, tools, and services

Profile
• At least Bachelor degree in business analytics, data science, marketing, user experience, agribusiness, statistics or any other related field
• Minimum 5 years of experience in market data analyses and growth and engagement; experience in the agricultural industry - an advantage
• Experience participating in strategic discussions, interpreting and integrating data from various sources and clearly communicating the findings from analyses to a diverse collection of stakeholders to drive and support decision-making
• Excellent data analysis skills with strong business acumen and understanding of how data insight can meet business needs and contribute value
• Experience increasing retention and engagement, managing churn, translating insight into improvements and implementing feature adoption strategies
• Proactive, resourceful and experienced working in a complex matrix organization with excellent collaboration, listening and communication skills
• Experience with digital marketing and other user-data oriented products
• Good understanding of Yara's business in Europe, its strategy and change agenda - an advantage

Additional Information
• Periodical visits to the local markets throughout the year for workshops are expected
• Operational language - English, knowledge of any other language spoken in the Continental Europe markets (i.e., French, German etc). is an advantage
• The location for this role can be any Yara site relevant to Continental Europe markets

Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply.

Contact details

Rūta Povilaitytė

Senior HR Advisor

ruta.povilaityte@yara com

Allison O'Dell

Director, Marketing & Agronomy

allison.odell@yara.com

Apply no later than

February 22, 2023

Knowledge grows through differences

Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive work environment is not only the right thing, but also the smart thing to do. To deliver on this, Yara has firmly anchored Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) in our business strategy and has more than 400 employees worldwide involved in D&I ambassadors networks

About QA:
QA is the UK’s leading tech training and talent solutions organisation. We provide a comprehensive suite of services to help individuals and companies be winners in the digital revolution. About the Position:
You will contribute to the successful delivery of business change by:work with systems architects and transformation colleagues, analyse system data to support the creation and maintenance of controlled Master Data for key data assets.work with the... Business Insights team, provide analysis and dashboards to drive improved accuracy and quality of data across a wide range of business systems, making recommendations for process or other business-related improvements.demonstrable improvement to QA Group business and IT systems driven by excellent data analysis and modelling.understand the technical and practical constraints around data lifecycles and migration, providing support and expertise to a range of projects.support the development and enhancement of system architecture, data structures and processes.

About You:Demonstrated ability to understand and analyse complex business processes and technologies to make sound recommendations to non-technical individuals.Knowledge of a range of analysis and modelling techniques, for example: modelling current and desired future scenarios, information flows and data structures.Ideally you will have an understanding of Cloud services (such as AWS and Azure), database design and data management through SQLExperience of working closely with Business Insight teams understanding the reporting requirements of the proposed business changeExperience working with databases and Data Warehouses

What We'll Do For You!

You may have noticed we’ve not stated the salary for this position. We’re currently working on creating more transparent salary bands across QA, so rest assured, our salaries are competitive and will be discussed as part of the recruitment process.
